7 As they were increased, so they sinned against me: therefore will I change their glory into shame.Hosea 4:7
Stats
Rank: #4782 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 98 characters, 15 words, 79 letters, 31 vowels, 48 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כְּרֻבָּ֖ם כֵּ֣ן חָֽטְאוּ־לִ֑י כְּבֹודָ֖ם בְּקָלֹ֥ון אָמִֽיר׃

Lit: The more they increased so the more they sinned against Me their glory into shame I will change

KJV: As they were increased, so they sinned against me: therefore will I change their glory into shame.
References

"they were"
Ho 4:10: For they will eat: not and have enough: they will commit whoredom: and will not increase: because they have left off to take heed to the LORD.
Ho 5:1: Hear you this: O priests; and listen: you house of Israel; and give you ear: O house of the king; for judgment is toward you: because you have been a snare on Mizpah: and a net spread upon Tabor.
Ho 6:9: As troops of robbers wait for a man: so the company of priests murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.
Ho 13:6: 14: According to their pasture: so were they filled; they were filled: and their heart was exalted; therefore have they forgotten me.
Ezr 9:7: Since the days of our fathers have we been in a great trespass to this day; and for our iniquities have we: our kings: and our priests: been delivered into the hand of the kings of the lands: to the sword: to captivity: and to a spoil: and to confusion of face: as it is this day.

"therefore"
1Sa 2:30: For what reason the LORD God of Israel says: I said indeed that your house: and the house of your father: should walk before me for ever: but now the LORD says: Be it far from me; for them that honour me I will honour: and they that despise me will be lightly esteemed.
Jer 2:26: 27: As the thief is ashamed when he is found: so is the house of Israel ashamed; they: their kings: their princes: and their priests: and their prophets:
Mal 2:9: Therefore have I also made you contemptible and base before all the people: according as you not have kept my ways: but have been partial in the law.
Php 3:19: Whose end is destruction: whose God is their belly: and whose glory is in their shame: who mind earthly things.)

8 They eat up the sin of my people, and they set their heart on their iniquity.Hosea 4:8
Stats
Rank: #4989 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 77 characters, 15 words, 60 letters, 24 vowels, 36 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: חַטַּ֥את עַמִּ֖י יֹאכֵ֑לוּ וְאֶל־עֲוֹנָ֖ם יִשְׂא֥וּ נַפְשֹֽׁו׃

Lit: The sin of My people they eat up and on their iniquity they set their heart

KJV: They eat up the sin of my people, and they set their heart on their iniquity.
References

"eat"
Le 6:26: The priest that offers it for sin will eat it: in the holy place will it be eaten: in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation.
Le 7:6: 7: Every male among the priests will eat thereof: it will be eaten in the holy place: it is most holy.

"set their heart on their iniquity"
1Sa 2:29: For what reason kick you at my sacrifice and at my offering: which I have commanded in my habitation; and honour your sons above me: to make yourselves fat with the chief of all the offerings of Israel my people?
Ps 24:4: He who has clean hands: and a pure heart; who has not lifted up his soul to vanity: nor sworn deceitfully.
Ps 25:1: A Psalm of David.>> To you: O LORD: do I lift up my soul.
Isa 56:11: Yes: they are greedy dogs which can never have enough: and they are shepherds that cannot understand: they all look to their own way: every one for his gain: from his quarter.
Eze 14:3: 7: Son of man: these men have set up their idols in their heart: and put the stumblingblock of their iniquity before their face: should I be inquired of at all by them?
Mic 3:11: The heads thereof judge for reward: and the priests thereof teach for hire: and the prophets thereof divine for money: yet will they lean upon the LORD: and say: Is not the LORD among us? none evil can come upon us.
Mal 1:10: Who is there even among you that would shut the doors for nought? neither do you kindle fire on my altar for nought. I have no pleasure in you: says the LORD of hosts: neither will I accept an offering at your hand.
Ro 16:18: For they that are such not serve our Lord Jesus Christ: but their own belly; and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.
Tit 1:11: Whose mouths must be stopped: who subvert whole houses: teaching things which they not ought: for filthy lucre's sake.
2Pe 2:3: Through covetousness will they with feigned words make merchandise of you: whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not: and their damnation slumbers not.

H3548 כֹּהֵן kôhên ko-hane active participle of כָּהַן; literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman); chief ruler, idiom own, priest, prince, principal officer. 		כַּכֹּהֵ֑ןkak-kō-hên; like priest Prep-k, Art | N-ms

9 There will be, like people, like priest: and I will punish them for their ways, and reward them their doings.Hosea 4:9
Stats
Rank: #6084 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 114 characters, 17 words, 89 letters, 32 vowels, 57 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה כָעָ֖ם כַּכֹּהֵ֑ן וּפָקַדְתִּ֤י עָלָיו֙ דְּרָכָ֔יו וּמַעֲלָלָ֖יו אָשִׁ֥יב לֹֽו׃

Lit: And it shall be like people like priest so I will punish them for their ways and for their deeds reward them

KJV: And there shall be, like people, like priest: and I will punish them for their ways, and reward them their doings.
References

"like people"
Isa 9:14-16: Therefore the LORD will cut off from Israel head and tail: branch and rush: in one day.
Isa 24:2: It will be: as with the people: so with the priest; as with the servant: so with his master; as with the maid: so with her mistress; as with the buyer: so with the seller; as with the lender: so with the borrower; as with the taker of usury: so with the giver of usury to him.
Jer 5:31: The prophets prophesy falsely: and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love to have it so: and what will you do in the end thereof?
Jer 8:10-12: Therefore will I give their wives to others: and their fields to them that will inherit them: for every one from the least even to the great is given to covetousness: from the prophet even to the priest every one deals falsely.
Jer 23:11: 12: For both prophet and priest are profane; yes: in my house have I found their wickedness: says the LORD.
Eze 22:26-31: Her priests have violated my law: and have profaned my holy things: they have put no difference between the holy and profane: neither have they showed difference between the unclean and the clean: and have hid their eyes from my sabbaths: and I am profaned among them.
Mt 15:14: Let them alone: they be blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind: both will fall into the ditch.

"punish"
Ho 1:4: The LORD said to Him: Call His name Jezreel; for yet a little while: and I will avenge the blood of Jezreel upon the house of Jehu: and will cause to cease the kingdom of the house of Israel.

"reward them"
Ps 109:17: 18: As he loved cursing: so let it come to him: as he not delighted in blessing: so let it be far from him.
Pr 5:22: His own iniquities will take the wicked himself: and he will be holden with the cords of his sins.
Isa 3:10: Say you to the righteous: that it will be well with him: for they will eat the fruit of their doings.
Zec 1:6: But my words and my statutes: which I commanded my servants the prophets: did not they take hold of your fathers? and they returned and said: Like as the LORD of hosts thought to do to us: according to our ways: and according to our doings: so has He dealt with us.

10 For they will eat, not and have enough: they will commit whoredom, and will not increase: because they have left off to take heed to the LORD.Hosea 4:10
Stats
Rank: #7306 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 145 characters, 23 words, 114 letters, 43 vowels, 71 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאָֽכְלוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א יִשְׂבָּ֔עוּ הִזְנ֖וּ וְלֹ֣א יִפְרֹ֑צוּ כִּֽי־אֶת־יְהוָ֥ה עָזְב֖וּ לִשְׁמֹֽר׃

Lit: For they shall eat but not have enough they shall commit harlotry but not increase because Yahweh they have ceased obeying

KJV: For they shall eat, and not have enough: they shall commit whoredom, and shall not increase: because they have left off to take heed to the LORD.
References

"they shall eat"
Le 26:26: And when I have broken the staff of your bread: 10 women will bake your bread in one oven: and they will deliver you your bread again by weight: and you will eat: not and be satisfied.
Pr 13:25: The righteous eats to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked will want.
Isa 65:13-16: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Look: my servants will eat: but you will be hungry: look: my servants will drink: but you will be thirsty: look: my servants will rejoice: but you will be ashamed:
Mic 6:14: You will eat: not but be satisfied; and your casting down will be in the middle of you; and you will take hold: but will not deliver; and that which you deliver will I give up to the sword.
Hag 1:6: You have sown much: and bring in little; you eat: but you not have enough; you drink: but you not are filled with drink; you clothe you: but there is none warm; and he who ears'>ears wages ears'>ears wages to put it into a bag with holes.
Mal 2:1-3: Now: O you priests: this commandment is for you.

"they shall commit"
Ho 4:14: I not will punish your daughters when they commit whoredom: nor your spouses when they commit adultery: for themselves are separated with whores: and they sacrifice with harlots: therefore the people that does not understand will fall.
Ho 9:11-17: As for Ephraim: their glory will fly away like a bird: from the birth: and from the womb: and from the conception.

"left"
2Ch 24:17: Now after the death of Jehoiada came the princes of Judah: and made obeisance to the king. Then the king listened to them.
Ps 36:3: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he has left off to be wise: and to do good.
Ps 125:5: As for such as turn aside to their crooked ways: the LORD will lead them forth with the workers of iniquity: but peace will be upon Israel.
Jer 34:15: you were now turned: and had done right in my sight: in proclaiming liberty every man to his neighbour; and you had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name:
Eze 18:24: But when the righteous turns away from his righteousness: and commits iniquity: and does'>does according to all the abominations that the wicked man does'>does: will he live? All his righteousness that he has done will not be mentioned: in his trespass that he has trespassed: and in his sin that he has sinned: in them will he die.
Zep 1:6: Them that are turned back from the LORD; and those that not have sought the LORD: nor inquired for Him.
2Pe 2:20-22: For if after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ: they are again entangled therein: and overcome: the latter end is worse with them than the beginning.

11 Whoredom and wine and new wine take away the heart.Hosea 4:11
Stats
Rank: #6402 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 51 characters, 10 words, 41 letters, 17 vowels, 24 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: זְנ֛וּת וְיַ֥יִן וְתִירֹ֖ושׁ יִֽקַּֽח־לֵֽב׃

Lit: Harlotry and wine and new wine enslave the heart

KJV: Whoredom and wine and new wine take away the heart.
References

"take"
Ho 4:12: My people ask counsel at their stocks: and their staff declares to them: for the spirit of whoredoms has caused them to err: and they have gone a whoring from under their God.
Pr 6:32: But whoever commits adultery with a woman lacks understanding: he that does it destroyeth his own soul.
Pr 20:1: Wine is a mocker: strong drink is raging: and whoever is deceived thereby not is wise.
Pr 23:27-35: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.
Ec 7:7: Surely oppression makes a wise man mad; and a gift destroyeth the heart.
Isa 5:12: The harp: and the viol: the tabret: and pipe: and wine: are in their feasts: but they not regard the work of the LORD: neither consider the operation of His hands.
Isa 28:7: But they also have erred through wine: and through strong drink are out of the way; the priest and the prophet have erred through strong drink: they are swallowed up of wine: they are out of the way through strong drink; they err in vision: they stumble in judgment.
Lu 21:34: Take heed to yourselves: lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting: and drunkenness: and cares of this life: and so that day come upon you unawares.
Ro 13:11-14: That: knowing the time: that now it is high time to awake out of sleep: for now is our salvation nearer than when we believed.

H3588כִּ֣יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֣יkî for Conj
H7307ר֤וּחַrū-aḥ   (N-csc)
H7307 רוּחַ rûwach roo-akh from רוּחַ; wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions); air, anger, blast, breath, idiom cool, courage, mind, idiom quarter, idiom side, spirit(-ual), tempest, idiom vain, (whirl-) wind(-y). 		ר֤וּחַrū-aḥ the spirit N-csc

H8582הִתְעָ֔הhiṯ-‘āh,   (V-Hifil-Perf-3ms)
H8582 תָּעָה tâʻâh taw-aw a primitive root; to vacillate, i.e. reel or stray (literally or figuratively); also causative of both; (cause to) go astray, deceive, dissemble, (cause to, make to) err, pant, seduce, (make to) stagger, (cause to) wander, be out of the way. 		הִתְעָ֔הhiṯ-‘āh, has caused them to stray V-Hifil-Perf-3ms
H2181וַיִּזְנ֖וּway-yiz-nū   (Conj-w | V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3mp)
H2181 זָנָה zânâh zaw-naw a primitive root (highly-fed and therefore wanton); to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah); (cause to) commit fornication, idiom continually, idiom great, (be an, play the) harlot, (cause to be, play the) whore, (commit, fall to) whoredom, (cause to) go a-whoring, whorish. 		וַיִּזְנ֖וּway-yiz-nū and they have played the harlot Conj-w | V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3mp

H8478 תַּחַת tachath takh-ath from the same as תּוֹחַ; the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.; as, beneath, idiom flat, in(-stead), (same) place (where...is), room, for...sake, stead of, under, idiom unto, idiom when...was mine, whereas, (where-) fore, with. 		מִתַּ֥חַתmit-ta-ḥaṯ against Prep-m
H430אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃’ĕ-lō-hê-hem.   (N-mpc | 3mp)
H430 אֱלֹהִים ʼĕlôhîym el-o-heem plural of אֱלוֹהַּ; gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative; angels, idiom exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), idiom (very) great, judges, idiom mighty. 		אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃’ĕ-lō-hê-hem. their God N-mpc | 3mp
12 My people ask counsel at their stocks, and their staff declares to them: for the spirit of whoredoms has caused them to err, and they have gone a whoring from under their God.Hosea 4:12
Stats
Rank: #7859 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 179 characters, 30 words, 143 letters, 51 vowels, 92 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עַמִּי֙ בְּעֵצֹ֣ו יִשְׁאָ֔ל וּמַקְלֹ֖ו יַגִּ֣יד לֹ֑ו כִּ֣י ר֤וּחַ זְנוּנִים֙ הִתְעָ֔ה וַיִּזְנ֖וּ מִתַּ֥חַת אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃

Lit: My people from their wooden idols ask counsel and their staff informs them for the spirit of harlotry has caused them to stray and they have played the harlot against their God

KJV: My people ask counsel at their stocks, and their staff declareth unto them: for the spirit of whoredoms hath caused them to err, and they have gone a whoring from under their God.
References

"ask"
Jer 2:27: Saying to a stock: You are my father; and to a stone: You have brought me forth: for they have turned their back to me: not and their face: but in the time of their trouble they will say: Arise: and save us.
Jer 10:8: But they are altogether brutish and foolish: the stock is a doctrine of vanities.
Eze 21:21: For the king of Babylon stood at the parting of the way: at the head of the two ways: to use divination: he made his arrows bright: he consulted with images: he looked in the liver.
Hab 2:19: Woe to him that says to the wood: Awake; to the dumb stone: Arise: it will teach! Look: it is laid over with gold and silver: and there is no breath at all in the middle of it.

"for"
Ho 5:4: They not will frame their doings to turn to their God: for the spirit of whoredoms is in the middle of them: and they not have known the LORD.
Isa 44:18-20: They not have known nor understood: for he has shut their eyes: that they cannot see; and their hearts: that they cannot understand.
Mic 2:11: If a man walking in the spirit and falsehood do lie: saying: I will prophesy to you of wine and of strong drink; he will even be the prophet of this people.
2Th 2:9-11: Even him: whose coming is after the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders:

"gone"
Ho 9:1: not Rejoice: O Israel: for joy: as other people: for you have gone a whoring from your God: you have loved a reward upon every cornfloor.
Le 17:7: They will no more offer their sacrifices to devils: after whom they have gone a whoring. This will be a statute for ever to them throughout their generations.
Le 20:5: Then I will set my face against that man: and against his family: and will cut him off: and all that go a whoring after him: to commit whoredom with Molech: from among their people.
Nu 15:39: It will be to you for a fringe: that you may look upon it: and remember all the commandments of the LORD: and do them; and that you not seek after your own heart and your own eyes: after which you use to go a whoring:
De 31:16: The LORD said to Moses: Look: you will sleep with your fathers; and this people will rise up: and go a whoring after the gods of the strangers of the land: whither they go to be among them: and will forsake me: and break my covenant which I have made with them.
2Ch 21:13: But have walked in the way of the kings of Israel: and have made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to go a whoring: like to the whoredoms of the house of Ahab: and also have killed your brothers of your father's house: which were better than yourself:
Ps 73:27: For: indeed: they that are far from you will perish: you have destroyed all them that go a whoring from you.
Jer 3:1-3: They say: If a man put away His wife: and she go from Him: and become another man's: will He return to her again? will not that land be greatly polluted? but you have played the harlot with many lovers; yet return again to me: says the LORD.
Eze 16:1-63: Again the word of the LORD came to me: saying:
Eze 23:1-49: The word of the LORD came again to me: saying:

עַל־רָאשֵׁ֨י הֶהָרִ֜ים יְזַבֵּ֗חוּ וְעַל־הַגְּבָעֹות֙ יְקַטֵּ֔רוּ תַּ֣חַת אַלֹּ֧ון וְלִבְנֶ֛ה וְאֵלָ֖ה כִּ֣י טֹ֣וב צִלָּ֑הּ עַל־כֵּ֗ן תִּזְנֶ֙ינָה֙ בְּנֹ֣ותֵיכֶ֔ם וְכַלֹּותֵיכֶ֖ם תְּנָאַֽפְנָה׃

13 They sacrifice upon the tops of the mountains, and burn incense upon the hills, under oaks and poplars and elms, because the shadow thereof is good: therefore your daughters will commit whoredom, and your spouses will commit adultery.Hosea 4:13
Stats
Rank: #6412 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 236 characters, 33 words, 193 letters, 73 vowels, 120 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עַל־רָאשֵׁ֨י הֶהָרִ֜ים יְזַבֵּ֗חוּ וְעַל־הַגְּבָעֹות֙ יְקַטֵּ֔רוּ תַּ֣חַת אַלֹּ֧ון וְלִבְנֶ֛ה וְאֵלָ֖ה כִּ֣י טֹ֣וב צִלָּ֑הּ עַל־כֵּ֗ן תִּזְנֶ֙ינָה֙ בְּנֹ֣ותֵיכֶ֔ם וְכַלֹּותֵיכֶ֖ם תְּנָאַֽפְנָה׃

Lit: On the tops the mountaintops they offer sacrifices and on the hills burn incense Under oaks and poplars and terebinths because is good Their shade upon thus commit harlotry your daughters and your brides commit adultery

KJV: They sacrifice upon the tops of the mountains, and burn incense upon the hills, under oaks and poplars and elms, because the shadow thereof is good: therefore your daughters shall commit whoredom, and your spouses shall commit adultery.
References

"sacrifice"
Isa 1:29: For they will be ashamed of the oaks which you have desired: and you will be confounded for the gardens that you have chosen.
Isa 57:5: 7: Enflaming yourselves with idols under every green tree: slaying the children in the valleys under the clifts of the rocks?
Jer 3:6: 13: The LORD said also to me in the days of Josiah the king: Have you seen that which backsliding Israel has done? she is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree: and there has played the harlot.
Eze 6:13: Then will you know that I am the LORD: when their killed men will be among their idols round about their altars: upon every high hill: in all the tops of the mountains: and under every green tree: and under every thick oak: the place where they did offer sweet savour to all their idols.
Eze 16:16: 25: Of your garments you did take: and deckedst your high places with divers colours: and playedst the harlot thereupon: the like things will not come: neither will it be so.
Eze 20:28: 29: For when I had brought them into the land: for the which I lifted up my hand to give it to them: then they saw every high hill: and all the thick trees: and they offered there their sacrifices: and there they presented the provocation of their offering: there also they made their sweet savour: and poured out there their drink offerings.

"therefore"
2Sa 12:10-12: Now therefore the sword will never depart from your house; because you have despised me: and have taken the wife of Uriah the Hittite to be your wife.
Job 31:9: 10: If my heart have been deceived by a woman: or if I have laid wait at my neighbour's door;
Am 7:17: Therefore thus says the LORD; Your wife will be an harlot in the city: and your sons and your daughters will fall by the sword: and your land will be divided by line; and you will die in a polluted land: and Israel will surely go into captivity forth of His land.
Ro 1:23-28: Changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man: and to birds: and fourfooted beasts: and creeping things.

H3808לֹֽא־lō-   (Adv-NegPrt)
H3808 לֹא lôʼ lo or לוֹא; or לֹה; (Deuteronomy 3:11), a primitive particle; not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles; idiom before, phrase or else, ere, phrase except, ig(-norant), much, less, nay, neither, never, no((-ne), -r, (-thing)), (idiom as though...,(can-), for) not (out of), of nought, otherwise, out of, phrase surely, phrase as truly as, phrase of a truth, phrase verily, for want, phrase whether, without. 		לֹֽא־lō- Not Adv-NegPrt

H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֣יkî when Conj

14 I not will punish your daughters when they commit whoredom, nor your spouses when they commit adultery: for themselves are separated with whores, and they sacrifice with harlots: therefore the people that does not understand will fall.Hosea 4:14
Stats
Rank: #7787 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 236 characters, 33 words, 195 letters, 68 vowels, 127 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לֹֽא־אֶפְקֹ֨וד עַל־בְּנֹותֵיכֶ֜ם כִּ֣י תִזְנֶ֗ינָה וְעַל־כַּלֹּֽותֵיכֶם֙ כִּ֣י תְנָאַ֔פְנָה כִּי־הֵם֙ עִם־הַזֹּנֹ֣ות יְפָרֵ֔דוּ וְעִם־הַקְּדֵשֹׁ֖ות יְזַבֵּ֑חוּ וְעָ֥ם לֹֽא־יָבִ֖ין יִלָּבֵֽט׃

Lit: Not I will punish on your daughters when they commit harlotry nor your brides when they commit adultery for they with harlots the men go apart and with a ritual harlot offer sacrifices therefore people not who do understand will be trampled

KJV: I will not punish your daughters when they commit whoredom, nor your spouses when they commit adultery: for themselves are separated with whores, and they sacrifice with harlots: therefore the people that doth not understand shall fall.
References

"punish"
Ho 4:17: Ephraim is joined to idols: let him alone.
Isa 1:5: Why should you be stricken any more? you will revolt more and more: the whole head is sick: and the whole heart faint.
Heb 12:8: But if you be without chastisement: whereof all are partakers: then are you bastards: not and sons.

"for"
1Co 6:16: What? know you not that he which is joined to an harlot is one body? for two: says he: will be one flesh.

"and they"
1Ki 14:23: 24: For they also built them high places: and images: and groves: on every high hill: and under every green tree.
1Ki 15:12: He took away the sodomites out of the land: and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.
2Ki 23:7: He brake down the houses of the sodomites: that were by the house of the LORD: where the women wove hangings for the grove.

"therefore"
Ho 4:1: 5: 6: Hear the word of the LORD: you children of Israel: for the LORD has a controversy with the inhabitants of the land: because there is no truth: nor mercy: nor knowledge of God in the land.
Ho 14:9: Who is wise: and He will understand these things? prudent: and He will know them? for the ways of the LORD are right: and the just will walk in them: but the transgressors will fall therein.
Pr 28:5: Evil men not understand judgment: but they that seek the LORD understand all things.
Isa 44:18-20: They not have known nor understood: for he has shut their eyes: that they cannot see; and their hearts: that they cannot understand.
Isa 56:11: Yes: they are greedy dogs which can never have enough: and they are shepherds that cannot understand: they all look to their own way: every one for his gain: from his quarter.
Da 12:10: Many will be purified: and made white: and tried; but the wicked will do wickedly: and none of the wicked will understand; but the wise will understand.
Joh 8:43: Why do you not understand my speech? even because you cannot hear my word.
Ro 3:11: There is none that understands: there is none that seeks after God.
Eph 4:18: Having the understanding darkened: being alienated from the life of God through the ignorance that is in them: because of the blindness of their heart:

 אִם־זֹנֶ֤ה אַתָּה֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַל־יֶאְשַׁ֖ם יְהוּדָ֑ה וְאַל־תָּבֹ֣אוּ הַגִּלְגָּ֗ל וְאַֽל־תַּעֲלוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית אָ֔וֶן וְאַל־תִּשָּׁבְע֖וּ חַי־יְהוָֽה׃

H518אִם־’im-   (Conj)
H518 אִם ʼim eem a primitive particle; used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not; (and, can-, doubtless, if, that) (not), phrase but, either, phrase except, phrase more(-over if, than), neither, nevertheless, nor, oh that, or, phrase save (only, -ing), seeing, since, sith, phrase surely (no more, none, not), though, phrase of a truth, phrase unless, phrase verily, when, whereas, whether, while, phrase yet., 		אִם־’im- Though Conj

H7650תִּשָּׁבְע֖וּtiš-šā-ḇə-‘ū   (V-Nifal-Imperf-2mp)
H7650 שָׁבַע shâbaʻ shaw-bah a primitive root; properly to be complete, but used only as a denominative from שֶׁבַע; to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times); adjure, charge (by an oath, with an oath), feed to the full (by mistake for שָׂבַע), take an oath, idiom straitly, (cause to, make to) swear., 		תִּשָּׁבְע֖וּtiš-šā-ḇə-‘ū swear an oath saying V-Nifal-Imperf-2mp
H2416חַי־ḥay-   (N-ms)
H2416 חַי chay khah-ee from חָיָה; alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively; phrase age, alive, appetite, (wild) beast, company, congregation, life(-time), live(-ly), living (creature, thing), maintenance, phrase merry, multitude, phrase (be) old, quick, raw, running, springing, troop., 		חַי־ḥay- as lives N-ms
H3069יְהוָֽה׃Yah-weh.   (N-proper-ms)
H3069 יְהֹוִה Yᵉhôvih yeh-ho-vee a variation of יְהֹוָה (used after אֲדֹנָי, and pronounced by Jews as אֱלֹהִים, in order to prevent the repetition of the same sound, since they elsewhere pronounce יְהֹוָה as אֲדֹנָי); {YHWH}; God. 		יְהוָֽה׃Yah-weh. Yahweh N-proper-ms
15 Though you, Israel, play the harlot, yet not let Judah offend; and not come you to Gilgal, neither go you up to Bethaven, nor swear, The LORD lives.Hosea 4:15
Stats
Rank: #8439 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 150 characters, 21 words, 115 letters, 44 vowels, 71 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אִם־זֹנֶ֤ה אַתָּה֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַל־יֶאְשַׁ֖ם יְהוּדָ֑ה וְאַל־תָּבֹ֣אוּ הַגִּלְגָּ֗ל וְאַֽל־תַּעֲלוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית אָ֔וֶן וְאַל־תִּשָּׁבְע֖וּ חַי־יְהוָֽה׃

Lit: Though play the harlot you Israel not let offend Judah and not do come up to Gilgal nor go up to Beth Aven nor swear an oath saying as lives Yahweh

KJV: Though thou, Israel, play the harlot, yet let not Judah offend; and come not ye unto Gilgal, neither go ye up to Bethaven, nor swear, The LORD liveth.
References

"play"
Ho 4:12: My people ask counsel at their stocks: and their staff declares to them: for the spirit of whoredoms has caused them to err: and they have gone a whoring from under their God.
Jer 3:6-10: The LORD said also to me in the days of Josiah the king: Have you seen that which backsliding Israel has done? she is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree: and there has played the harlot.
Eze 23:4-8: The names of them were Aholah the elder: and Aholibah her sister: and they were my: and they bare sons and daughters. Thus were their names; Samaria is Aholah: and Jerusalem Aholibah.

"yet"
Ho 11:12: Ephraim compasss me about with lies: and the house of Israel with deceit: but Judah yet rules with God: and is faithful with the saints.
2Ki 17:18: 19: Therefore the LORD was very angry with Israel: and removed them out of His sight: there was none left but the tribe of Judah only.
Jer 3:10: 11: Yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah has not turned to me with her whole heart: but feignedly: says the LORD.
Lu 12:47: 48: That servant: which knew his lord's will: and not prepared himself: neither did according to his will: will be beaten with many stripes.
Eph 5:11: Have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness: but rather reprove them.

"Gilgal"
Ho 9:15: All their wickedness is in Gilgal: for there I hated them: for the wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of my house: I will love them no more: all their princes are revolters.
Ho 12:11: Is there iniquity in Gilead? surely they are vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yes: their altars are as heaps in the furrows of the fields.
Am 4:4: Come to Bethel: and transgress; at Gilgal multiply transgression; and bring your sacrifices every morning: and your tithes after 3 years:
Am 5:5: But not seek Bethel: nor enter into Gilgal: and not pass to Beersheba: for Gilgal will surely go into captivity: and Bethel will come to nought.

"Beth-aven"
Ho 5:8: Blow you the cornet in Gibeah: and the trumpet in Ramah: cry aloud at Bethaven: after you: O Benjamin.
Ho 10:5: 8: The inhabitants of Samaria will fear because of the calves of Bethaven: for the people thereof will mourn over it: and the priests thereof that rejoiced on it: for the glory thereof: because it is departed from it.
1Ki 12:28: 29: Whereupon the king took counsel: and made two calves of gold: and said to them: It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem: look your gods: O Israel: which brought you up out of the land of Egypt.

"nor"
Isa 48:1: Hear you this: O house of Jacob: which are called by the name of Israel: and are come forth out of the waters of Judah: which swear by the name of the LORD: and make mention of the God of Israel: but not in truth: nor in righteousness.
Jer 5:2: Though they say: The LORD lives; surely they swear falsely.
Eze 20:39: As for you: O house of Israel: thus says the Lord GOD; Go you: serve you every one His idols: and hereafter also: if you not will listen to me: but pollute you my holy name no more with your gifts: and with your idols.
Am 6:10: A man's uncle will take Him up: and He that'>He who burns Him: to bring out the bones out of the house: and will say to Him that is by the sides of the house: Is there yet any with you? and He will say: No. Then will He say: Hold your tongue: for we not may make mention of the name of the LORD.
Am 8:14: They that swear by the sin of Samaria: and say: Your god: O Dan: lives'>lives; and: The manner of Beersheba lives'>lives; even they will fall: and never rise up again.
Zep 1:5: 6: Them that worship the host of heaven upon the housetops; and them that worship and that swear by the LORD: and that swear by Malcham;

H3588כִּ֚יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֚יkî For Conj

16 For Israel slides back as a backsliding heifer: now the LORD will feed them as a lamb in a large place.Hosea 4:16
Stats
Rank: #9863 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 104 characters, 20 words, 82 letters, 31 vowels, 51 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֚י כְּפָרָ֣ה סֹֽרֵרָ֔ה סָרַ֖ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עַתָּה֙ יִרְעֵ֣ם יְהוָ֔ה כְּכֶ֖בֶשׂ בַּמֶּרְחָֽב׃

Lit: For Like a calf stubborn is stubborn Israel now will let them forage Yahweh Like a lamb in open country

KJV: For Israel slideth back as a backsliding heifer: now the LORD will feed them as a lamb in a large place.
References

"slideth"
Ho 11:7: My people are bent to backsliding from me: though they called them to the most High: none at all would exalt him.
1Sa 15:11: It repents me that I have set up Saul to be king: for He is turned back from following me: and has not performed my commandments. And it grieved Samuel; and He cried to the LORD all night.
Jer 3:6: 8: 11: The LORD said also to me in the days of Josiah the king: Have you seen that which backsliding Israel has done? she is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree: and there has played the harlot.
Jer 5:6: For what reason a lion out of the for will kill them: and a wolf of the evenings will spoil them: a leopard will watch over their cities: every one that goes out there will be torn in pieces: because their transgressions are many: and their backslidings are increased.
Jer 7:24: But they listened not: nor inclined their ear: but walked in the counsels and in the imagination of their evil heart: and went backward: not and forward.
Jer 8:5: Why then is this people of Jerusalem slidden back by a perpetual backsliding? they hold fast deceit: they refuse to return.
Jer 14:7: O LORD: though our iniquities testify against us: do you it for your name's sake: for our backslidings are many; we have sinned against you.
Zec 7:11: But they refused to listen: and pulled away the shoulder: and stopped their ears: that they not should hear.

"as a lamb"
Le 26:33: I will scatter you among the heathen: and will draw out a sword after you: and your land will be desolate: and your cities waste.
Isa 7:21-25: It will come to pass in that day: that a man will nourish a young cow: and two sheep;
Isa 22:18: He will surely violently turn and toss you like a ball into a large country: there will you die: and there the chariots of your glory will be the shame of your lord's house.

Stats

Translation

Lit: Is rebellion their drink continually they commit harlotry love dearly dishonor Her rulers

KJV: Their drink is sour: they have committed whoredom continually: her rulers with shame do love, Give ye.
References

"drink"
De 32:32: 33: For their vine is of the vine of Sodom: and of the fields of Gomorrah: their grapes are grapes of gall: their clusters are bitter:
Isa 1:21: 22: How is the faithful city become an harlot! it was full of judgment; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers.
Jer 2:21: Yet I had planted you a noble vine: wholly a right seed: how then are you turned into the degenerate plant of a strange vine to me?

"committed"
Ho 4:2: 10: By swearing: and lying: and killing: and stealing: and committing adultery: they break out: and blood touches blood.
2Ki 17:7-17: For so it was: that the children of Israel had sinned against the LORD their God: which had brought them up out of the land of Egypt: from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt: and had feared other gods:

"her"
Ex 23:8: you will take no gift: for the gift blinds the wise: and perverts the words of the righteous.
De 16:19: You will not wrest judgment; you will not respect persons: neither take a gift: for a gift does blind the eyes of the wise: and pervert the words of the righteous.
1Sa 8:3: His sons not walked in his ways: but turned aside after lucre: and took bribes: and perverted judgment.
1Sa 12:3: 4: Look: here I am: witness against me before the LORD: and before His anointed: whose ox have I taken? or whose ass have I taken? or whom have I defrauded? whom have I oppressed? or of whose hand have I received any bribe to blind my eyes therewith? and I will restore it you.
Pr 30:15: 16: The horseleach has two daughters: crying: Give: give. There are 3 things that are never satisfied: yes: 4 things not say: It is enough:
Am 5:12: For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just: they take a bribe: and they turn aside the poor in the gate from their right.
Mic 3:11: The heads thereof judge for reward: and the priests thereof teach for hire: and the prophets thereof divine for money: yet will they lean upon the LORD: and say: Is not the LORD among us? none evil can come upon us.
Mic 7:3: That they may do evil with both hands earnestly: the prince asks: and the judge asks for a reward; and the great man: he utters his mischievous desire: so they wrap it up.

"rulers"
Ps 47:9: The princes of the people are gathered together: even the people of the God of Abraham: for the shields of the earth belong to God: He is greatly exalted.

H3671 כָּנָף kânâph kaw-nawf from כָּנַף; an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle; phrase bird, border, corner, end, feather(-ed), idiom flying, phrase (one an-) other, overspreading, idiom quarters, skirt, idiom sort, uttermost part, wing(-ed). 		בִּכְנָפֶ֑יהָbiḵ-nā-p̄e-hā; in its wings Prep-b | N-fpc | 3fs
H954וְיֵבֹ֖שׁוּwə-yê-ḇō-šū   (Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjImperf-3mp)
H954 בּוּשׁ bûwsh boosh a primitive root; properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed; (be, make, bring to, cause, put to, with, a-) shamed(-d), be (put to) confounded(-fusion), become dry, delay, be long. 		וְיֵבֹ֖שׁוּwə-yê-ḇō-šū and they shall be ashamed Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjImperf-3mp
H2077מִזִּבְחוֹתָֽם‪‬‪‬miz-ziḇ-ḥō-w-ṯām.   (Prep-m | N-mpc | 3mp)
H2077 זֶבַח zebach zeh-bakh from זָבַח; properly, a slaughter, i.e. the flesh of an animal; by implication, a sacrifice (the victim or the act); offer(-ing), sacrifice. 		מִזִּבְחוֹתָֽם‪‬‪‬miz-ziḇ-ḥō-w-ṯām. because of their sacrifices Prep-m | N-mpc | 3mp
19 The wind has bound her up in her wings, and they will be ashamed because of their sacrifices.Hosea 4:19
Stats
Counts: 95 characters, 17 words, 76 letters, 28 vowels, 48 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: צָרַ֥ר ר֛וּחַ אֹותָ֖הּ בִּכְנָפֶ֑יהָ וְיֵבֹ֖שׁוּ מִזִּבְחֹותָֽם׃ ס

Lit: Has wrapped up the wind her in its wings and they shall be ashamed because of their sacrifices

KJV: The wind hath bound her up in her wings, and they shall be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
References

"wind"
Jer 4:11: 12: At that time will it be said to this people and to Jerusalem: A dry wind of the high places in the wilderness toward the daughter of my people: not to fan: nor to cleanse:
Jer 51:1: Thus says the LORD; Look: I will raise up against Babylon: and against them that dwell in the middle of them that rise up against me: a destroying wind;
Zec 5:9-11: Then lifted I up my eyes: and looked: and: look: there came out two women: and the wind was in their wings; for they had wings like the wings of a stork: and they lifted up the ephah between the earth and the heaven.

"and"
Ho 10:6: It will be also carried to Assyria for a present to king Jareb: Ephraim will receive shame: and Israel will be ashamed of his own counsel.
Isa 1:29: For they will be ashamed of the oaks which you have desired: and you will be confounded for the gardens that you have chosen.
Isa 42:17: They will be turned back: they will be greatly ashamed: that trust in graven images: that say to the molten images: You are our gods.
Jer 2:26: 27: 36: 37: As the thief is ashamed when he is found: so is the house of Israel ashamed; they: their kings: their princes: and their priests: and their prophets:
Jer 3:24: 25: For shame has devoured the labour of our fathers from our youth; their flocks and their herds: their sons and their daughters.
Jer 17:13: O LORD: the hope of Israel: all that forsake you will be ashamed: and they that depart from me will be written in the earth: because they have forsaken the LORD: the fountain of living waters.

5
Judgment on Israel and Judah

שִׁמְעוּ־זֹ֨את הַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים וְהַקְשִׁ֣יבוּ ׀ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וּבֵ֤ית הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַאֲזִ֔ינוּ כִּ֥י לָכֶ֖ם הַמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט כִּֽי־פַח֙ הֱיִיתֶ֣ם לְמִצְפָּ֔ה וְרֶ֖שֶׁת פְּרוּשָׂ֥ה עַל־תָּבֹֽור׃

1 Hear you this, O priests; and listen, you house of Israel; and give you ear, O house of the king; for judgment is toward you, because you have been a snare on Mizpah, and a net spread upon Tabor.Hosea 5:1
Stats
Counts: 192 characters, 31 words, 145 letters, 64 vowels, 81 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ־זֹ֨את הַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים וְהַקְשִׁ֣יבוּ ׀ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וּבֵ֤ית הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַאֲזִ֔ינוּ כִּ֥י לָכֶ֖ם הַמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט כִּֽי־פַח֙ הֱיִיתֶ֣ם לְמִצְפָּ֔ה וְרֶ֖שֶׁת פְּרוּשָׂ֥ה עַל־תָּבֹֽור׃

Lit: Hear this priests and take heed house of Israel and house of the king Give ear for yours is the judgment because a snare you have been to Mizpah and a net spread on Tabor

KJV: Hear ye this, O priests; and hearken, ye house of Israel; and give ye ear, O house of the king; for judgment is toward you, because ye have been a snare on Mizpah, and a net spread upon Tabor.
References

"O priests"
Ho 4:1: 6: 7: Hear the word of the LORD: you children of Israel: for the LORD has a controversy with the inhabitants of the land: because there is no truth: nor mercy: nor knowledge of God in the land.
Ho 6:9: As troops of robbers wait for a man: so the company of priests murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.
Mal 1:6: A son honours His father: and a servant His master: if then I be a father: where is my honour? and if I be a master: where is my fear? says the LORD of hosts to you: O priests: that despise my name. And you say: Wherein have we despised your name?
Mal 2:1: Now: O you priests: this commandment is for you.

"O house"
Ho 7:3-5: They make the king glad with their wickedness: and the princes with their lies.
1Ki 14:7-16: Go: tell Jeroboam: Thus says the LORD God of Israel: Forasmuch as I exalted you from among the people: and made you prince over my people Israel:
1Ki 21:18-22: Arise: go down to meet Ahab king of Israel: which is in Samaria: look: he is in the vineyard of Naboth: whither he is gone down to possess it.
2Ch 21:12-15: There came a writing to Him from Elijah the prophet: saying: Thus says the LORD God of David your father: Because you have not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat your father: nor in the ways of Asa king of Judah:
Jer 13:18: Say to the king and to the queen: Humble yourselves: sit down: for your principalities will come down: even the crown of your glory.
Jer 22:1-9: Thus says the LORD; Go down to the house of the king of Judah: and speak there this word:
Am 7:9: The high places of Isaac will be desolate: and the sanctuaries of Israel will be laid waste; and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.
Mic 3:1: 9: I said: Hear: I pray you: O heads of Jacob: and you princes of the house of Israel; Is it not for you to know judgment?

"for"
Ho 9:11-17: As for Ephraim: their glory will fly away like a bird: from the birth: and from the womb: and from the conception.
Ho 10:15: So will Bethel do to you because of your great wickedness: in a morning will the king of Israel utterly be cut off.
Ho 13:8: I will meet them as a bear that is bereaved of her whelps: and will rend the caul of their heart: and there will I devour them like a lion: the wild beast will tear them.

"ye have"
Ho 9:8: The watchman of Ephraim was with my God: but the prophet is a snare of a fowler in all His ways: and hatred in the house of His God.
Mic 7:2: The good man is perished out of the earth: and there is none upright among men: they all lie in wait for blood; they hunt every man his brother with a net.
Hab 1:15-17: They take up all of them with the angle: they catch them in their net: and gather them in their drag: therefore they rejoice and are glad.

"Tabor"
Jg 4:6: She sent and called Barak the son of Abinoam out of Kedeshnaphtali: and said to Him: Has not the LORD God of Israel commanded: saying: Go and draw toward mount Tabor: and take with you 10000 men of the children of Naphtali and of the children of Zebulun?
Jer 46:18: As I live: says the King: whose name is the LORD of hosts: Surely as Tabor is among the mountains: and as Carmel by the sea: so will He come.

H3605לְכֻלָּֽם׃lə-ḵul-lām.   (Prep-l | N-msc | 3mp)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		לְכֻלָּֽם׃lə-ḵul-lām. them all Prep-l | N-msc | 3mp
2 The revolters are profound to make slaughter, though I have been a rebuker of them all.Hosea 5:2
Stats
Counts: 91 characters, 16 words, 73 letters, 30 vowels, 43 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְשַׁחֲטָ֥ה שֵׂטִ֖ים הֶעְמִ֑יקוּ וַאֲנִ֖י מוּסָ֥ר לְכֻלָּֽם׃

Lit: And in slaughter the revolters are deeply involved and Though I rebuke them all

KJV: And the revolters are profound to make slaughter, though I have been a rebuker of them all.
References

"the revolters"
Ho 6:9: As troops of robbers wait for a man: so the company of priests murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.
Ho 9:15: All their wickedness is in Gilgal: for there I hated them: for the wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of my house: I will love them no more: all their princes are revolters.
Jer 6:28: They are all grievous revolters: walking with slanders: they are brass and iron; they are all corrupters.

"profound"
Ps 64:3-6: Who whet their tongue like a sword: and bend their bows to shoot their arrows: even bitter words:
Ps 140:1-5: A Psalm of David.>> Deliver me: O LORD: from the evil man: preserve me from the violent man;
Isa 29:15: Woe to them that seek deep to hide their counsel from the LORD: and their works are in the dark: and they say: Who sees us? and who knows us?
Jer 11:18: 19: The LORD has given me knowledge of it: and I know it: then you shewedst me their doings.
Jer 18:18: Then said they: Come: and let us devise devices against Jeremiah; for the law will not perish from the priest: nor counsel from the wise: nor the word from the prophet. Come: and let us smite him with the tongue: and let not us give heed to any of his words.
Lu 22:2-5: The chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people.
Ac 23:12-15: When it was day: certain of the Jews banded together: and bound themselves under a curse: saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul.

"though"
Ho 6:5: Therefore have I hewed them by the prophets; I have killed them by the words of my mouth: and your judgments are as the light that goes forth.
Isa 1:5: Why should you be stricken any more? you will revolt more and more: the whole head is sick: and the whole heart faint.
Jer 5:3: O LORD: are not your eyes upon the truth? you have stricken them: but they not have grieved; you have consumed them: but they have refused to receive correction: they have made their faces harder than a rock; they have refused to return.
Jer 25:3-7: From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon king of Judah: even to this day: that is the 3 and twentieth year: the word of the LORD has come to me: and I have spoken to you: rising early and speaking; but you not have listened.
Am 4:6-12: I also have given you cleanness of teeth in all your cities: and want of bread in all your places: yet have you not returned to me: says the LORD.
Zep 3:1: 2: Woe to her that is filthy and polluted: to the oppressing city!
Re 3:19: As many as I love: I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore: and repent.

 אֲנִי֙ יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֶפְרַ֔יִם וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹֽא־נִכְחַ֣ד מִמֶּ֑נִּי כִּ֤י עַתָּה֙ הִזְנֵ֣יתָ אֶפְרַ֔יִם נִטְמָ֖א יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃

H3045 יָדַע yâdaʻ yaw-dah a primitive root; to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.); acknowledge, acquaintance(-ted with), advise, answer, appoint, assuredly, be aware, (un-) awares, can(-not), certainly, comprehend, consider, idiom could they, cunning, declare, be diligent, (can, cause to) discern, discover, endued with, familiar friend, famous, feel, can have, be (ig-) norant, instruct, kinsfolk, kinsman, (cause to let, make) know, (come to give, have, take) knowledge, have (knowledge), (be, make, make to be, make self) known, phrase be learned, phrase lie by man, mark, perceive, privy to, idiom prognosticator, regard, have respect, skilful, shew, can (man of) skill, be sure, of a surety, teach, (can) tell, understand, have (understanding), idiom will be, wist, wit, wot. 		יָדַ֣עְתִּיyā-ḏa‘-tî know V-Qal-Perf-1cs

H2181הִזְנֵ֣יתָhiz-nê-ṯā   (V-Hifil-Perf-2ms)
H2181 זָנָה zânâh zaw-naw a primitive root (highly-fed and therefore wanton); to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah); (cause to) commit fornication, idiom continually, idiom great, (be an, play the) harlot, (cause to be, play the) whore, (commit, fall to) whoredom, (cause to) go a-whoring, whorish. 		הִזְנֵ֣יתָhiz-nê-ṯā you commit harlotry V-Hifil-Perf-2ms

3 I know Ephraim, and Israel not is hid from me: for now, O Ephraim, you commit whoredom, and Israel is defiled.Hosea 5:3
Stats
Counts: 115 characters, 16 words, 89 letters, 36 vowels, 53 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֲנִי֙ יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֶפְרַ֔יִם וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹֽא־נִכְחַ֣ד מִמֶּ֑נִּי כִּ֤י עַתָּה֙ הִזְנֵ֣יתָ אֶפְרַ֔יִם נִטְמָ֖א יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃

Lit: I know Ephraim and Israel not is hidden from Me for now you commit harlotry Ephraim is defiled Israel

KJV: I know Ephraim, and Israel is not hid from me: for now, O Ephraim, thou committest whoredom, and Israel is defiled.
References

"know"
Am 3:2: You only have I known of all the families of the earth: therefore I will punish you for all your iniquities.
Heb 4:13: Neither is there any creature that not is manifest in his sight: but all things are naked and opened to the eyes of him with whom we have to do.
Re 3:15: I know your works: that you are neither cold nor hot: I would you wert cold or hot.

"Ephraim"
Ho 5:9: 11: 13: Ephraim will be desolate in the day of rebuke: among the tribes of Israel have I made known that which will surely be.
Ho 6:4: O Ephraim: what will I do to you? O Judah: what will I do to you? for your goodness is as a morning cloud: and as the early dew it goes away.
Ho 8:11: Because Ephraim has made many altars to sin: altars will be to him to sin.
Ho 12:1: Ephraim feeds on wind: and follows after the east wind: he daily increases lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians: and oil is carried into Egypt.
Ho 13:1: When Ephraim spoke trembling: he exalted himself in Israel; but when he offended in Baal: he died.
Ge 48:19: 20: His father refused: and said: I know it: my son: I know it: he also will become a people: and he also will be great: but truly his younger brother will be greater than he: and his seed will become a multitude of nations.
De 33:17: His glory is like the firstling of his bullock: and his horns are like the horns of unicorns: with them he will push the people together to the ends of the earth: and they are the 10 thousands of Ephraim: and they are the thousands of Manasseh.
Isa 7:5: 8: 9: 17: Because Syria: Ephraim: and the son of Remaliah: have taken evil counsel against you: saying:

"thou"
Ho 4:17: 18: Ephraim is joined to idols: let him alone.
1Ki 12:26-33: Jeroboam said in his heart: Now will the kingdom return to the house of David:
1Ki 14:14-16: Moreover the LORD will raise Him up a king over Israel: who will cut off the house of Jeroboam that day: but what? even now.
Eze 23:5-21: Aholah played the harlot when she was my; and she doted on her lovers: on the Assyrians her neighbours:

4 They not will frame their doings to turn to their God: for the spirit of whoredoms is in the middle of them, and they not have known the LORD.Hosea 5:4
Stats
Counts: 143 characters, 27 words, 112 letters, 38 vowels, 74 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לֹ֤א יִתְּנוּ֙ מַ֣עַלְלֵיהֶ֔ם לָשׁ֖וּב אֶל־אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶ֑ם כִּ֣י ר֤וּחַ זְנוּנִים֙ בְּקִרְבָּ֔ם וְאֶת־יְהוָ֖ה לֹ֥א יָדָֽעוּ׃

Lit: Not they do direct their deeds Toward turning to their God For the spirit of harlotry is in their midst and Yahweh not they do know

KJV: They will not frame their doings to turn unto their God: for the spirit of whoredoms is in the midst of them, and they have not known the LORD.
References

"They will not frame their doings"
Ps 36:1-4: A Psalm of David the servant of the LORD.>> The transgression of the wicked says within my heart: that there is no fear of God before His eyes.
Ps 78:8: not might be as their fathers: a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that not set their heart aright: and whose spirit not was stedfast with God.
Joh 3:19: 20: This is the condemnation: that light is come into the world: and men loved darkness rather than light: because their deeds were evil.
2Th 2:11: 12: For this cause God will send them strong delusion: that they should believe a lie:

"for"
Ho 4:12: My people ask counsel at their stocks: and their staff declares to them: for the spirit of whoredoms has caused them to err: and they have gone a whoring from under their God.
Jer 50:38: A drought is upon her waters; and they will be dried up: for it is the land of graven images: and they are mad upon their idols.

"and"
Ho 4:1: Hear the word of the LORD: you children of Israel: for the LORD has a controversy with the inhabitants of the land: because there is no truth: nor mercy: nor knowledge of God in the land.
1Sa 2:12: Now the sons of Eli were sons of Belial; they not knew the LORD.
Ps 9:10: They that know your name will put their trust in you: for you: LORD: have not forsaken them that seek you.
Jer 9:6: 24: Your habitation is in the middle of deceit; through deceit they refuse to know me: says the LORD.
Jer 22:15: 16: Will you reign: because you close yourself in cedar? not did your father eat and drink: and do judgment and justice: and then it was well with him?
Jer 24:7: I will give them an heart to know me: that I am the LORD: and they will be my people: and I will be their God: for they will return to me with their whole heart.
Joh 8:55: Yet you not have known him; but I know him: and if I should say: I know not him: I will be a liar like to you: but I know him: and keep his saying.
Joh 16:3: These things will they do to you: because they not have known the Father: nor me.
1Jo 2:3: 4: Hereby we do know that we know him: if we keep his commandments.

 וְעָנָ֥ה גְאֹֽון־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּפָנָ֑יו וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל וְאֶפְרַ֗יִם יִכָּֽשְׁלוּ֙ בַּעֲוֹנָ֔ם כָּשַׁ֥ל גַּם־יְהוּדָ֖ה עִמָּֽם׃

H6030וְעָנָ֥הwə-‘ā-nāh   (Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjPerf-3ms)
H6030 עָנָה ʻânâh aw-naw a primitive root; properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce; give account, afflict (by mistake for עָנָה), (cause to, give) answer, bring low (by mistake for עָנָה), cry, hear, Leannoth, lift up, say, idiom scholar, (give a) shout, sing (together by course), speak, testify, utter, (bear) witness. See also בֵּית עֲנוֹת, בֵּית עֲנָת. 		וְעָנָ֥הwə-‘ā-nāh And testifies Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjPerf-3ms
H1347גְאֽוֹן־ḡə-’ō-wn-   (N-msc)
H1347 גָּאוֹן gâʼôwn gaw-ohn from גָּאָה; the same as גַּאֲוָהxlit gaʻăvâh corrected to gaʼăvâh; {arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament}; arrogancy, excellency(-lent), majesty, pomp, pride, proud, swelling. 		גְאֽוֹן־ḡə-’ō-wn- the pride N-msc
H3478יִשְׂרָאֵ֖לyiś-rā-’êl   (N-proper-ms)
H3478 יִשְׂרָאֵל Yisrâʼêl yis-raw-ale from שָׂרָה and אֵל; he will rule as God; Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity; Israel. 		יִשְׂרָאֵ֖לyiś-rā-’êl of Israel N-proper-ms
H6440בְּפָנָ֑יוbə-p̄ā-nāw;   (Prep-b | N-cpc | 3ms)
H6440 פָּנִים pânîym paw-neem plural (but always as singular) of an unused noun פָּנֶה; from פָּנָה); the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.); phrase accept, a-(be-) fore(-time), against, anger, idiom as (long as), at, phrase battle, phrase because (of), phrase beseech, countenance, edge, phrase employ, endure, phrase enquire, face, favour, fear of, for, forefront(-part), form(-er time, -ward), from, front, heaviness, idiom him(-self), phrase honourable, phrase impudent, phrase in, it, look(-eth) (-s), idiom me, phrase meet, idiom more than, mouth, of, off, (of) old (time), idiom on, open, phrase out of, over against, the partial, person, phrase please, presence, propect, was purposed, by reason of, phrase regard, right forth, phrase serve, idiom shewbread, sight, state, straight, phrase street, idiom thee, idiom them(-selves), through (phrase -out), till, time(-s) past, (un-) to(-ward), phrase upon, upside (phrase down), with(-in, phrase -stand), idiom ye, idiom you. 		בְּפָנָ֑יוbə-p̄ā-nāw; to his face Prep-b | N-cpc | 3ms

H3782יִכָּֽשְׁלוּ֙yik-kā-šə-lū   (V-Nifal-Imperf-3mp)
H3782 כָּשַׁל kâshal kaw-shal a primitive root; to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall; bereave (from the margin), cast down, be decayed, (cause to) fail, (cause, make to) fall (down, -ing), feeble, be (the) ruin(-ed, of), (be) overthrown, (cause to) stumble, idiom utterly, be weak. 		יִכָּֽשְׁלוּ֙yik-kā-šə-lū stumble V-Nifal-Imperf-3mp

H5771 עָוֺן ʻâvôn aw-vone or עָווֹן; (2 Kings 7:9; Psalm 51:5 (אֲבַד)), from עָוָה; perversity, i.e. (moral) evil; fault, iniquity, mischeif, punishment (of iniquity), sin. 		בַּעֲוֺנָ֔םba-‘ă-wō-nām, in their iniquity Prep-b | N-csc | 3mp

H3782 כָּשַׁל kâshal kaw-shal a primitive root; to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall; bereave (from the margin), cast down, be decayed, (cause to) fail, (cause, make to) fall (down, -ing), feeble, be (the) ruin(-ed, of), (be) overthrown, (cause to) stumble, idiom utterly, be weak. 		כָּשַׁ֥לkā-šal stumbles V-Qal-Perf-3ms
H1571גַּם־gam-   (Conj)
H1571 גַּם gam gam by contraction from an unused root meaning to gather; properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and; again, alike, also, (so much) as (soon), both (so)...and, but, either...or, even, for all, (in) likewise (manner), moreover, nay...neither, one, then(-refore), though, what, with, yea. 		גַּם־gam- also Conj

H3063 יְהוּדָה Yᵉhûwdâh yeh-hoo-daw from יָדָה; celebrated; Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory; Judah. 		יְהוּדָ֖הyə-hū-ḏāh Judah N-proper-ms
H5973עִמָּֽם׃‘im-mām.   (Prep | 3mp)
H5973 עִם ʻim eem from עָמַם; adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English); accompanying, against, and, as (idiom long as), before, beside, by (reason of), for all, from (among, between), in, like, more than, of, (un-) to, with(-al). 		עִמָּֽם׃‘im-mām. with them Prep | 3mp
5 The pride of Israel does testify to his face: therefore will Israel and Ephraim fall in their iniquity; Judah also will fall with them.Hosea 5:5
Stats
Counts: 141 characters, 23 words, 114 letters, 43 vowels, 71 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְעָנָ֥ה גְאֹֽון־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּפָנָ֑יו וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל וְאֶפְרַ֗יִם יִכָּֽשְׁלוּ֙ בַּעֲוֹנָ֔ם כָּשַׁ֥ל גַּם־יְהוּדָ֖ה עִמָּֽם׃

Lit: And testifies the pride of Israel to his face therefore Israel and Ephraim stumble in their iniquity stumbles also Judah with them

KJV: And the pride of Israel doth testify to his face: therefore shall Israel and Ephraim fall in their iniquity; Judah also shall fall with them.
References

"the pride"
Ho 7:10: The pride of Israel testifieth to His face: and they not do return to the LORD their God: nor seek Him for all this.
Pr 30:13: There is a generation: O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.
Isa 3:9: The show of their face does witness against them; and they declare their sin as Sodom: they hide it not. Woe to their soul! for they have rewarded evil to themselves.
Isa 9:9: 10: All the people will know: even Ephraim and the inhabitant of Samaria: that say in the pride and stoutness of heart:
Isa 28:1-3: Woe to the crown of pride: to the drunkards of Ephraim: whose glorious beauty is a fading flower: which are on the head of the fat valleys of them that are overcome with wine!

"testify"
Isa 44:9: They that make a graven image are all of them vanity; and their delectable things will not profit; and they are their own witnesses; they not see: nor know; that they may be ashamed.
Isa 59:12: For our transgressions are multiplied before you: and our sins testify against us: for our transgressions are with us; and as for our iniquities: we know them;
Jer 14:7: O LORD: though our iniquities testify against us: do you it for your name's sake: for our backslidings are many; we have sinned against you.
Mt 23:31: For what reason you be witnesses to yourselves: that you are the children of them which killed the prophets.
Lu 19:22: He says to him: Out of your own mouth will I judge you: you wicked servant. You knew that I was an austere man: taking up that I not laid down: and reaping that I not did sow:

"fall in"
Ho 4:5: Therefore will you fall in the day: and the prophet also will fall with you in the night: and I will destroy your mother.
Ho 14:1: O Israel: return to the LORD your God; for you have fallen by your iniquity.
Pr 11:5: 21: The righteousness of the perfect will direct his way: but the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.
Pr 14:32: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous has hope in his death.
Pr 24:16: For a just man falls 7 times: and rises up again: but the wicked will fall into mischief.
Am 5:2: The virgin of Israel is fallen; she will no more rise: she is forsaken upon her land; there is none to raise her up.

"Judah"
Ho 5:14: For I will be to Ephraim as a lion: and as a young lion to the house of Judah: I: even I: will tear and go away; I will take away: and none will rescue him.
Ho 8:14: For Israel has forgotten his Maker: and builds temples; and Judah has multiplied fenced cities: but I will send a fire upon his cities: and it will devour the palaces thereof.
2Ki 17:19: 20: Also Judah not kept the commandments of the LORD their God: but walked in the statutes of Israel which they made.
Eze 23:31-35: You have walked in the way of your sister; therefore will I give her cup into your hand.
Am 2:4: 5: Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Judah: and for 4: I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they have despised the law of the LORD: and not have kept His commandments: and their lies caused them to err: after the which their fathers have walked:

 בְּצֹאנָ֣ם וּבִבְקָרָ֗ם יֵֽלְכ֛וּ לְבַקֵּ֥שׁ אֶת־יְהוָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א יִמְצָ֑אוּ חָלַ֖ץ מֵהֶֽם׃

H6629 צֹאן tsôʼn tsone or צאוֹן; (Psalm 144:13), from an unused root meaning to migrate; a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men); (small) cattle, flock (phrase -s), lamb (phrase -s), sheep(-cote, -fold, -shearer, -herds). 		בְּצֹאנָ֣םbə-ṣō-nām With their flocks Prep-b | N-fsc | 3mp

H4672 מָצָא mâtsâʼ maw-tsaw a primitive root; properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present; phrase be able, befall, being, catch, idiom certainly, (cause to) come (on, to, to hand), deliver, be enough (cause to) find(-ing, occasion, out), get (hold upon), idiom have (here), be here, hit, be left, light (up-) on, meet (with), idiom occasion serve, (be) present, ready, speed, suffice, take hold on. 		יִמְצָ֑אוּyim-ṣā-’ū; they will find Him V-Qal-Imperf-3mp

H1992מֵהֶֽם׃mê-hem.   (Prep-m | Pro-3mp)
H1992 הֵם hêm haym or (prolonged) הֵמָּה; masculine plural from הֲלַךְ; they (only used when emphatic); it, like, idiom (how, so) many (soever, more as) they (be), (the) same, idiom so, idiom such, their, them, these, they, those, which, who, whom, withal, ye. 		מֵהֶֽם׃mê-hem. from them Prep-m | Pro-3mp
6 They will go with their flocks and with their herds to seek the LORD; but they will not find Him; He has withdrawn Himself from them.Hosea 5:6
Stats
Rank: #4438 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 136 characters, 24 words, 108 letters, 31 vowels, 77 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בְּצֹאנָ֣ם וּבִבְקָרָ֗ם יֵֽלְכ֛וּ לְבַקֵּ֥שׁ אֶת־יְהוָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א יִמְצָ֑אוּ חָלַ֖ץ מֵהֶֽם׃

Lit: With their flocks and herds they shall go to seek Yahweh but not they will find Him He has withdrawn Himself from them

KJV: They shall go with their flocks and with their herds to seek the LORD; but they shall not find him; he hath withdrawn himself from them.
References

"go"
Ex 10:9: 24-26: Moses said: We will go with our young and with our old: with our sons and with our daughters: with our flocks and with our herds will we go; for we must hold a feast to the LORD.
Pr 15:8: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD: but the prayer of the upright is His delight.
Pr 21:27: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more: when he brings it with a wicked mind?
Jer 7:4: Trust you not in lying words: saying: The temple of the LORD: The temple of the LORD: The temple of the LORD: are these.
Mic 6:6: 7: Wherewith will I come before the LORD: and bow myself before the high God? will I come before Him with burnt offerings: with calves of a year old?

"they"
Pr 1:28: Then will they call upon me: but I not will answer; they will seek me early: but they will not find me:
Isa 1:11-15: To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices to me? says the LORD: I am full of the burnt offerings of rams: and the fat of fed beasts; and I not delight in the blood of bullocks: or of lambs: or of He goats.
Isa 66:3: He who kills an ox is as if he killed a man; he who sacrifices a lamb: as if he cut off a dog's neck; he who offers an oblation: as if he offered swine's blood; he who burns incense: as if he blessed an idol. Yes: they have chosen their own ways: and their soul delights in their abominations.
Jer 11:11: Therefore thus says the LORD: Look: I will bring evil upon them: which they will not be able to escape; and though they will cry to me: I not will listen to them.
La 3:44: You have covered yourself with a cloud: that our prayer not should pass through.
Eze 8:18: Therefore will I also deal in fury: my eye will not spare: neither will I have pity: and though they cry in my ears with a loud voice: yet will not I hear them.
Am 5:21-23: I hate: I despise your feast days: and I not will smell in your solemn assemblies.
Mic 3:4: Then will they cry to the LORD: but He not will hear them: He will even hide His face from them at that time: as they have behaved themselves ill in their doings.
Joh 7:34: You will seek me: and will not find me: and where I am: there you cannot come.

"he"
Song 5:6: I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself: and was gone: my soul failed when he spoke: I sought him: but I not could find him; I called him: but he gave me no answer.
Lu 5:16: He withdrew himself into the wilderness: and prayed.

H3588כִּֽי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּֽי־kî- for Conj

H398יֹאכְלֵ֥םyō-ḵə-lêm   (V-Qal-Imperf-3ms | 3mp)

H854 אֵת ʼêth ayth probably from אָנָה; properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.; against, among, before, by, for, from, in(-to), (out) of, with. Often with another prepositional prefix. 		אֶת־’eṯ- and Prep

7 They have dealt treacherously against the LORD: for they have begotten strange children: now will a month devour them with their portions.Hosea 5:7
Stats
Rank: #5827 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 139 characters, 20 words, 115 letters, 40 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בַּיהוָ֣ה בָּגָ֔דוּ כִּֽי־בָנִ֥ים זָרִ֖ים יָלָ֑דוּ עַתָּ֛ה יֹאכְלֵ֥ם חֹ֖דֶשׁ אֶת־חֶלְקֵיהֶֽם׃ ס

Lit: With Yahweh they have dealt treacherously for children Pagan they have begotten now shall devour them a New Moon and their heritage

KJV: They have dealt treacherously against the LORD: for they have begotten strange children: now shall a month devour them with their portions.
References

"dealt"
Ho 6:7: But they like men have transgressed the covenant: there have they dealt treacherously against me.
Isa 48:8: Yes: you heard not; yes: you knew not; yes: from that time that your ear not was opened: for I knew that you would deal very treacherously: and were called a transgressor from the womb.
Isa 59:13: In transgressing and lying against the LORD: and departing away from our God: speaking oppression and revolt: conceiving and uttering from the heart words of falsehood.
Jer 3:20: Surely as a wife treacherously departs from her husband: so have you dealt treacherously with me: O house of Israel: says the LORD.
Jer 5:11: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me: says the LORD.

"begotten"
Ne 13:23: 24: In those days also saw I Jews that had married wives of Ashdod: of Ammon: and of Moab:
Ps 144:7: 11: Send your hand from above; rid me: and deliver me out of great waters: from the hand of strange children;
Mal 2:11-15: Judah has dealt treacherously: and an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem; for Judah has profaned the holiness of the LORD which He loved: and has married the daughter of a strange god.

"a month"
Eze 12:28: Therefore say to them: Thus says the Lord GOD; There will none of my words be prolonged any more: but the word which I have spoken will be done: says the Lord GOD.
Zec 11:8: 3 shepherds also I cut off in one month; and my soul lothed them: and their soul also abhorred me.

8 Blow you the cornet in Gibeah, and the trumpet in Ramah: cry aloud at Bethaven, after you, O Benjamin.Hosea 5:8
Stats
Rank: #6153 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 104 characters, 13 words, 79 letters, 31 vowels, 48 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: תִּקְע֤וּ שֹׁופָר֙ בַּגִּבְעָ֔ה חֲצֹצְרָ֖ה בָּרָמָ֑ה הָרִ֙יעוּ֙ בֵּ֣ית אָ֔וֶן אַחֲרֶ֖יךָ בִּנְיָמִֽין׃

Lit: Blow the rams horn in Gibeah the trumpet in Ramah Cry aloud at Beth Aven Look behind you Benjamin

KJV: Blow ye the cornet in Gibeah, and the trumpet in Ramah: cry aloud [at] Bethaven, after thee, O Benjamin.
References

"Blow"
Ho 8:1: Set the trumpet to your mouth. He will come as an eagle against the house of the LORD: because they have transgressed my covenant: and trespassed against my law.
Jer 4:5: Declare you in Judah: and publish in Jerusalem; and say: Blow you the trumpet in the land: cry: gather together: and say: Assemble yourselves: and let us go into the defenced cities.
Jer 6:1: O you children of Benjamin: gather yourselves to flee out of the middle of Jerusalem: and blow the trumpet in Tekoa: and set up a sign of fire in Bethhaccerem: for evil appears out of the north: and great destruction.
Joe 2:1: 15: Blow you the trumpet in Zion: and sound an alarm in my holy mountain: let all the inhabitants of the land tremble: for the day of the LORD comes: for it is nigh at hand;

"Gibeah"
Ho 9:9: They have deeply corrupted themselves: as in the days of Gibeah: therefore he will remember their iniquity: he will visit their sins.
Ho 10:9: O Israel: you have sinned from the days of Gibeah: there they stood: the battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity not did overtake them.
Jg 19:12-15: His master said to him: We not will turn aside here into the city of a stranger: that is not of the children of Israel; we will pass over to Gibeah.
Jg 20:4-6: The Levite: the husband of the woman that was killed: answered and said: I came into Gibeah that belongeth to Benjamin: I and my concubine: to lodge.
1Sa 15:34: Then Samuel went to Ramah; and Saul went up to his house to Gibeah of Saul.
2Sa 21:6: Let 7 men of His sons be delivered to us: and we will hang them up to the LORD in Gibeah of Saul: whom the LORD did choose. And the king said: I will give them.
Isa 10:29: They are gone over the passage: they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramah is afraid; Gibeah of Saul is fled.

"Ramah"
1Sa 7:17: His return was to Ramah; for there was His house; and there He judged Israel; and there He built an altar to the LORD.
1Sa 8:4: Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together: and came to Samuel to Ramah:
1Sa 15:34: Then Samuel went to Ramah; and Saul went up to his house to Gibeah of Saul.

"Beth-aven"
Ho 4:15: Though you: Israel: play the harlot: yet not let Judah offend; and not come you to Gilgal: neither go you up to Bethaven: nor swear: The LORD lives.
Ho 10:5: 8: The inhabitants of Samaria will fear because of the calves of Bethaven: for the people thereof will mourn over it: and the priests thereof that rejoiced on it: for the glory thereof: because it is departed from it.
Jos 7:2: Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai: which is beside Bethaven: on the east side of Bethel: and spoke to them: saying: Go up and view the country. And the men went up and viewed Ai.
1Ki 12:29: He set the one in Bethel: and the other put he in Dan.

"after"
Jg 5:14: Out of Ephraim was there a root of them against Amalek; after you: Benjamin: among your people; out of Machir came down governors: and out of Zebulun they that handle the pen of the writer.

"Ephraim"

Am 7:9: 17: The high places of Isaac will be desolate: and the sanctuaries of Israel will be laid waste; and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.

"have"

Isa 48:3: 5: I have declared the former things from the beginning; and they went forth out of my mouth: and I showed them; I did them suddenly: and they came to pass.

H8210 שָׁפַךְ shâphak shaw-fak a primitive root; to spill forth (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to expend (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to sprawl out; cast (up), gush out, pour (out), shed(-der, out), slip. 		אֶשְׁפּ֥וֹךְ’eš-pō-wḵ I will pour out V-Qal-Imperf-1cs

10 The princes of Judah were like them that remove the bound: therefore I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.Hosea 5:10
Stats
Rank: #8575 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 115 characters, 21 words, 92 letters, 36 vowels, 56 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הָיוּ֙ שָׂרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה כְּמַסִּיגֵ֖י גְּב֑וּל עֲלֵיהֶ֕ם אֶשְׁפֹּ֥וךְ כַּמַּ֖יִם עֶבְרָתִֽי׃

Lit: Are the princes of Judah like those who remove a landmark on them I will pour out like water my wrath

KJV: The princes of Judah were like them that remove the bound: therefore I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.
References

"remove"
De 19:14: You will not remove your neighbour's landmark: which they of old time have set in your inheritance: which you will inherit in the land that the LORD your God gives you to possess it.
De 27:17: Cursed be he who removes his neighbour's landmark. And all the people will say: Amen.
2Ki 16:7-9: So Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglathpileser king of Assyria: saying: I am your servant and your son: come up: and save me out of the hand of the king of Syria: and out of the hand of the king of Israel: which rise up against me.
2Ch 28:16-22: At that time did king Ahaz send to the kings of Assyria to help him.
Pr 17:14: The beginning of strife is as when one lets out water: therefore leave off contention: before it be meddled with.
Pr 22:28: not Remove the ancient landmark: which your fathers have set.

"like"
Ps 32:6: For this will every one that is godly pray to you in a time when you may be found: surely in the floods of great waters they will not come nigh to him.
Ps 88:17: They came round about me daily like water; they compassed me about together.
Ps 93:3: 4: The floods have lifted up: O LORD: the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift up their waves.
Mt 7:27: The rain descended: and the floods came: and the winds blew: and beat upon that house; and it fell: and great was the fall of it.
Lu 6:49: But he who hears: and does not: is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth; against which the stream did beat vehemently: and immediately it fell; and the ruin of that house was great.

Translation
