Lit: Is oppressed Ephraim and broken in judgment because he willingly walked by human precept

KJV: Ephraim is oppressed [and] broken in judgment, because he willingly walked after the commandment.

"oppressed"

2Ki 15:16-20: 29: Then Menahem smote Tiphsah: and all that were therein: and the coasts thereof from Tirzah: because they not opened to him: therefore he smote it; and all the women therein that were with child he ripped up.
Am 5:11: 12: Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon the poor: and you take from him burdens of wheat: you have built houses of cut stone: but you will not dwell in them; you have planted pleasant vineyards: but you will not drink wine of them.

"he willingly"
1Ki 12:26-33: Jeroboam said in his heart: Now will the kingdom return to the house of David:
Mic 6:16: For the statutes of Omri are kept: and all the works of the house of Ahab: and you walk in their counsels; that I should make you a desolation: and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore you will bear the reproach of my people.

12 Therefore will I be to Ephraim as a moth, and to the house of Judah as rottenness.Hosea 5:12
Stats
Counts: 86 characters, 14 words, 66 letters, 28 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֥י כָעָ֖שׁ לְאֶפְרָ֑יִם וְכָרָקָ֖ב לְבֵ֥ית יְהוּדָֽה׃

Lit: Therefore I will be like a moth to Ephraim and like rottenness to the house of Judah

KJV: Therefore will I [be] unto Ephraim as a moth, and to the house of Judah as rottenness.
References

"as a"
Job 13:28: He: as a rotten thing: consumes: as a garment that is moth eaten.
Isa 50:9: Look: the Lord GOD will help me; who is He that will condemn me? indeed: they all will wax old as a garment; the moth will eat them up.
Isa 51:8: For the moth will eat them up like a garment: and the worm will eat them like wool: but my righteousness will be for ever: and my salvation from generation to generation.

"as"
Pr 12:4: A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband: but she that makes ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.

"rottenness"
Jon 4:7: But God prepared a worm when the morning rose the next day: and it smote the gourd that it withered.
Mr 9:44-48: Where their worm dies not: and the fire not is quenched.

H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		וְה֗וּאwə-hū, And yet he Conj-w | Pro-3ms
H3808לֹ֤אlō   (Adv-NegPrt)
H3808 לֹא lôʼ lo or לוֹא; or לֹה; (Deuteronomy 3:11), a primitive particle; not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles; idiom before, phrase or else, ere, phrase except, ig(-norant), much, less, nay, neither, never, no((-ne), -r, (-thing)), (idiom as though...,(can-), for) not (out of), of nought, otherwise, out of, phrase surely, phrase as truly as, phrase of a truth, phrase verily, for want, phrase whether, without. 		לֹ֤אlō cannot Adv-NegPrt

H7495 רָפָא râphâʼ raw-faw or רָפָה; a primitive root; properly, to mend (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to cure; cure, (cause to) heal, physician, repair, idiom thoroughly, make whole. See רָפָה. 		לִרְפֹּ֣אlir-pō cure Prep-l | V-Qal-Inf

H4205מָזֽוֹר׃mā-zō-wr.   (N-ms)
H4205 מָזוֹר mâzôwr maw-zore or מָזֹר; from זוּר in the sense of binding up; a bandage, i.e. remedy; hence, a sore (as needing a compress); bound up, wound. 		מָזֽוֹר׃mā-zō-wr. of your wound N-ms
13 When Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah saw his wound, then went Ephraim to the Assyrian, and sent to king Jareb: yet could not he heal you, nor cure you of your wound.Hosea 5:13
Stats
Counts: 169 characters, 28 words, 131 letters, 50 vowels, 81 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא אֶפְרַ֜יִם אֶת־חָלְיֹ֗ו וִֽיהוּדָה֙ אֶת־מְזֹרֹ֔ו וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ אֶל־אַשּׁ֔וּר וַיִּשְׁלַ֖ח אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ יָרֵ֑ב וְה֗וּא לֹ֤א יוּכַל֙ לִרְפֹּ֣א לָכֶ֔ם וְלֹֽא־יִגְהֶ֥ה מִכֶּ֖ם מָזֹֽור׃

Lit: And when saw Ephraim his sickness and Judah saw his wound and went Ephraim to Assyria and sent to King Jareb And yet he cannot could cure you nor heal you of your wound

KJV: When Ephraim saw his sickness, and Judah saw his wound, then went Ephraim to the Assyrian, and sent to king Jareb: yet could he not heal you, nor cure you of your wound.
References

"his wound"
Jer 30:12: 14: For thus says the LORD: Your bruise is incurable: and your wound is grievous.
Mic 1:9: For her wound is incurable; for it is come to Judah; he is come to the gate of my people: even to Jerusalem.

"went"
Ho 7:11: Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt: they go to Assyria.
Ho 10:6: It will be also carried to Assyria for a present to king Jareb: Ephraim will receive shame: and Israel will be ashamed of his own counsel.
Ho 12:1: Ephraim feeds on wind: and follows after the east wind: he daily increases lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians: and oil is carried into Egypt.
2Ki 15:19: 29: And Pul the king of Assyria came against the land: and Menahem gave Pul a000 talents of silver: that his hand might be with him to confirm the kingdom in his hand.
2Ki 16:7: So Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglathpileser king of Assyria: saying: I am your servant and your son: come up: and save me out of the hand of the king of Syria: and out of the hand of the king of Israel: which rise up against me.
2Ch 28:16-18: At that time did king Ahaz send to the kings of Assyria to help him.

"yet"
2Ch 28:20: 21: Tilgathpilneser king of Assyria came to him: and distressed him: but strengthened not him.
Jer 30:15: Why cry you for your affliction? your sorrow is incurable for the multitude of your iniquity: because your sins were increased: I have done these things to you.

 כִּ֣י אָנֹכִ֤י כַשַּׁ֙חַל֙ לְאֶפְרַ֔יִם וְכַכְּפִ֖יר לְבֵ֣ית יְהוּדָ֑ה אֲנִ֨י אֲנִ֤י אֶטְרֹף֙ וְאֵלֵ֔ךְ אֶשָּׂ֖א וְאֵ֥ין מַצִּֽיל׃

H3588כִּ֣יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֣יkî For Conj

14 For I will be to Ephraim as a lion, and as a young lion to the house of Judah: I, even I, will tear and go away; I will take away, and none will rescue him.Hosea 5:14
Stats
Counts: 163 characters, 28 words, 117 letters, 53 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֣י אָנֹכִ֤י כַשַּׁ֙חַל֙ לְאֶפְרַ֔יִם וְכַכְּפִ֖יר לְבֵ֣ית יְהוּדָ֑ה אֲנִ֨י אֲנִ֤י אֶטְרֹף֙ וְאֵלֵ֔ךְ אֶשָּׂ֖א וְאֵ֥ין מַצִּֽיל׃

Lit: For I will be like a lion to Ephraim and like a young lion to the house of Judah I even I will tear them and go away I will take them away and no one shall rescue

KJV: For I will be unto Ephraim as a lion, and as a young lion to the house of Judah: I, [even] I, will tear and go away; I will take away, and none shall rescue [him].
References

"as a lion"
Ho 13:7: 8: Therefore I will be to them as a lion: as a leopard by the way will I observe them:
Job 10:16: For it increases. You hunt me as a fierce lion: and again you shew yourself marvellous upon me.
Ps 7:2: Lest he tear my soul like a lion: rending it in pieces: while there is none to deliver.
La 3:10: He was to me as a bear lying in wait: and as a lion in secret places.
Am 3:4-8: Will a lion roar in the for: when he has no prey? will a young lion cry out of his den: if he have not takenhing?

"will tear"
Ps 7:2: Lest he tear my soul like a lion: rending it in pieces: while there is none to deliver.
Ps 50:22: Now consider this: you that forget God: lest I tear you in pieces: and there be none to deliver.
Mic 5:8: The remnant of Jacob will be among the Gentiles in the middle of many people as a lion among the beasts of the for: as a young lion among the flocks of sheep: who: if he go through: both treads down: and tears in pieces: and none can deliver.

"none"
De 28:31: Your ox will be killed before your eyes: and you will not eat thereof: your ass will be violently taken away from before your face: and will not be restored to you: your sheep will be given to your enemies: and you will have none to rescue them.
Job 10:7: You know that I not am wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of your hand.
Isa 5:29: Their roaring will be like a lion: they will roar like young lions: yes: they will roar: and lay hold of the prey: and will carry it away safe: and none will deliver it.
Am 2:14: Therefore the flight will perish from the swift: and the strong will not strengthen his force: neither will the mighty deliver himself:

 אֵלֵ֤ךְ אָשׁ֙וּבָה֙ אֶל־מְקֹומִ֔י עַ֥ד אֲשֶֽׁר־יֶאְשְׁמ֖וּ וּבִקְשׁ֣וּ פָנָ֑י בַּצַּ֥ר לָהֶ֖ם יְשַׁחֲרֻֽנְנִי׃

H7836יְשַׁחֲרֻֽנְנִי׃yə-ša-ḥă-run-nî.   (V-Piel-Imperf-3mp | 1cs, Pn)
H7836 שָׁחַר shâchar shaw-khar a primitive root; properly, to dawn, i.e. (figuratively) be (up) early at any task (with the implication of earnestness); by extension, to search for (with painstaking); (do something) betimes, enquire early, rise (seek) betimes, seek diligently) early, in the morning). 		יְשַׁחֲרֻֽנְנִי׃yə-ša-ḥă-run-nî. they will earnestly seek Me V-Piel-Imperf-3mp | 1cs, Pn

Translation

KJV: I will go and return to my place, till they acknowledge their offence, and seek my face: in their affliction they will seek me early.

6
The Unrepentance of Israel and Judah

לְכוּ֙ וְנָשׁ֣וּבָה אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה כִּ֛י ה֥וּא טָרָ֖ף וְיִרְפָּאֵ֑נוּ יַ֖ךְ וְיַחְבְּשֵֽׁנוּ׃

Translation
Hebrew: לְכוּ֙ וְנָשׁ֣וּבָה אֶל־יְהוָ֔ה כִּ֛י ה֥וּא טָרָ֖ף וְיִרְפָּאֵ֑נוּ יַ֖ךְ וְיַחְבְּשֵֽׁנוּ׃

Lit: Come and let us return to Yahweh For He has torn but He will heal us He has stricken but He will bind us up

KJV: Come, and let us return unto the LORD: for he hath torn, and he will heal us; he hath smitten, and he will bind us up.

H2421 חָיָה châyâh khaw-yaw a primitive root (compare חָוָה, חָיָה); to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive; keep (leave, make) alive, idiom certainly, give (promise) life, (let, suffer to) live, nourish up, preserve (alive), quicken, recover, repair, restore (to life), revive, (idiom God) save (alive, life, lives), idiom surely, be whole. 		וְנִחְיֶ֥הwə-niḥ-yeh that we may live Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjImperf-1cp
H6440לְפָנָֽיו׃lə-p̄ā-nāw.   (Prep-l | N-cpc | 3ms)
H6440 פָּנִים pânîym paw-neem plural (but always as singular) of an unused noun פָּנֶה; from פָּנָה); the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.); phrase accept, a-(be-) fore(-time), against, anger, idiom as (long as), at, phrase battle, phrase because (of), phrase beseech, countenance, edge, phrase employ, endure, phrase enquire, face, favour, fear of, for, forefront(-part), form(-er time, -ward), from, front, heaviness, idiom him(-self), phrase honourable, phrase impudent, phrase in, it, look(-eth) (-s), idiom me, phrase meet, idiom more than, mouth, of, off, (of) old (time), idiom on, open, phrase out of, over against, the partial, person, phrase please, presence, propect, was purposed, by reason of, phrase regard, right forth, phrase serve, idiom shewbread, sight, state, straight, phrase street, idiom thee, idiom them(-selves), through (phrase -out), till, time(-s) past, (un-) to(-ward), phrase upon, upside (phrase down), with(-in, phrase -stand), idiom ye, idiom you. 		לְפָנָֽיו׃lə-p̄ā-nāw. in His sight Prep-l | N-cpc | 3ms
2 After two days will he revive us: in the third day he will raise us up, and we will live in his sight.Hosea 6:2
Stats
Counts: 103 characters, 21 words, 78 letters, 29 vowels, 49 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יְחַיֵּ֖נוּ מִיֹּמָ֑יִם בַּיֹּום֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י יְקִמֵ֖נוּ וְנִחְיֶ֥ה לְפָנָֽיו׃

Lit: He will revive us after two days On day the third He will raise us up that we may live in His sight

KJV: After two days will he revive us: in the third day he will raise us up, and we shall live in his sight.
References

"two"
Ho 13:14: I will ransom them from the power of the grave; I will redeem them from death: O death: I will be your plagues; O grave: I will be your destruction: repentance will be hid from my eyes.
2Ki 20:5: Turn again: and tell Hezekiah the captain of my people: Thus says the LORD: the God of David your father: I have heard your prayer: I have seen your tears: look: I will heal you: on the third day you will go up to the house of the LORD.
Ps 30:4: Sing to the LORD: O you saints of His: and give thanks at the remembrance of His holiness.
Isa 26:19: Your dead men will live: together with my dead body will they arise. Awake and sing: you that dwell in dust: for your dew is as the dew of herbs: and the earth will cast out the dead.
Eze 37:11-13: Then He said to me: Son of man: these bones are the whole house of Israel: look: they say: Our bones are dried: and our hope is lost: we are cut off for our parts.
1Co 15:4: That he was buried: and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures:

"we"
Ge 17:18: Abraham said to God: O that Ishmael might live before you!
Ps 61:7: He will abide before God for ever: O prepare mercy and truth: which may preserve Him.
Joh 14:19: Yet a little while: and the world sees me no more; but you see me: because I live: you will live also.
Ro 14:8: For whether we live: we live to the Lord; and whether we die: we die to the Lord: whether we live therefore: or die: we are the Lord's.

3 Then will we know, if we follow on to know the LORD: His going forth is prepared as the morning; and He will come to us as the rain, as the latter and former rain to the earth.Hosea 6:3
Stats
Counts: 184 characters, 32 words, 140 letters, 51 vowels, 89 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְנֵדְעָ֣ה נִרְדְּפָ֗ה לָדַ֙עַת֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֔ה כְּשַׁ֖חַר נָכֹ֣ון מֹֽוצָאֹ֑ו וְיָבֹ֤וא כַגֶּ֙שֶׁם֙ לָ֔נוּ כְּמַלְקֹ֖ושׁ יֹ֥ורֶה אָֽרֶץ׃

Lit: And let us know let us pursue the knowledge of Yahweh As the morning is established His going forth and He will come like the rain to us Like the latter and former rain to the earth

KJV: Then shall we know, if we follow on to know the LORD: his going forth is prepared as the morning; and he shall come unto us as the rain, as the latter [and] former rain unto the earth.
References

"we know"
Ho 2:20: I will even betroth you to me in faithfulness: and you will know the LORD.
Isa 54:13: All your children will be taught of the LORD; and great will be the peace of your children.
Jer 24:7: I will give them an heart to know me: that I am the LORD: and they will be my people: and I will be their God: for they will return to me with their whole heart.
Mic 4:2: Many nations will come: and say: Come: and let us go up to the mountain of the LORD: and to the house of the God of Jacob; and He will teach us of His ways: and we will walk in His paths: for the law will go forth of Zion: and the word of the LORD from Jerusalem.
Joh 17:3: This is life eternal: that they might know you the only true God: and Jesus Christ: whom you have sent.

"if"
Pr 2:1-5: My son: if you will receive my words: and hide my commandments with you;
Mt 13:11: He answered and said to them: Because it is given to you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven: but to them it not is given.
Joh 7:17: If any man will do His will: He will know of the doctrine: whether it be of God: or whether I speak of myself.
Ac 17:11: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica: in that they received the word with all readiness of mind: and searched the scriptures daily: whether those things were so.
Php 3:13-15: Brothers: I not count myself to have apprehended: but this one thing I do: forgetting those things which are behind: and reaching forth to those things which are before:
Heb 3:14: For we are made partakers of Christ: if we hold the beginning of our confidence stedfast to the end;

"his going"
2Sa 23:4: he will be as the light of the morning: when the sun rises: even a morning without clouds; as the tender grass springing out of the earth by clear shining after rain.
Ps 19:4: Their line is gone out through all the earth: and their words to the end of the world. In them has he set a tabernacle for the sun:
Pr 4:18: But the path of the just is as the shining light: that shines more and more to the perfect day.
Mal 4:2: But to you that fear my name will the Sun of righteousness arise with healing in his wings; and you will go forth: and grow up as calves of the stall.
Lu 1:78: Through the tender mercy of our God; whereby the dayspring from on high has visited us:
2Pe 1:19: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; to what you do well that you take heed: as to a light that shines in a dark place: until the day dawn: and the day star arise in your hearts:
Re 22:16: I Jesus have sent my angel to testify to you these things in the churches. I am the root and the offspring of David: and the bright and morning star.

"as the rain"
Ho 10:12: Sow to yourselves in righteousness: reap in mercy; break up your fallow ground: for it is time to seek the LORD: till He come and rain righteousness upon you.
Ho 14:5: I will be as the dew to Israel: he will grow as the lily: and cast forth his roots as Lebanon.
De 32:2: My doctrine will drop as the rain: my speech will distil as the dew: as the small rain upon the tender herb: and as the showers upon the grass:
Job 29:23: They waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.
Ps 65:9: You visit the earth: and water it: you greatly enrich it with the river of God: which is full of water: you prepare them grain: when you have so provided for it.
Ps 72:6: He will come down like rain upon the mown grass: as showers that water the earth.
Isa 5:6: I will lay it waste: it will not be pruned: nor digged; but there will come up briers and thorns: I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.
Isa 32:15: Until the spirit be poured upon us from on high: and the wilderness be a fruitful field: and the fruitful field be counted for a for.
Isa 44:3: For I will pour water upon him that is thirsty: and floods upon the dry ground: I will pour my spirit upon your seed: and my blessing upon your offspring:
Eze 36:25: Then will I sprinkle clean water upon you: and you will be clean: from all your filthiness: and from all your idols: will I cleanse you.
Joe 2:23: 24: Be glad then: you children of Zion: and rejoice in the LORD your God: for He has given you the former rain moderately: and He will cause to come down for you the rain: the former rain: and the latter rain in the first month.
Mic 5:7: The remnant of Jacob will be in the middle of many people as a dew from the LORD: as the showers upon the grass: that tarries not for man: nor waits for the sons of men.
Zec 10:1: Ask you of the LORD rain in the time of the latter rain; so the LORD will make bright clouds: and give them showers of rain: to every one grass in the field.

H4100מָ֤הmāh   (Interrog)
H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		מָ֤הmāh What Interrog

H7925 שָׁכַם shâkam shaw-kam a primitive root; properly, to incline (the shoulder to a burden); but used only as denominative from שְׁכֶם; literally, to load up (on the back of man or beast), i.e. to start early in the morning; (arise, be up, get (oneself) up, rise up) early (betimes), morning. 		מַשְׁכִּ֥יםmaš-kîm early V-Hifil-Prtcpl-ms

4 O Ephraim, what will I do to you? O Judah, what will I do to you? for your goodness is as a morning cloud, and as the early dew it goes away.Hosea 6:4
Stats
Counts: 150 characters, 27 words, 113 letters, 47 vowels, 66 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מָ֤ה אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לְּךָ֙ אֶפְרַ֔יִם מָ֥ה אֶעֱשֶׂה־לְּךָ֖ יְהוּדָ֑ה וְחַסְדְּכֶם֙ כַּֽעֲנַן־בֹּ֔קֶר וְכַטַּ֖ל מַשְׁכִּ֥ים הֹלֵֽךְ׃

Lit: What shall I do to you Ephraim what shall I do to you Judah for your faithfulness is like a cloud morning and like the dew early it goes away

KJV: O Ephraim, what shall I do unto thee? O Judah, what shall I do unto thee? for your goodness is as a morning cloud, and as the early dew it goeth away.
References

"what"

Isa 5:3: 4: Now: O inhabitants of Jerusalem: and men of Judah: judge: I pray you: betwixt me and my vineyard.
Jer 3:19: But I said: How will I put you among the children: and give you a pleasant land: a goodly heritage of the hosts of nations? and I said: You will call me: My father; and will not turn away from me.
Jer 5:7: 9: 23: How will I pardon you for this? your children have forsaken me: and sworn by them that are no gods: when I had fed them to the full: they then committed adultery: and assembled themselves by troops in the harlots' houses.
Jer 9:7: Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts: Look: I will melt them: and try them; for how will I do for the daughter of my people?
Lu 13:7-9: Then said he to the dresser of his vineyard: Look: these 3 years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree: and find none: cut it down; why cumbereth it the ground?
Lu 19:41: 42: When he was come near: he beheld the city: and wept over it:

"for"

Mt 13:21: Yet has not he root in himself: but endures for a while: for when tribulation or persecution arises because of the word: soon he is offended.

"as a"

5 Therefore have I hewed them by the prophets; I have killed them by the words of my mouth: and your judgments are as the light that goes forth.Hosea 6:5
Stats
Counts: 145 characters, 22 words, 111 letters, 36 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֗ן חָצַ֙בְתִּי֙ בַּנְּבִיאִ֔ים הֲרַגְתִּ֖ים בְּאִמְרֵי־פִ֑י וּמִשְׁפָּטֶ֖יךָ אֹ֥ור יֵצֵֽא׃

Lit: Upon thus I have hewn them by the prophets I have slain them by the words of My mouth and your judgments are like light that goes forth

KJV: Therefore have I hewed them by the prophets; I have slain them by the words of my mouth: and thy judgments [are as] the light [that] goeth forth.

"have I"

H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֛יkî For Conj

6 For I desired mercy, not and sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.Hosea 6:6
Stats
Rank: #1538 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 91 characters, 14 words, 73 letters, 26 vowels, 47 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֛י חֶ֥סֶד חָפַ֖צְתִּי וְלֹא־זָ֑בַח וְדַ֥עַת אֱלֹהִ֖ים מֵעֹלֹֽות׃

Lit: For mercy I desire and not sacrifice and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings

KJV: For I desired mercy, and not sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
References

"I desired"
1Sa 15:22: Samuel said: Has the LORD as great delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices: as in obeying the voice of the LORD? Look: to obey is better than sacrifice: and to listen than the fat of rams.
Ps 50:8: I not will reprove you for your sacrifices or your burnt offerings: to have been continually before me.
Pr 21:3: To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.
Ec 5:1: Keep your foot when you go to the house of God: and be more ready to hear: than to give the sacrifice of fools: for they not consider that they do evil.
Isa 1:11: To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices to me? says the LORD: I am full of the burnt offerings of rams: and the fat of fed beasts; and I not delight in the blood of bullocks: or of lambs: or of He goats.
Isa 58:6: Is not this the fast that I have chosen? to loose the bands of wickedness: to undo the heavy burdens: and to let the oppressed go free: and that you break every yoke?
Jer 7:22: For I spoke not to your fathers: nor commanded them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt: concerning burnt offerings or sacrifices:
Da 4:27: For what reason: O king: let my counsel be acceptable to you: and break off your sins by righteousness: and your iniquities by shewing mercy to the poor; if it may be a lengthening of your tranquillity.
Am 5:21: I hate: I despise your feast days: and I not will smell in your solemn assemblies.
Mic 6:6: Wherewith will I come before the LORD: and bow myself before the high God? will I come before Him with burnt offerings: with calves of a year old?
Mt 5:7: Blessed are the merciful: for they will obtain mercy.
Mt 9:13: But go you and learn what that means: I will have mercy: not and sacrifice: for I not am come to call the righteous: but sinners to repentance.
Mt 12:7: But if you had known what this means: I will have mercy: not and sacrifice: you not would have condemned the guiltless.

"the"
Ho 4:1: Hear the word of the LORD: you children of Israel: for the LORD has a controversy with the inhabitants of the land: because there is no truth: nor mercy: nor knowledge of God in the land.
1Ch 28:9: you: Solomon my son: know you the God of your father: and serve Him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind: for the LORD searches all hearts: and understands all the imaginations of the thoughts: if you seek Him: He will be found of you; but if you forsake Him: He will cast you off for ever.
Jer 22:16: He judged the cause of the poor and needy; then it was well with Him: was not this to know me? says the LORD.
1Jo 2:3: Hereby we do know that we know him: if we keep his commandments.
1Jo 3:6: Whoever abides in him sins'>sins not: whoever sins'>sins has not seen him: neither known him.

H1992וְהֵ֕מָּהwə-hêm-māh   (Conj-w | Pro-3mp)

H1285 בְּרִית bᵉrîyth ber-eeth from בָּרָה (in the sense of cutting (like בָּרָא)); a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh); confederacy, (con-) feder(-ate), covenant, league. 		בְרִ֑יתḇə-rîṯ; the covenant N-fs
H8033שָׁ֖םšām   (Adv)
H8033 שָׁם shâm shawm a primitive particle (rather from the relative pronoun, אֲשֶׁר); there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence; in it, phrase thence, there (-in, phrase of, phrase out), phrase thither, phrase whither. 		שָׁ֖םšām there Adv
H898בָּ֥גְדוּbā-ḡə-ḏū   (V-Qal-Perf-3cp)
H898 בָּגַד bâgad baw-gad a primitive root; to cover (with a garment); figuratively, to act covertly; by implication, to pillage; deal deceitfully (treacherously, unfaithfully), offend, transgress(-or), (depart), treacherous (dealer, -ly, man), unfaithful(-ly, man), idiom very. 		בָּ֥גְדוּbā-ḡə-ḏū they dealt treacherously V-Qal-Perf-3cp
Hבִֽי׃ḇî.   (Prep | 1cs)
 		בִֽי׃ḇî. with Me Prep | 1cs
7 But they like men have transgressed the covenant: there have they dealt treacherously against me.Hosea 6:7
Stats
Rank: #3492 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 97 characters, 14 words, 81 letters, 30 vowels, 51 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהֵ֕מָּה כְּאָדָ֖ם עָבְר֣וּ בְרִ֑ית שָׁ֖ם בָּ֥גְדוּ בִֽי׃

Lit: But they like men transgressed the covenant there they dealt treacherously with Me

KJV: But they like men have transgressed the covenant: there have they dealt treacherously against me.
References

"men"
Ge 3:6: 11: When the woman saw that the tree was good for food: and that it was pleasant to the eyes: and a tree to be desired to make one wise: she took of the fruit thereof: and did eat: and gave also to her husband with her; and he did eat.
Job 31:33: If I covered my transgressions as Adam: by hiding my iniquity in my bosom:

"transgressed"
Ho 8:1: Set the trumpet to your mouth. He will come as an eagle against the house of the LORD: because they have transgressed my covenant: and trespassed against my law.
2Ki 17:15: They rejected His statutes: and His covenant that He made with their fathers: and His testimonies which He testified against them; and they followed vanity: and became vain: and went after the heathen that were round about them: concerning whom the LORD had charged them: that they not should do like them.
Isa 24:5: The earth also is defiled under the inhabitants thereof; because they have transgressed the laws: changed the ordinance: broken the everlasting covenant.
Jer 31:32: Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day that I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt; which my covenant they brake: although I was an husband to them: says the LORD:
Eze 16:59-61: For thus says the Lord GOD; I will even deal with you as you have done: which have despised the oath in breaking the covenant.
Heb 8:9: Not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because they not continued in my covenant: and I regarded not them: says the Lord.

"they dealt"
Ho 5:7: They have dealt treacherously against the LORD: for they have begotten strange children: now will a month devour them with their portions.
Isa 24:16: From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs: even glory to the righteous. But I said: My leanness: my leanness: woe to me! the treacherous dealers have dealt treacherously; yes: the treacherous dealers have dealt very treacherously.
Isa 48:8: Yes: you heard not; yes: you knew not; yes: from that time that your ear not was opened: for I knew that you would deal very treacherously: and were called a transgressor from the womb.
Jer 3:7: I said after she had done all these things: Turn you to me. But she not returned. And her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
Jer 5:11: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me: says the LORD.
Jer 9:6: Your habitation is in the middle of deceit; through deceit they refuse to know me: says the LORD.

H1818מִדָּֽם׃mid-dām.   (Prep-m | N-ms)
H1818 דָּם dâm dawm from דָּמַם (compare אָדַם); blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood); blood(-y, -guiltiness, (-thirsty), phrase innocent. 		מִדָּֽם׃mid-dām. with blood Prep-m | N-ms
8 Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity, and is polluted with blood.Hosea 6:8
Stats
Rank: #4057 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 74 characters, 12 words, 57 letters, 22 vowels, 35 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: גִּלְעָ֕ד קִרְיַ֖ת פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן עֲקֻבָּ֖ה מִדָּֽם׃

Lit: Gilead is a city of evildoers And defiled with blood

KJV: Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity, [and is] polluted with blood.
References

"Gilead"
Ho 12:11: Is there iniquity in Gilead? surely they are vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yes: their altars are as heaps in the furrows of the fields.
Jos 21:38: Out of the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead with her suburbs: to be a city of refuge for the slayer; and Mahanaim with her suburbs:

"polluted with blood"
Ho 5:1: Hear you this: O priests; and listen: you house of Israel; and give you ear: O house of the king; for judgment is toward you: because you have been a snare on Mizpah: and a net spread upon Tabor.
2Sa 3:27: When Abner was returned to Hebron: Joab took him aside in the gate to speak with him quietly: and smote him there under the fifth rib: that he died: for the blood of Asahel his brother.
2Sa 20:8: When they were at the great stone which is in Gibeon: Amasa went before them. And Joab's garment that he had put on was girded to him: and upon it a girdle with a sword fastened upon his loins in the sheath thereof; and as he went forth it fell out.
1Ki 2:5: Moreover you know also what Joab the son of Zeruiah did to me: and what he did to the two captains of the hosts of Israel: to Abner the son of Ner: and to Amasa the son of Jether: whom he killed: and shed the blood of war in peace: and put the blood of war upon his girdle that was about his loins: and in his shoes that were on his feet.
Ps 10:8: He sits in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places does he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.
Ps 59:2: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity: and save me from bloody men.
Isa 59:6: Their webs will not become garments: neither will they cover themselves with their works: their works are works of iniquity: and the act of violence is in their hands.
Jer 11:19: But I was like a lamb or an ox that is brought to the slaughter; and I not knew that they had devised devices against me: saying: Let us destroy the tree with the fruit thereof: and let us cut him off from the land of the living: that his name may be no more remembered.
Mic 7:2: The good man is perished out of the earth: and there is none upright among men: they all lie in wait for blood; they hunt every man his brother with a net.
Mt 26:15: 16: Said to them: What will you give me: and I will deliver him to you? And they covenanted with him for 30 pieces of silver.
Ac 23:12-15: When it was day: certain of the Jews banded together: and bound themselves under a curse: saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul.
Ac 25:3: Desired favour against him: that he would send for him to Jerusalem: laying wait in the way to kill him.

9 As troops of robbers wait for a man, so the company of priests murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.Hosea 6:9
Stats
Rank: #5141 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 122 characters, 22 words, 96 letters, 32 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּכְחַכֵּ֨י אִ֜ישׁ גְּדוּדִ֗ים חֶ֚בֶר כֹּֽהֲנִ֔ים דֶּ֖רֶךְ יְרַצְּחוּ־שֶׁ֑כְמָה כִּ֥י זִמָּ֖ה עָשֽׂוּ׃

Lit: And as lie in wait for a man bands of robbers So the company of priests on the way murder to Shechem surely lewdness they commit

KJV: And as troops of robbers wait for a man, so the company of priests murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.
References

"as troops"
Ho 7:1: When I would have healed Israel: then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered: and the wickedness of Samaria: for they commit falsehood; and the thief comes in: and the troop of robbers spoils without.
Ezr 8:31: Then we departed from the river of Ahava on the twelfth day of the first month: to go to Jerusalem: and the hand of our God was upon us: and He delivered us from the hand of the enemy: and of such as lay in wait by the way.
Job 1:15-17: The Sabeans fell upon them: and took them away; yes: they have killed the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell you.
Pr 1:11-19: If they say: Come with us: let us lay wait for blood: let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:

"so"
Ho 5:1: Hear you this: O priests; and listen: you house of Israel; and give you ear: O house of the king; for judgment is toward you: because you have been a snare on Mizpah: and a net spread upon Tabor.
Jer 11:9: The LORD said to me: A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah: and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Eze 22:27: Her princes in the middle thereof are like wolves ravening the prey: to shed blood: and to destroy souls: to get dishon gain.
Mic 3:9: Hear this: I pray you: you heads of the house of Jacob: and princes of the house of Israel: that abhor judgment: and pervert all equity.
Zep 3:3: Her princes within her are roaring lions; her judges are evening wolves; they not gnaw the bones till the morrow.
Mr 14:1: After two days was the feast of the passover: and of unleavened bread: and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft: and put him to death.
Lu 22:2-6: The chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people.
Joh 11:47: Then gathered the chief priests and the Pharisees a council: and said: What do we? for this man does many miracles.
Ac 4:24: When they heard that: they lifted up their voice to God with one accord: and said: Lord: you are God: which have made heaven: and earth: and the sea: and all that in them is:

"by consent"
1Ki 12:25: Then Jeroboam built Shechem in mount Ephraim: and dwelt therein; and went out from there: and built Penuel.

10 I have seen an horrible thing in the house of Israel: there is the whoredom of Ephraim, Israel is defiled.Hosea 6:10
Stats
Rank: #5853 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 106 characters, 18 words, 84 letters, 37 vowels, 47 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בְּבֵית֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רָאִ֖יתִי [שַׁעֲרִירִיָּה כ] (שַׁעֲרֽוּרִיָּ֑ה ק) ם זְנ֣וּת לְאֶפְרַ֔יִם נִטְמָ֖א יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃

Lit: In the house of Israel I have seen a horrible thing there is the harlotry of Ephraim is defiled Israel

KJV: I have seen an horrible thing in the house of Israel: there is the whoredom of Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
References

"I have seen an horrible thing in the house of Israel: there is the whoredom of Ephraim, Israel is defiled."
Jer 2:12: 13: Be astonished: O you heavens: at this: and be horribly afraid: be you very desolate: says the LORD.
Jer 5:30: 31: A wonderful and horrible thing is committed in the land;
Jer 18:13: Therefore thus says the LORD; Ask you now among the heathen: who has heard such things: the virgin of Israel has done a very horrible thing.
Jer 23:14: I have seen also in the prophets of Jerusalem an horrible thing: they commit adultery: and walk in lies: they strengthen also the hands of evildoers: that none does return from his wickedness: they are all of them to me as Sodom: and the inhabitants thereof as Gomorrah.

"there"
Ho 4:11: 17: Whoredom and wine and new wine take away the heart.
Ho 5:3: I know Ephraim: and Israel not is hid from me: for now: O Ephraim: you commit whoredom: and Israel is defiled.

Eze 23:5: Aholah played the harlot when she was my; and she doted on her lovers: on the Assyrians her neighbours:

"he hath"

7
Ephraim’s Iniquity

כְּרָפְאִ֣י לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְנִגְלָ֞ה עֲוֹ֤ן אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ וְרָעֹ֣ות שֹֽׁמְרֹ֔ון כִּ֥י פָעֲל֖וּ שָׁ֑קֶר וְגַנָּ֣ב יָבֹ֔וא פָּשַׁ֥ט גְּד֖וּד בַּחֽוּץ׃

1 When I would have healed Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered, and the wickedness of Samaria: for they commit falsehood; and the thief comes in, and the troop of robbers spoils without.Hosea 7:1
Stats
Counts: 203 characters, 29 words, 164 letters, 65 vowels, 99 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כְּרָפְאִ֣י לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְנִגְלָ֞ה עֲוֹ֤ן אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ וְרָעֹ֣ות שֹֽׁמְרֹ֔ון כִּ֥י פָעֲל֖וּ שָׁ֑קֶר וְגַנָּ֣ב יָבֹ֔וא פָּשַׁ֥ט גְּד֖וּד בַּחֽוּץ׃

Lit: When I would have healed Israel and was uncovered the iniquity of Ephraim and the wickedness of Samaria for they have committed fraud and a thief comes in takes spoil a band of robbers outside

KJV: When I would have healed Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered, and the wickedness of Samaria: for they commit falsehood; and the thief cometh in, and the troop of robbers spoileth without.
References

"I would"
Jer 51:9: We would have healed Babylon: but she not is healed: forsake her: and let us go every one into his own country: for her judgment reaches to heaven: and is lifted up even to the skies.
Mt 23:37: O Jerusalem: Jerusalem: you that kill the prophets: and stone them which are sent to you: how often would I have gathered your children together: even as a hen gathers her chickens under her wings: and you not would!
Lu 13:34: O Jerusalem: Jerusalem: which kill the prophets: and stone them that are sent to you; how often would I have gathered your children together: as a hen does gather her brood under her wings: and you not would!
Lu 19:42: Saying: If you hadst known: even you: at least in this your day: the things which belong to your peace! but now they are hid from your eyes.

"the iniquity"
Ho 4:17: Ephraim is joined to idols: let him alone.
Ho 6:8: Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity: and is polluted with blood.
Ho 8:9: For they are gone up to Assyria: a wild ass alone by himself: Ephraim has hired lovers.
Isa 28:1: Woe to the crown of pride: to the drunkards of Ephraim: whose glorious beauty is a fading flower: which are on the head of the fat valleys of them that are overcome with wine!
Mic 6:16: For the statutes of Omri are kept: and all the works of the house of Ahab: and you walk in their counsels; that I should make you a desolation: and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore you will bear the reproach of my people.

"wickedness"
Ho 8:5: Your calf: O Samaria: has cast you off; my anger is kindled against them: how long will it be ere they attain to innocency?
Ho 10:5: The inhabitants of Samaria will fear because of the calves of Bethaven: for the people thereof will mourn over it: and the priests thereof that rejoiced on it: for the glory thereof: because it is departed from it.
Eze 16:46: your elder sister is Samaria: she and her daughters that dwell at your left hand: and your younger sister: that dwells at your right hand: is Sodom and her daughters.
Eze 23:4: The names of them were Aholah the elder: and Aholibah her sister: and they were my: and they bare sons and daughters. Thus were their names; Samaria is Aholah: and Jerusalem Aholibah.
Am 8:14: They that swear by the sin of Samaria: and say: Your god: O Dan: lives'>lives; and: The manner of Beersheba lives'>lives; even they will fall: and never rise up again.

"they commit"
Ho 5:1: Hear you this: O priests; and listen: you house of Israel; and give you ear: O house of the king; for judgment is toward you: because you have been a snare on Mizpah: and a net spread upon Tabor.
Ho 6:10: I have seen an horrible thing in the house of Israel: there is the whoredom of Ephraim: Israel is defiled.
Ho 11:12: Ephraim compasss me about with lies: and the house of Israel with deceit: but Judah yet rules with God: and is faithful with the saints.
Ho 12:1: Ephraim feeds on wind: and follows after the east wind: he daily increases lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians: and oil is carried into Egypt.
Isa 59:12: For our transgressions are multiplied before you: and our sins testify against us: for our transgressions are with us; and as for our iniquities: we know them;
Jer 9:2-6: Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging place of wayfaring men; that I might leave my people: and go from them! for they be all adulterers: an assembly of treacherous men.
Mic 7:3-7: That they may do evil with both hands earnestly: the prince asks: and the judge asks for a reward; and the great man: he utters his mischievous desire: so they wrap it up.

"the troop"
Ho 6:9: As troops of robbers wait for a man: so the company of priests murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.

 וּבַל־יֹֽאמְרוּ֙ לִלְבָבָ֔ם כָּל־רָעָתָ֖ם זָכָ֑רְתִּי עַתָּה֙ סְבָב֣וּם מַֽעַלְלֵיהֶ֔ם נֶ֥גֶד פָּנַ֖י הָיֽוּ׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H1077וּבַל־ū-ḇal-   (Conj-w | Adv)
H1077 בַּל bal bal from בָּלָה; properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest; lest, neither, no, none (that...), not (any), nothing. 		וּבַל־ū-ḇal- And not Conj-w | Adv
H559יֹֽאמְרוּ֙yō-mə-rū   (V-Qal-Imperf-3mp)

2 They not consider in their hearts that I remember all their wickedness: now their own doings have beset them about; they are before my face.Hosea 7:2
Stats
Counts: 144 characters, 24 words, 116 letters, 44 vowels, 72 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּבַל־יֹֽאמְרוּ֙ לִלְבָבָ֔ם כָּל־רָעָתָ֖ם זָכָ֑רְתִּי עַתָּה֙ סְבָב֣וּם מַֽעַלְלֵיהֶ֔ם נֶ֥גֶד פָּנַ֖י הָיֽוּ׃

Lit: And not they do consider in their hearts all their wickedness That I remember now have surrounded them their own deeds before My face they are

KJV: And they consider not in their hearts that I remember all their wickedness: now their own doings have beset them about; they are before my face.
References

"consider not in"
De 32:29: O that they were wise: that they understood this: that they would consider their latter end!
Ps 50:22: Now consider this: you that forget God: lest I tear you in pieces: and there be none to deliver.
Isa 1:3: The ox knows his owner: and the ass his master's crib: but Israel does not know: my people does not consider.
Isa 5:12: The harp: and the viol: the tabret: and pipe: and wine: are in their feasts: but they not regard the work of the LORD: neither consider the operation of His hands.
Isa 44:19: None considers in his heart: neither is there knowledge nor understanding to say: I have burned part of it in the fire; yes: also I have baked bread upon the coals thereof; I have roasted flesh: and eaten it: and will I make the residue thereof an abomination? will I fall down to the stock of a tree?

"I remember"
Ho 9:9: They have deeply corrupted themselves: as in the days of Gibeah: therefore he will remember their iniquity: he will visit their sins.
Ps 25:7: not Remember the sins of my youth: nor my transgressions: according to your mercy remember you me for your goodness' sake: O LORD.
Jer 14:10: Thus says the LORD to this people: Thus have they loved to wander: they not have refrained their feet: therefore the LORD does not accept them; He will now remember their iniquity: and visit their sins.
Am 8:7: The LORD has sworn by the excellency of Jacob: Surely I will never forget any of their works.
Lu 12:2: For there not ishing covered: that will not be revealed; neither hid: that will not be known.
1Co 4:5: Therefore not judgehing before the time: until the Lord come: who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness: and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts: and then will every man have praise of God.

"their own"
Nu 32:23: But if you not will do so: look: you have sinned against the LORD: and be sure your sin will find you out.
Job 20:11-29: His bones are full of the sin of his youth: which will lie down with him in the dust.
Ps 9:16: The LORD is known by the judgment which He executes: the wicked is snared in the work of His own hands. Higgaion. Selah.
Pr 5:22: His own iniquities will take the wicked himself: and he will be holden with the cords of his sins.
Isa 26:16: LORD: in trouble have they visited you: they poured out a prayer when your chastening was upon them.
Jer 2:19: Your own wickedness will correct you: and your backslidings will reprove you: know therefore and see that it is an evil thing and bitter: that you have forsaken the LORD your God: and that my fear is not in you: says the Lord GOD of hosts.
Jer 4:18: Your way and your doings have procured these things to you; this is your wickedness: because it is bitter: because it reaches to your heart.

"are before"
Job 34:21: For his eyes are upon the ways of man: and he sees all his goings.
Ps 90:8: You have set our iniquities before you: our secret sins in the light of your face.
Pr 5:21: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD: and He ponders all His goings.
Jer 16:17: For my eyes are upon all their ways: they not are hid from my face: neither is their iniquity hid from my eyes.
Jer 32:19: Great in counsel: and mighty in work: for your eyes are open upon all the ways of the sons of men: to give every one according to his ways: and according to the fruit of his doings:
Heb 4:13: Neither is there any creature that not is manifest in his sight: but all things are naked and opened to the eyes of him with whom we have to do.

 בְּרָעָתָ֖ם יְשַׂמְּחוּ־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּבְכַחֲשֵׁיהֶ֖ם שָׂרִֽים׃

3 They make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes with their lies.Hosea 7:3
Stats
Counts: 79 characters, 13 words, 64 letters, 21 vowels, 43 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בְּרָעָתָ֖ם יְשַׂמְּחוּ־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּבְכַחֲשֵׁיהֶ֖ם שָׂרִֽים׃

Lit: With their wickedness they make glad a king and with their lies princes

KJV: They make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes with their lies.
References

"They make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes with their lies."
Ho 5:11: Ephraim is oppressed and broken in judgment: because he willingly walked after the commandment.
1Ki 22:6: 13: Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together: about 400 men: and said to them: Will I go against Ramothgilead to battle: or will I forbear? And they said: Go up; for the Lord will deliver it into the hand of the king.
Jer 5:31: The prophets prophesy falsely: and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love to have it so: and what will you do in the end thereof?
Jer 9:2: Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging place of wayfaring men; that I might leave my people: and go from them! for they be all adulterers: an assembly of treacherous men.
Jer 28:1-4: It came to pass the same year: in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah: in the fourth year: and in the fifth month: that Hananiah the son of Azur the prophet: which was of Gibeon: spoke to me in the house of the LORD: in the presence of the priests and of all the people: saying:
Jer 37:19: Where are now your prophets which prophesied to you: saying: The king of Babylon will not come against you: nor against this land?
Am 7:10-13: Then Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel: saying: Amos has conspired against you in the middle of the house of Israel: the land not is able to bear all his words.
Mic 6:16: For the statutes of Omri are kept: and all the works of the house of Ahab: and you walk in their counsels; that I should make you a desolation: and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore you will bear the reproach of my people.
Mic 7:3: That they may do evil with both hands earnestly: the prince asks: and the judge asks for a reward; and the great man: he utters his mischievous desire: so they wrap it up.
Ro 1:32: Who knowing the judgment of God: that they which commit such things are worthy of death: not only do the same: but have pleasure in them that do them.
1Jo 4:5: They are of the world: therefore speak they of the world: and the world hears them.

4 They are all adulterers, as an oven heated by the baker, who ceases from raising after he has kneaded the dough, until it be leavened.Hosea 7:4
Stats
Counts: 138 characters, 21 words, 108 letters, 44 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כֻּלָּם֙ מְנָ֣אֲפִ֔ים כְּמֹ֣ו תַנּ֔וּר בֹּעֵ֖רָה מֵֽאֹפֶ֑ה יִשְׁבֹּ֣ות מֵעִ֔יר מִלּ֥וּשׁ בָּצֵ֖ק עַד־חֻמְצָתֹֽו׃

Lit: They are all adulterers Like an oven heated by a baker He ceases stirring the fire after kneading the dough Until it is leavened

KJV: They are all adulterers, as an oven heated by the baker, [who] ceaseth from raising after he hath kneaded the dough, until it be leavened.
References

"are all"
Ho 4:2: 12: By swearing: and lying: and killing: and stealing: and committing adultery: they break out: and blood touches blood.
Jer 5:7: 8: How will I pardon you for this? your children have forsaken me: and sworn by them that are no gods: when I had fed them to the full: they then committed adultery: and assembled themselves by troops in the harlots' houses.
Jer 9:2: Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging place of wayfaring men; that I might leave my people: and go from them! for they be all adulterers: an assembly of treacherous men.
Jas 4:4: You adulterers and adulteresses: know you not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.

"as"
Ho 7:6: 7: For they have made ready their heart like an oven: while they lie in wait: their baker sleeps all the night; in the morning it burns as a flaming fire.

 יֹ֣ום מַלְכֵּ֔נוּ הֶחֱל֥וּ שָׂרִ֖ים חֲמַ֣ת מִיָּ֑יִן מָשַׁ֥ךְ יָדֹ֖ו אֶת־לֹצְצִֽים׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H3117י֣וֹםyō-wm   (N-msc)
H3117 יוֹם yôwm yome from an unused root meaning to be hot; a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb); age, phrase always, phrase chronicals, continually(-ance), daily, ((birth-), each, to) day, (now a, two) days (agone), phrase elder, idiom end, phrase evening, phrase (for) ever(-lasting, -more), idiom full, life, as (so) long as (... live), (even) now, phrase old, phrase outlived, phrase perpetually, presently, phrase remaineth, idiom required, season, idiom since, space, then, (process of) time, phrase as at other times, phrase in trouble, weather, (as) when, (a, the, within a) while (that), idiom whole (phrase age), (full) year(-ly), phrase younger. 		י֣וֹםyō-wm In the day N-msc

H2470הֶחֱל֥וּhe-ḥĕ-lū   (V-Hifil-Perf-3cp)
H2470 חָלָה châlâh khaw-law a primitive root (compare חוּל, חָלָה, חָלַל); properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat; beseech, (be) diseased, (put to) grief, be grieved, (be) grievous, infirmity, intreat, lay to, put to pain, idiom pray, make prayer, be (fall, make) sick, sore, be sorry, make suit (idiom supplication), woman in travail, be (become) weak, be wounded. 		הֶחֱל֥וּhe-ḥĕ-lū have made him sick V-Hifil-Perf-3cp

H8269 שַׂר sar sar from שָׂרַר; a head person (of any rank or class); captain (that had rule), chief (captain), general, governor, keeper, lord,(-task-)master, prince(-ipal), ruler, steward. 		שָׂרִ֖יםśā-rîm Princes N-mp

H4900 מָשַׁךְ mâshak maw-shak a primitive root; to draw, used in a great variety of applications (including to sow, to sound, to prolong, to develop, to march, to remove, to delay, to be tall, etc.); draw (along, out), continue, defer, extend, forbear, idiom give, handle, make (pro-, sound) long, idiom sow, scatter, stretch out. 		מָשַׁ֥ךְmā-šaḵ He stretched out V-Qal-Perf-3ms
H3027יָד֖וֹyā-ḏōw   (N-fsc | 3ms)
H3027 יָד yâd yawd a primitive word; in distinction from כַּף, the closed one); used (as noun, adverb, etc.) in a great variety of applications, both literally and figuratively, both proximate and remote (as follows); a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),; (phrase be) able, idiom about, phrase armholes, at, axletree, because of, beside, border, idiom bounty, phrase broad, (broken-) handed, idiom by, charge, coast, phrase consecrate, phrase creditor, custody, debt, dominion, idiom enough, phrase fellowship, force, idiom from, hand(-staves, -y work), idiom he, himself, idiom in, labour, phrase large, ledge, (left-) handed, means, idiom mine, ministry, near, idiom of, idiom order, ordinance, idiom our, parts, pain, power, idiom presumptuously, service, side, sore, state, stay, draw with strength, stroke, phrase swear, terror, idiom thee, idiom by them, idiom themselves, idiom thine own, idiom thou, through, idiom throwing, phrase thumb, times, idiom to, idiom under, idiom us, idiom wait on, (way-) side, where, phrase wide, idiom with (him, me, you), work, phrase yield, idiom yourselves. 		יָד֖וֹyā-ḏōw his hand N-fsc | 3ms
H854אֶת־’eṯ-   (Prep)
H854 אֵת ʼêth ayth probably from אָנָה; properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.; against, among, before, by, for, from, in(-to), (out) of, with. Often with another prepositional prefix. 		אֶת־’eṯ- with Prep
H3945לֹצְצִֽים׃lō-ṣə-ṣîm.   (V-Piel-Prtcpl-mp)
H3945 לָצַץ lâtsats law-tsats a primitive root; to deride; scorn. 		לֹצְצִֽים׃lō-ṣə-ṣîm. scoffers V-Piel-Prtcpl-mp
5 In the day of our king the princes have made him sick with bottles of wine; he stretched out his hand with scorners.Hosea 7:5
Stats
Counts: 116 characters, 22 words, 92 letters, 32 vowels, 60 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יֹ֣ום מַלְכֵּ֔נוּ הֶחֱל֥וּ שָׂרִ֖ים חֲמַ֣ת מִיָּ֑יִן מָשַׁ֥ךְ יָדֹ֖ו אֶת־לֹצְצִֽים׃

Lit: In the day of our king have made him sick Princes inflamed with wine He stretched out his hand with scoffers

KJV: In the day of our king the princes have made him sick with bottles of wine; he stretched out his hand with scorners.
References

"the day"
Ge 40:20: It came to pass the third day: which was Pharaoh's birthday: that he made a feast to all his servants: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his servants.
Da 5:1-4: Belshazzar the king made a great feast to a000 of his lords: and drank wine before the000.
Mt 14:6: But when Herod's birthday was kept: the daughter of Herodias danced before them: and pleased Herod.
Mr 6:21: When a convenient day was come: that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords: high captains: and chief estates of Galilee;

"made"
Pr 20:1: Wine is a mocker: strong drink is raging: and whoever is deceived thereby not is wise.
Isa 5:11: 12: 22: 23: Woe to them that rise up early in the morning: that they may follow strong drink; that continue until night: till wine inflame them!
Isa 28:1: 7: 8: Woe to the crown of pride: to the drunkards of Ephraim: whose glorious beauty is a fading flower: which are on the head of the fat valleys of them that are overcome with wine!
Hab 2:15: 16: Woe to him that gives his neighbour drink: that put your bottle to him: and make him drunken also: that you may look on their nakedness!
Eph 5:18: not be drunk with wine: wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;
1Pe 4:3: 4: For the time past of our life may suffice us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles: when we walked in lasciviousness: lusts: excess of wine: revellings: banquetings: and abominable idolatries:

"he stretched"
1Ki 13:4: It came to pass: when king Jeroboam heard the saying of the man of God: which had cried against the altar in Bethel: that He put forth His hand from the altar: saying: Lay hold on Him. And His hand: which He put forth against Him: dried up: so that He not could pull it in again to Him.

"with scorners"
Ps 1:1: Blessed is the man that walks not in the counsel of the ungodly: nor stands in the way of sinners: nor sits in the seat of the scornful.
Ps 69:12: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.
Pr 13:20: He who walks with wise men will be wise: but a companion of fools will be destroyed.
Pr 23:29-35: Who has woe? who has sorrow? who has contentions? who has babbling? who has wounds without cause? who has redness of eyes?
Da 5:4: 23: They drank wine: and praised the gods of gold: and of silver: of brass: of iron: of wood: and of stone.

 כִּֽי־קֵרְב֧וּ כַתַּנּ֛וּר לִבָּ֖ם בְּאָרְבָּ֑ם כָּל־הַלַּ֙יְלָה֙ יָשֵׁ֣ן אֹֽפֵהֶ֔ם בֹּ֕קֶר ה֥וּא בֹעֵ֖ר כְּאֵ֥שׁ לֶהָבָֽה׃

H3588כִּֽי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּֽי־kî- For Conj

6 For they have made ready their heart like an oven, while they lie in wait: their baker sleeps all the night; in the morning it burns as a flaming fire.Hosea 7:6
Stats
Counts: 156 characters, 27 words, 123 letters, 48 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּֽי־קֵרְב֧וּ כַתַּנּ֛וּר לִבָּ֖ם בְּאָרְבָּ֑ם כָּל־הַלַּ֙יְלָה֙ יָשֵׁ֣ן אֹֽפֵהֶ֔ם בֹּ֕קֶר ה֥וּא בֹעֵ֖ר כְּאֵ֥שׁ לֶהָבָֽה׃

Lit: For they prepare like an oven their heart while they lie in wait all night sleeps their baker in the morning it burns like a fire flaming

KJV: For they have made ready their heart like an oven, whiles they lie in wait: their baker sleepeth all the night; in the morning it burneth as a flaming fire.
References

"they"
Ho 7:4: 7: They are all adulterers: as an oven heated by the baker: who ceases from raising after he has kneaded the dough: until it be leavened.
1Sa 19:11-15: Saul also sent messengers to David's house: to watch him: and to kill him in the morning: and Michal David's wife told him: saying: If you not save your life to night: to morrow you will be killed.
2Sa 13:28: 29: Now Absalom had commanded his servants: saying: Mark you now when Amnon's heart is merry with wine: and when I say to you: Smite Amnon; then kill him: not fear: not have I commanded you? be courageous: and be valiant.
Ps 10:8: 9: He sits in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places does he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.
Pr 4:16: For they not sleep: except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away: unless they cause some to fall.
Mic 2:1: Woe to them that devise iniquity: and work evil upon their beds! when the morning is light: they practise it: because it is in the power of their hand.

7 They are all hot as an oven, and have devoured their judges; all their kings are fallen: there is none among them that calls to me.Hosea 7:7
Stats
Counts: 135 characters, 23 words, 106 letters, 42 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כֻּלָּ֤ם יֵחַ֙מּוּ֙ כַּתַּנּ֔וּר וְאָכְל֖וּ אֶת־שֹֽׁפְטֵיהֶ֑ם כָּל־מַלְכֵיהֶ֣ם נָפָ֔לוּ אֵין־קֹרֵ֥א בָהֶ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃

Lit: All they are hot like an oven and have devoured their judges all their kings have fallen None calls among them upon Me

KJV: They are all hot as an oven, and have devoured their judges; all their kings are fallen: there is none among them that calleth unto me.
References

"devoured"
Ho 8:4: They have set up kings: not but by me: they have made princes: and I knew it not: of their silver and their gold have they made them idols: that they may be cut off.
1Ki 15:28: Even in the third year of Asa king of Judah did Baasha kill him: and reigned in his stead.
1Ki 16:9-11: 18: 22: His servant Zimri: captain of half his chariots: conspired against him: as he was in Tirzah: drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza steward of his house in Tirzah.
2Ki 9:24: 33: Jehu drew a bow with his full strength: and smote Jehoram between his arms: and the arrow went out at his heart: and he sunk down in his chariot.
2Ki 10:7: 14: It came to pass: when the letter came to them: that they took the king's sons: and killed 70 persons: and put their heads in baskets: and sent him them to Jezreel.
2Ki 15:10: 14: 25: 30: Shallum the son of Jabesh conspired against him: and smote him before the people: and killed him: and reigned in his stead.

"there"
Ho 7:10: 14: The pride of Israel testifieth to His face: and they not do return to the LORD their God: nor seek Him for all this.
Ho 5:15: I will go and return to my place: till they acknowledge their offence: and seek my face: in their affliction they will seek me early.
Job 36:13: But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they not cry when he binds them.
Isa 9:13: For the people turns not to Him that smites them: neither do they seek the LORD of hosts.
Isa 43:22: But you have not called upon me: O Jacob; but you have been weary of me: O Israel.
Isa 64:7: there is none that calls upon your name: that stirs up himself to take hold of you: for you have hid your face from us: and have consumed us: because of our iniquities.
Eze 22:30: I sought for a man among them: that should make up the hedge: and stand in the gap before me for the land: that I not should destroy it: but I found none.
Da 9:13: As it is written in the law of Moses: all this evil is come upon us: yet made not we our prayer before the LORD our God: that we might turn from our iniquities: and understand your truth.

 אֶפְרַ֕יִם בָּעַמִּ֖ים ה֣וּא יִתְבֹּולָ֑ל אֶפְרַ֛יִם הָיָ֥ה עֻגָ֖ה בְּלִ֥י הֲפוּכָֽה׃

H669אֶפְרַ֕יִם’ep̄-ra-yim   (N-proper-ms)
H669 אֶפְרַיִם ʼEphrayim ef-rah-yim dual of masculine form of אֶפְרָת; double fruit; Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory; Ephraim, Ephraimites. 		אֶפְרַ֕יִם’ep̄-ra-yim Ephraim N-proper-ms
H5971בָּעַמִּ֖יםbā-‘am-mîm   (Prep-b, Art | N-mp)
H5971 עַם ʻam am from עָמַם; a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock; folk, men, nation, people. 		בָּעַמִּ֖יםbā-‘am-mîm among the peoples Prep-b, Art | N-mp
H1931ה֣וּאhū   (Pro-3ms)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		ה֣וּאhū he Pro-3ms

8 Ephraim, he has mixed himself among the people; Ephraim is a not cake turned.Hosea 7:8
Stats
Rank: #4235 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 78 characters, 12 words, 62 letters, 25 vowels, 37 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֶפְרַ֕יִם בָּעַמִּ֖ים ה֣וּא יִתְבֹּולָ֑ל אֶפְרַ֛יִם הָיָ֥ה עֻגָ֖ה בְּלִ֥י הֲפוּכָֽה׃

Lit: Ephraim among the peoples he has mixed Ephraim is a cake not unturned

KJV: Ephraim, he hath mixed himself among the people; Ephraim is a cake not turned.
References

"he hath"
Ho 5:7: 13: They have dealt treacherously against the LORD: for they have begotten strange children: now will a month devour them with their portions.
Ho 9:3: They will not dwell in the LORD's land; but Ephraim will return to Egypt: and they will eat unclean things in Assyria.
Ezr 9:1: 12: Now when these things were done: the princes came to me: saying: The people of Israel: and the priests: and the Levites: not have separated themselves from the people of the lands: doing according to their abominations: even of the Canaanites: the Hittites: the Perizzites: the Jebusites: the Ammonites: the Moabites: the Egyptians: and the Amorites.
Ne 13:23-25: In those days also saw I Jews that had married wives of Ashdod: of Ammon: and of Moab:
Ps 106:35: But were mingled among the heathen: and learned their works.
Eze 23:4-11: The names of them were Aholah the elder: and Aholibah her sister: and they were my: and they bare sons and daughters. Thus were their names; Samaria is Aholah: and Jerusalem Aholibah.
Mal 2:11: Judah has dealt treacherously: and an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem; for Judah has profaned the holiness of the LORD which He loved: and has married the daughter of a strange god.

"a cake"
Ho 8:2-4: Israel will cry to me: My God: we know you.
1Ki 18:21: Elijah came to all the people: and said: How long halt you between two opinions? if the LORD be God: follow Him: but if Baal: then follow Him. And the people answered Him not">not Him a word.
Zep 1:5: Them that worship the host of heaven upon the housetops; and them that worship and that swear by the LORD: and that swear by Malcham;
Mt 6:24: No man can serve two masters: for either He will hate the one: and love the other; or else He will hold to the one: and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon.
Re 3:15: 16: I know your works: that you are neither cold nor hot: I would you wert cold or hot.

9 Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knows'>knows it not: yes, gray hairs are here and there upon him, yet he knows'>knows not.Hosea 7:9
Stats
Rank: #5412 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 125 characters, 19 words, 98 letters, 36 vowels, 62 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אָכְל֤וּ זָרִים֙ כֹּחֹ֔ו וְה֖וּא לֹ֣א יָדָ֑ע גַּם־שֵׂיבָה֙ זָ֣רְקָה בֹּ֔ו וְה֖וּא לֹ֥א יָדָֽע׃

Lit: Have devoured Aliens his strength but he not does know it Yes gray hairs are here and there on him and yet he not does know it

KJV: Strangers have devoured his strength, and he knoweth it not: yea, gray hairs are here and there upon him, yet he knoweth not.
References

"devoured"
Ho 8:7: For they have sown the wind: and they will reap the whirlwind: it has no stalk: the bud will yield no meal: if so be it yield: the strangers will swallow it up.
2Ki 13:3-7: 22: The anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel: and He delivered them into the hand of Hazael king of Syria: and into the hand of Benhadad the son of Hazael: all their days.
2Ki 15:19: And Pul the king of Assyria came against the land: and Menahem gave Pul a000 talents of silver: that his hand might be with him to confirm the kingdom in his hand.
Pr 23:35: They have stricken me: will you say: and I not was sick; they have beaten me: and I felt it not: when will I awake? I will seek it yet again.
Isa 42:22-25: But this is a people robbed and spoiled; they are all of them snared in holes: and they are hid in prison houses: they are for a prey: and none delivers; for a spoil: and none says: Restore.
Isa 57:1: The righteous perishes: and no man lays it to heart: and merciful men are taken away: none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.

H413אֶל־’el-   (Prep)
H413 אֵל ʼêl ale (but only used in the shortened constructive form אֶל ); a primitive particle; properly, denoting motion towards, but occasionally used of a quiescent position, i.e.; near, with or among; often in general, to; about, according to, after, against, among, as for, at, because(-fore, -side), both...and, by, concerning, for, from, idiom hath, in(-to), near, (out) of, over, through, to(-ward), under, unto, upon, whether, with(-in). 		אֶל־’el- to Prep

H3068 יְהֹוָה Yᵉhôvâh yeh-ho-vaw from הָיָה; (the) self-Existent or Eternal; Jehovah, Jewish national name of God; Jehovah, the Lord. Compare יָהּ, יְהֹוִה. 		יְהוָ֣הYah-weh Yahweh N-proper-ms
H430אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶ֔ם’ĕ-lō-hê-hem,   (N-mpc | 3mp)
H430 אֱלֹהִים ʼĕlôhîym el-o-heem plural of אֱלוֹהַּ; gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative; angels, idiom exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), idiom (very) great, judges, idiom mighty. 		אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶ֔ם’ĕ-lō-hê-hem, their God N-mpc | 3mp

H1245 בָּקַשׁ bâqash baw-kash a primitive root; to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after; ask, beg, beseech, desire, enquire, get, make inquisition, procure, (make) request, require, seek (for). 		בִקְשֻׁ֖הוּḇiq-šu-hū seek Him V-Piel-Perf-3cp | 3ms
H3605בְּכָל־bə-ḵāl   (Prep-b | N-msc)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		בְּכָל־bə-ḵāl for all Prep-b | N-msc

10 The pride of Israel testifieth to His face: and they not do return to the LORD their God, nor seek Him for all this.Hosea 7:10
Stats
Rank: #7672 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 120 characters, 23 words, 93 letters, 35 vowels, 58 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְעָנָ֥ה גְאֹֽון־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּפָנָ֑יו וְלֹֽא־שָׁ֙בוּ֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א בִקְשֻׁ֖הוּ בְּכָל־זֹֽאת׃

Lit: And testifies the pride of Israel to his face but not they do return to Yahweh their God nor seek Him for all this

KJV: And the pride of Israel testifieth to his face: and they do not return to the LORD their God, nor seek him for all this.
References

"the pride"
Ho 5:5: The pride of Israel does testify to his face: therefore will Israel and Ephraim fall in their iniquity; Judah also will fall with them.
Jer 3:3: Therefore the showers have been withholden: and there has been no latter rain; and you hadst a whore's forehead: you refusedst to be ashamed.

"and they"
Ho 7:7: They are all hot as an oven: and have devoured their judges; all their kings are fallen: there is none among them that calls to me.
Ho 6:1: Come: and let us return to the LORD: for He has torn: and He will heal us; He has smitten: and He will bind us up.
Pr 27:22: Though you should bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle: yet not will his foolishness depart from him.
Isa 9:13: For the people turns not to Him that smites them: neither do they seek the LORD of hosts.
Jer 8:5: 6: Why then is this people of Jerusalem slidden back by a perpetual backsliding? they hold fast deceit: they refuse to return.
Jer 25:5-7: They said: Turn you again now every one from His evil way: and from the evil of your doings: and dwell in the land that the LORD has given to you and to your fathers for ever and ever:
Jer 35:15-17: I have sent also to you all my servants the prophets: rising up early and sending them: saying: Return you now every man from his evil way: and amend your doings: and not go after other gods to serve them: and you will dwell in the land which I have given to you and to your fathers: but you not have inclined your ear: nor listened to me.
Am 4:6-13: I also have given you cleanness of teeth in all your cities: and want of bread in all your places: yet have you not returned to me: says the LORD.
Zec 1:4: Be you not as your fathers: to whom the former prophets have cried: saying: Thus says the LORD of hosts; Turn you now from your evil ways: and from your evil doings: but they not did hear: nor listen to me: says the LORD.

"nor"
Ps 10:4: The wicked: through the pride of His face: not will seek after God: God is not in all His thoughts.
Ps 14:2: The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men: to see if there were any that did understand: and seek God.
Ps 53:2: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men: to see if there were any that did understand: that did seek God.
Ro 3:11: There is none that understands: there is none that seeks after God.

וַיְהִ֣י אֶפְרַ֔יִם כְּיֹונָ֥ה פֹותָ֖ה אֵ֣ין לֵ֑ב מִצְרַ֥יִם קָרָ֖אוּ אַשּׁ֥וּר הָלָֽכוּ׃

11 Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.Hosea 7:11
Stats
Rank: #9255 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 88 characters, 15 words, 69 letters, 27 vowels, 42 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י אֶפְרַ֔יִם כְּיֹונָ֥ה פֹותָ֖ה אֵ֣ין לֵ֑ב מִצְרַ֥יִם קָרָ֖אוּ אַשּׁ֥וּר הָלָֽכוּ׃

Lit: And is Ephraim like a dove silly without sense to Egypt they call to Assyria they go

KJV: Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.
References

"a silly"
Ho 11:11: They will tremble as a bird out of Egypt: and as a dove out of the land of Assyria: and I will place them in their houses: says the LORD.

"without"
Ho 4:11: Whoredom and wine and new wine take away the heart.
Pr 6:32: But whoever commits adultery with a woman lacks understanding: he that does it destroyeth his own soul.
Pr 15:32: He who refuses instruction despises his own soul: but he who hears reproof gets understanding.
Pr 17:16: For what reason is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom: seeing he has no heart to it?

"they call"
Ho 5:13: When Ephraim saw his sickness: and Judah saw his wound: then went Ephraim to the Assyrian: and sent to king Jareb: yet could not he heal you: nor cure you of your wound.
Ho 8:8: 9: Israel is swallowed up: now will they be among the Gentiles as a vessel wherein is no pleasure.
Ho 9:3: They will not dwell in the LORD's land; but Ephraim will return to Egypt: and they will eat unclean things in Assyria.
Ho 12:1: Ephraim feeds on wind: and follows after the east wind: he daily increases lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians: and oil is carried into Egypt.
Ho 14:3: Asshur will not save us; we not will ride upon horses: neither will we say any more to the work of our hands: You are our gods: for in you the fatherless finds mercy.
2Ki 15:19: And Pul the king of Assyria came against the land: and Menahem gave Pul a000 talents of silver: that his hand might be with him to confirm the kingdom in his hand.
2Ki 17:3: 4: Against him came up Shalmaneser king of Assyria; and Hoshea became his servant: and gave him presents.
Isa 30:1-6: Woe to the rebellious children: says the LORD: that take counsel: not but of me; and that cover with a covering: not but of my spirit: that they may add sin to sin:
Isa 31:1-3: Woe to them that go down to Egypt for help; and stay on horses: and trust in chariots: because they are many; and in horsemen: because they are very strong; but they not look to the Holy one of Israel: neither seek the LORD!
Jer 2:18: 36: Now what have you to do in the way of Egypt: to drink the waters of Sihor? or what have you to do in the way of Assyria: to drink the waters of the river?
Eze 23:4-8: The names of them were Aholah the elder: and Aholibah her sister: and they were my: and they bare sons and daughters. Thus were their names; Samaria is Aholah: and Jerusalem Aholibah.
