6 For, indeed, they are gone because of destruction: Egypt will gather them up, Memphis will bury them: the pleasant places for their silver, nettles will possess them: thorns will be in their tabernacles.Hosea 9:6
Stats
Counts: 205 characters, 24 words, 163 letters, 54 vowels, 109 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֤ה הָֽלְכוּ֙ מִשֹּׁ֔ד מִצְרַ֥יִם תְּקַבְּצֵ֖ם מֹ֣ף תְּקַבְּרֵ֑ם מַחְמַ֣ד לְכַסְפָּ֗ם קִמֹּושׂ֙ יִֽירָשֵׁ֔ם חֹ֖וחַ בְּאָהֳלֵיהֶֽם׃

Lit: for indeed they are gone because of destruction Egypt shall gather them up Memphis shall bury them valuables of their silver Nettles shall possess Thorns shall be in their tents

KJV: For, lo, they are gone because of destruction: Egypt shall gather them up, Memphis shall bury them: the pleasant places for their silver, nettles shall possess them: thorns [shall be] in their tabernacles.
References

"they"
De 28:63: 64: It will come to pass: that as the LORD rejoiced over you to do you good: and to multiply you; so the LORD will rejoice over you to destroy you: and to bring you to nought; and you will be plucked from off the land whither you go to possess it.
1Sa 13:6: When the men of Israel saw that they were in a strait: (for the people were distressed: ) then the people did hide themselves in caves: and in thickets: and in rocks: and in high places: and in pits.
2Ki 13:7: Neither did he leave of the people to Jehoahaz but 50 horsemen: and 10 chariots: and 10000 footmen; for the king of Syria had destroyed them: and had made them like the dust by threshing.

"destruction"
Ho 7:13: Woe to them! for they have fled from me: destruction to them! because they have transgressed against me: though I have redeemed them: yet they have spoken lies against me.

"Egypt"
Ho 9:3: They will not dwell in the LORD's land; but Ephraim will return to Egypt: and they will eat unclean things in Assyria.
Ho 7:16: They return: but not to the most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes will fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this will be their derision in the land of Egypt.
Ho 8:13: They sacrifice flesh for the sacrifices of my offerings: and eat it; but the LORD accepts not them; now will He remember their iniquity: and visit their sins: they will return to Egypt.
Ho 11:11: They will tremble as a bird out of Egypt: and as a dove out of the land of Assyria: and I will place them in their houses: says the LORD.
Isa 11:11: It will come to pass in that day: that the Lord will set His hand again the second time to recover the remnant of His people: which will be left: from Assyria: and from Egypt: and from Pathros: and from Cush: and from Elam: and from Shinar: and from Hamath: and from the islands of the sea.
Isa 27:12: It will come to pass in that day: that the LORD will beat off from the channel of the river to the stream of Egypt: and you will be gathered one by one: O you children of Israel.
Zec 10:10: 11: I will bring them again also out of the land of Egypt: and gather them out of Assyria; and I will bring them into the land of Gilead and Lebanon; and place will not be found for them.

"the pleasant places for their silver, nettles"
Ho 10:8: The high places also of Aven: the sin of Israel: will be destroyed: the thorn and the thistle will come up on their altars; and they will say to the mountains: Cover us; and to the hills: Fall on us.
Ps 107:34: A fruitful land into barrenness: for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
Pr 24:31: And: indeed: it was all grown over with thorns: and nettles had covered the face thereof: and the stone wall thereof was broken down.
Isa 5:6: I will lay it waste: it will not be pruned: nor digged; but there will come up briers and thorns: I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.
Isa 7:23: It will come to pass in that day: that every place will be: where there were a000 vines at a000 silverlings: it will even be for briers and thorns.
Isa 32:13: Upon the land of my people will come up thorns and briers; yes: upon all the houses of joy in the joyous city:
Isa 34:13: Thorns will come up in her palaces: nettles and brambles in the fortresses thereof: and it will be an habitation of dragons: and a court for owls.

H7227 רַב rab rab by contracted from רָבַב; abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality); (in) abound(-undance, -ant, -antly), captain, elder, enough, exceedingly, full, great(-ly, man, one), increase, long (enough, (time)), (do, have) many(-ifold, things, a time), (ship-)master, mighty, more, (too, very) much, multiply(-tude), officer, often(-times), plenteous, populous, prince, process (of time), suffice(-lent)., 		וְרַבָּ֖הwə-rab-bāh and great Conj-w | Adj-fs
H4895מַשְׂטֵמָֽה׃maś-ṭê-māh.   (N-fs)

7 The days of visitation are come, the days of recompence are come; Israel will know it: the prophet is a fool, the spiritual man is mad, for the multitude of your iniquity, and the great hatred.Hosea 9:7
Stats
Counts: 199 characters, 26 words, 153 letters, 63 vowels, 90 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בָּ֣אוּ ׀ יְמֵ֣י הַפְּקֻדָּ֗ה בָּ֚אוּ יְמֵ֣י הַשִׁלֻּ֔ם יֵדְע֖וּ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֱוִ֣יל הַנָּבִ֗יא מְשֻׁגָּע֙ אִ֣ישׁ הָר֔וּחַ עַ֚ל רֹ֣ב עֲוֹנְךָ֔ וְרַבָּ֖ה מַשְׂטֵמָֽה׃

Lit: Have come the days of punishment have come the days of recompense knows Israel a fool the prophet is insane man is the spiritual because of the greatness of your iniquity and great enmity

KJV: The days of visitation are come, the days of recompence are come; Israel shall know it: the prophet [is] a fool, the spiritual man [is] mad, for the multitude of thine iniquity, and the great hatred.
References

"days of visitation"
Isa 10:3: What will you do in the day of visitation: and in the desolation which will come from far? to whom will you flee for help? and where will you leave your glory?
Jer 10:15: They are vanity: and the work of errors: in the time of their visitation they will perish.
Jer 11:23: There will be no remnant of them: for I will bring evil upon the men of Anathoth: even the year of their visitation.
Jer 46:21: Also her hired men are in the middle of her like fatted bullocks; for they also are turned back: and are fled away together: they not did stand: because the day of their calamity was come upon them: and the time of their visitation.
Eze 7:2-7: Also: you son of man: thus says the Lord GOD to the land of Israel; An end: the end is come upon the 4 corners of the land.
Eze 12:22-28: Son of man: what is that proverb that you have in the land of Israel: saying: The days are prolonged: and every vision faileth?
Am 8:2: He said: Amos: what see you? And I said: A basket of summer fruit. Then said the LORD to me: The end is come upon my people of Israel; I not will again pass by them any more.
Mic 7:4: The best of them is as a brier: the most upright is sharper than a thorn hedge: the day of your watchmen and your visitation comes; now will be their perplexity.
Zep 1:14-18: The great day of the LORD is near: it is near: and hasts greatly: even the voice of the day of the LORD: the mighty man will cry there bitterly.
Lu 21:22: For these be the days of vengeance: that all things which are written may be fulfilled.
Re 16:19: The great city was divided into 3 parts: and the cities of the nations fell: and great Babylon came in remembrance before God: to give to her the cup of the wine of the fierceness of His wrath.

"Israel"
Isa 26:11: LORD: when your hand is lifted up: they not will see: but they will see: and be ashamed for their envy at the people; yes: the fire of your enemies will devour them.
Eze 25:17: I will execute great vengeance upon them with furious rebukes; and they will know that I am the LORD: when I will lay my vengeance upon them.
Eze 38:23: Thus will I magnify myself: and sanctify myself; and I will be known in the eyes of many nations: and they will know that I am the LORD.

"the prophet"
Ho 9:8: The watchman of Ephraim was with my God: but the prophet is a snare of a fowler in all His ways: and hatred in the house of His God.
Jer 6:14: They have healed also the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly: saying: Peace: peace; when there is no peace.
Jer 8:11: For they have healed the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly: saying: Peace: peace; when there is no peace.
Jer 23:16: 17: Thus says the LORD of hosts: Listen not to the words of the prophets that prophesy to you: they make you vain: they speak a vision of their own heart: and not out of the mouth of the LORD.
La 2:14: Your prophets have seen vain and foolish things for you: and they not have discovered your iniquity: to turn away your captivity; but have seen for you false burdens and causes of banishment.
Eze 13:3: 10: Thus says the Lord GOD; Woe to the foolish prophets: that follow their own spirit: and have not seenhing!
Mic 2:11: If a man walking in the spirit and falsehood do lie: saying: I will prophesy to you of wine and of strong drink; he will even be the prophet of this people.
Zep 3:4: Her prophets are light and treacherous persons: her priests have polluted the sanctuary: they have done violence to the law.
Zec 11:15-17: The LORD said to me: Take to you yet the instruments of a foolish shepherd.

"mad"
2Ki 9:11: Then Jehu came forth to the servants of his lord: and one said to him: Is all well? for what reason came this mad fellow to you? And he said to them: You know the man: and his communication.
Jer 29:26: The LORD has made you priest'>priest in the stead of Jehoiada the priest'>priest: that you should be officers in the house of the LORD: for every man that is mad: and makes Himself a prophet: that you should put Him in prison: and in the stocks.
Mr 3:21: When his friends heard of it: they went out to lay hold on him: for they said: He is beside himself.
Ac 26:24: 25: As he thus spoke for himself: Festus said with a loud voice: Paul: you are beside yourself; much learning does make you mad.
2Co 5:13: For whether we be beside ourselves: it is to God: or whether we be sober: it is for your cause.

"the multitude"
Eze 14:9: 10: If the prophet be deceived when He has spoken a thing: I the LORD have deceived that prophet: and I will stretch out my hand upon Him: and will destroy Him from the middle of my people Israel.
2Th 2:10-12: With all deceivableness of unrighteousness in them that perish; because they not received the love of the truth: that they might be saved.

8 The watchman of Ephraim was with my God: but the prophet is a snare of a fowler in all His ways, and hatred in the house of His God.Hosea 9:8
Stats
Counts: 138 characters, 23 words, 101 letters, 37 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: צֹפֶ֥ה אֶפְרַ֖יִם עִם־אֱלֹהָ֑י נָבִ֞יא פַּ֤ח יָקֹושׁ֙ עַל־כָּל־דְּרָכָ֔יו מַשְׂטֵמָ֖ה בְּבֵ֥ית אֱלֹהָֽיו׃

Lit: The watchman of Ephraim is with my God but the prophet is a snare of fowler in all his ways Enmity in the house of his God

KJV: The watchman of Ephraim was with my God: [but] the prophet [is] a snare of a fowler in all his ways, [and] hatred in the house of his God.
References

"watchman"
Song 3:3: The watchmen that go about the city found me: to whom I said: Saw you him whom my soul loveth?
Isa 62:6: I have set watchmen upon your walls: O Jerusalem: which will never hold their peace day nor night: you that make mention of the LORD: not keep silence:
Jer 6:17: Also I set watchmen over you: saying: Listen to the sound of the trumpet. But they said: We not will listen.
Jer 31:6: For there will be a day: that the watchmen upon the mount Ephraim will cry: Arise you: and let us go up to Zion to the LORD our God.
Eze 3:17: Son of man: I have made you a watchman to the house of Israel: therefore hear the word at my mouth: and give them warning from me.
Eze 33:7: So you: O son of man: I have set you a watchman to the house of Israel; therefore you will hear the word at my mouth: and warn them from me.
Mic 7:4: The best of them is as a brier: the most upright is sharper than a thorn hedge: the day of your watchmen and your visitation comes; now will be their perplexity.
Heb 13:17: Obey them that have the rule over you: and submit yourselves: for they watch for your souls: as they that must give account: that they may do it with joy: not and with grief: for that is unprofitable for you.

"with"

2Ki 4:43: His servitor said: What: should I set this before 100 men? He said again: Give the people: that they may eat: for thus says the LORD: They will eat: and will leave thereof.
2Ki 5:14: 27: Then went He down: and dipped Himself 7 times in Jordan: according to the saying of the man of God: and His flesh came again like to the flesh of a little child: and He was clean.
2Ki 6:17: 18: Elisha prayed: and said: LORD: I pray you: open His eyes: that He may see. And the LORD opened the eyes of the young man; and He saw: and: look: the mountain was full of horses and chariots of fire round about Elisha.
2Ki 7:2: 19: Then a lord on whose hand the king leaned answered the man of God: and said: Look: if the LORD would make windows in heaven: might this thing be? And He said: Look: you will see it with your eyes: but will not eat thereof.
2Ki 13:21: It came to pass: as they were burying a man: that: look: they spied a band of men; and they cast the man into the sepulchre of Elisha: and when the man was let down: and touched the bones of Elisha: he revived: and stood up on his feet.

"but"
Ho 5:1: Hear you this: O priests; and listen: you house of Israel; and give you ear: O house of the king; for judgment is toward you: because you have been a snare on Mizpah: and a net spread upon Tabor.

1Ki 22:6: 11: 22: Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together: about 400 men: and said to them: Will I go against Ramothgilead to battle: or will I forbear? And they said: Go up; for the Lord will deliver it into the hand of the king.

La 4:13: For the sins of her prophets: and the iniquities of her priests: that have shed the blood of the just in the middle of her:

"in the"

Ro 3:7: For if the truth of God has more abounded through my lie to His glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?

H2403 חַטָּאָה chaṭṭâʼâh khat-taw-aw or חַטָּאת; from חָטָא; an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender; punishment (of sin), purifying(-fication for sin), sin(-ner, offering). 		חַטֹּאותָֽם׃ḥaṭ-ṭō-w-ṯām. their sins N-fpc | 3mp
9 They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah: therefore he will remember their iniquity, he will visit their sins.Hosea 9:9
Stats
Counts: 135 characters, 18 words, 108 letters, 41 vowels, 67 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הֶעְמִֽיקוּ־שִׁחֵ֖תוּ כִּימֵ֣י הַגִּבְעָ֑ה יִזְכֹּ֣ור עֲוֹנָ֔ם יִפְקֹ֖וד חַטֹּאותָֽם׃ ס

Lit: They are deeply corrupted as in the days of Gibeah He will remember their iniquity He will punish their sins

KJV: They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah: [therefore] he will remember their iniquity, he will visit their sins.
References

"deeply"
Isa 24:5: The earth also is defiled under the inhabitants thereof; because they have transgressed the laws: changed the ordinance: broken the everlasting covenant.
Isa 31:6: Turn you to him from whom the children of Israel have deeply revolted.

"Gibeah"
Ho 10:9: O Israel: you have sinned from the days of Gibeah: there they stood: the battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity not did overtake them.
Jg 19:22-30: Now as they were making their hearts merry: look: the men of the city: certain sons of Belial: beset the house round about: and beat at the door: and spoke to the master of the house: the old man: saying: Bring forth the man that came into your house: that we may know him.
Jg 20:1-21: Then all the children of Israel went out: and the congregation was gathered together as one man: from Dan even to Beersheba: with the land of Gilead: to the LORD in Mizpeh.

"therefore"
Ho 8:13: They sacrifice flesh for the sacrifices of my offerings: and eat it; but the LORD accepts not them; now will He remember their iniquity: and visit their sins: they will return to Egypt.

10 I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness; I saw your fathers as the firstripe in the fig tree at her first time: but they went to Baalpeor, and separated themselves to that shame; and their abominations were according as they loved.Hosea 9:10
Stats
Rank: #4023 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 242 characters, 34 words, 192 letters, 75 vowels, 117 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כַּעֲנָבִ֣ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֗ר מָצָ֙אתִי֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כְּבִכּוּרָ֤ה בִתְאֵנָה֙ בְּרֵ֣אשִׁיתָ֔הּ רָאִ֖יתִי אֲבֹֽותֵיכֶ֑ם הֵ֜מָּה בָּ֣אוּ בַֽעַל־פְּעֹ֗ור וַיִּנָּֽזְרוּ֙ לַבֹּ֔שֶׁת וַיִּהְי֥וּ שִׁקּוּצִ֖ים כְּאָהֳבָֽם׃

Lit: Like grapes in the wilderness I found Israel as the firstfruits on the fig tree in its first season I saw your fathers they But went to Baal Peor and separated themselves to [that shame and they became an abomination like the thing they loved

KJV: I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness; I saw your fathers as the firstripe in the fig tree at her first time: but they went to Baalpeor, and separated themselves unto [that] shame; and [their] abominations were according as they loved.
References

"found"
Ho 11:1: When Israel was a child: then I loved him: and called my son out of Egypt.
Ex 19:4-6: You have seen what I did to the Egyptians: and how I bare you on eagles' wings: and brought you to myself.
De 32:10: He found him in a desert land: and in the waste howling wilderness; he led him about: he instructed him: he kept him as the apple of his eye.
Jer 2:2: 3: Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem: saying: Thus says the LORD; I remember you: the kindness of your youth: the love of your espousals: when you went after me in the wilderness: in a land that was not sown.
Jer 31:2: Thus says the LORD: The people which were left of the sword found grace in the wilderness; even Israel: when I went to cause Him to rest.

"grapes"
Ho 2:15: I will give her her vineyards from there: and the valley of Achor for a door of hope: and she will sing there: as in the days of her youth: and as in the day when she came up out of the land of Egypt.
Nu 13:23: 24: They came to the brook of Eshcol: and cut down from there a branch with one cluster of grapes: and they bare it between two upon a staff; and they brought of the pomegranates: and of the figs.
Isa 28:4: The glorious beauty: which is on the head of the fat valley: will be a fading flower: and as the hasty fruit before the summer; which when he who looks upon it sees: while it is yet in his hand he eats it up.
Mic 7:1: Woe is me! for I am as when they have gathered the summer fruits: as the grapegleanings of the vintage: there is no cluster to eat: my soul desired the firstripe fruit.

"but"
Nu 25:3-18: Israel joined Himself to Baalpeor: and the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel.
De 4:3: your eyes have seen what the LORD did because of Baalpeor: for all the men that followed Baalpeor: the LORD your God has destroyed them from among you.
Ps 106:28: They joined themselves also to Baalpeor: and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

"separated"
Ho 4:14: I not will punish your daughters when they commit whoredom: nor your spouses when they commit adultery: for themselves are separated with whores: and they sacrifice with harlots: therefore the people that does not understand will fall.
Jg 6:32: Therefore on that day he called him Jerubbaal: saying: Let Baal plead against him: because he has thrown down his altar.
1Ki 16:31: It came to pass: as if it had been a light thing for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat: that he took to wife Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Zidonians: and went and served Baal: and worshipped him.
Jer 11:13: For according to the number of your cities were your gods: O Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have you set up altars to that shameful thing: even altars to burn incense to Baal.
Ro 6:21: What fruit had you then in those things whereof you are now ashamed? for the end of those things is death.

"and their"
Nu 15:39: It will be to you for a fringe: that you may look upon it: and remember all the commandments of the LORD: and do them; and that you not seek after your own heart and your own eyes: after which you use to go a whoring:
De 32:17: They sacrificed to devils: not to God; to gods whom they not knew: to new gods that came newly up: whom your fathers not feared.
Ps 81:12: So I gave them up to their own hearts' lust: and they walked in their own counsels.
Jer 5:31: The prophets prophesy falsely: and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love to have it so: and what will you do in the end thereof?
Eze 20:8: But they rebelled against me: and not would listen to me: they not did every man cast away the abominations of their eyes: neither did they forsake the idols of Egypt: then I said: I will pour out my fury upon them: to accomplish my anger against them in the middle of the land of Egypt.
Am 4:5: Offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving with leaven: and proclaim and publish the free offerings: for this likes you: O you children of Israel: says the Lord GOD.

11 As for Ephraim, their glory will fly away like a bird, from the birth, and from the womb, and from the conception.Hosea 9:11
Stats
Rank: #4531 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 115 characters, 18 words, 89 letters, 29 vowels, 60 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֶפְרַ֕יִם כָּעֹ֖וף יִתְעֹופֵ֣ף כְּבֹודָ֑ם מִלֵּדָ֥ה וּמִבֶּ֖טֶן וּמֵהֵרָיֹֽון׃

Lit: As for Ephraim like a bird shall fly away their glory No birth and no pregnancy and no conception

KJV: As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird, from the birth, and from the womb, and from the conception.
References

"their"
Ge 41:52: The name of the second called He Ephraim: For God has caused me to be fruitful in the land of my affliction.
Ge 48:16-20: The Angel which redeemed me from all evil: bless the lads; and let my name be named on them: and the name of my fathers Abraham and Isaac; and let them grow into a multitude in the middle of the earth.
Ge 49:22: Joseph is a fruitful bough: even a fruitful bough by a well; whose branches run over the wall:
De 33:17: His glory is like the firstling of his bullock: and his horns are like the horns of unicorns: with them he will push the people together to the ends of the earth: and they are the 10 thousands of Ephraim: and they are the thousands of Manasseh.
Job 18:5: 18: 19: Yes: the light of the wicked will be put out: and the spark of his fire will not shine.

"from the birth"
Ps 58:8: As a snail which melts: let every one of them pass away: like the untimely birth of a woman: that they not may see the sun.
Ec 6:3: If a man beget 100 children: and live many years: so that the days of his years be many: and his soul not be filled with good: and also that he have no burial; I say: that an untimely birth is better than he.
Am 1:13: Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of the children of Ammon: and for 4: I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they have ripped up the women with child of Gilead: that they might enlarge their border:

"from the womb"
Ho 9:14: Give them: O LORD: what will you give? give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.
De 28:18: 57: Cursed will be the fruit of your body: and the fruit of your land: the increase of your cattle: and the flocks of your sheep.
Lu 23:29: For: look: the days are coming: in the which they will say: Blessed are the barren: and the wombs that never bare: and the paps which never gave suck.

 כִּ֤י אִם־יְגַדְּלוּ֙ אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וְשִׁכַּלְתִּ֖ים מֵֽאָדָ֑ם כִּֽי־גַם־אֹ֥וי לָהֶ֖ם בְּשׂוּרִ֥י מֵהֶֽם׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H3588כִּ֤יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֤יkî Yes Conj
H518אִם־’im-   (Conj)
H518 אִם ʼim eem a primitive particle; used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not; (and, can-, doubtless, if, that) (not), phrase but, either, phrase except, phrase more(-over if, than), neither, nevertheless, nor, oh that, or, phrase save (only, -ing), seeing, since, sith, phrase surely (no more, none, not), though, phrase of a truth, phrase unless, phrase verily, when, whereas, whether, while, phrase yet., 		אִם־’im- Though Conj
H1431יְגַדְּלוּ֙yə-ḡad-də-lū   (V-Piel-Imperf-3mp)
H1431 גָּדַל gâdal gaw-dal a primitive root; properly, to twist (compare גְּדִל), i.e.; to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride); advance, boast, bring up, exceed, excellent, be(-come, do, give, make, wax), great(-er, come to... estate, phrase things), grow(up), increase, lift up, magnify(-ifical), be much set by, nourish (up), pass, promote, proudly (spoken), tower. 		יְגַדְּלוּ֙yə-ḡad-də-lū they bring up V-Piel-Imperf-3mp

H3588כִּֽי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּֽי־kî- Yes Conj
H1571גַם־ḡam-   (Conj)
H1571 גַּם gam gam by contraction from an unused root meaning to gather; properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and; again, alike, also, (so much) as (soon), both (so)...and, but, either...or, even, for all, (in) likewise (manner), moreover, nay...neither, one, then(-refore), though, what, with, yea. 		גַם־ḡam- Yes Conj

12 Though they bring up their children, yet will I bereave them, that there will not be a man left: yes, woe also to them when I depart from them!Hosea 9:12
Stats
Rank: #6041 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 148 characters, 22 words, 111 letters, 40 vowels, 71 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֤י אִם־יְגַדְּלוּ֙ אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וְשִׁכַּלְתִּ֖ים מֵֽאָדָ֑ם כִּֽי־גַם־אֹ֥וי לָהֶ֖ם בְּשׂוּרִ֥י מֵהֶֽם׃

Lit: Yes Though they bring up their children and yet I will bereave them to the last man Yes Yes woe to them when I depart from them

KJV: Though they bring up their children, yet will I bereave them, that there shall not [be] a man [left]: yea, woe also to them when I depart from them!
References

"yet"
Ho 9:13: 16: Ephraim: as I saw Tyrus: is planted in a pleasant place: but Ephraim will bring forth his children to the murderer.
De 28:32: 41: 42: Your sons and your daughters will be given to another people: and your eyes will look: and fail with longing for them all the day long: and there will be no might in your hand.
De 32:25: The sword without: and terror within: will destroy both the young man and the virgin: the suckling also with the man of gray hairs.
Job 27:14: If his children be multiplied: it is for the sword: and his offspring will not be satisfied with bread.
Jer 15:7: I will fan them with a fan in the gates of the land; I will bereave them of children: I will destroy my people: since they not return from their ways.
Jer 16:3: 4: For thus says the LORD concerning the sons and concerning the daughters that are born in this place: and concerning their mothers that bare them: and concerning their fathers that begot them in this land;
La 2:20: Look: O LORD: and consider to whom you have done this. Will the women eat their fruit: and children of a span long? will the priest and the prophet be killed in the sanctuary of the Lord?

"not"
Nu 26:65: For the LORD had said of them: They will surely die in the wilderness. And there not was left a man of them: save Caleb the son of Jephunneh: and Joshua the son of Nun.
Jg 4:16: But Barak pursued after the chariots: and after the host: to Harosheth of the Gentiles: and all the host of Sisera fell upon the edge of the sword; and there not was a man left.

"woe"
Ho 9:5: 6: What will you do in the solemn day: and in the day of the feast of the LORD?
Ho 7:13: Woe to them! for they have fled from me: destruction to them! because they have transgressed against me: though I have redeemed them: yet they have spoken lies against me.
De 31:17: Then my anger will be kindled against them in that day: and I will forsake them: and I will hide my face from them: and they will be devoured: and many evils and troubles will befall them; so that they will say in that day: not Are these evils come upon us: because our God is not among us?
1Sa 16:14: But the Spirit of the LORD departed from Saul: and an evil spirit from the LORD troubled Him.
1Sa 28:15: 16: Samuel said to Saul: Why have you disquieted me: to bring me up? And Saul answered: I am sore distressed; for the Philistines make war against me: and God is departed from me: and answers me no more: neither by prophets: nor by dreams: therefore I have called you: that you may make known to me what I will do.
2Ki 17:18: 23: Therefore the LORD was very angry with Israel: and removed them out of His sight: there was none left but the tribe of Judah only.

13 Ephraim, as I saw Tyrus, is planted in a pleasant place: but Ephraim will bring forth his children to the murderer.Hosea 9:13
Stats
Rank: #9423 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 116 characters, 18 words, 92 letters, 32 vowels, 60 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֶפְרַ֛יִם כַּאֲשֶׁר־רָאִ֥יתִי לְצֹ֖ור שְׁתוּלָ֣ה בְנָוֶ֑ה וְאֶפְרַ֕יִם לְהֹוצִ֥יא אֶל־הֹרֵ֖ג בָּנָֽיו׃

Lit: Ephraim just as I saw like Tyre planted in a pleasant place so Ephraim will bring out to the murderer his children

KJV: Ephraim, as I saw Tyrus, is planted in a pleasant place: but Ephraim shall bring forth his children to the murderer.

H6784 צָמַק tsâmaq tsaw-mak a primitive root; to dry up; dry. 		צֹמְקִֽים׃ṣō-mə-qîm. dry V-Qal-Prtcpl-mp
14 Give them, O LORD: what will you give? give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.Hosea 9:14
Stats
Counts: 85 characters, 13 words, 66 letters, 22 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: תֵּן־לָהֶ֥ם יְהוָ֖ה מַה־תִּתֵּ֑ן תֵּן־לָהֶם֙ רֶ֣חֶם מַשְׁכִּ֔יל וְשָׁדַ֖יִם צֹמְקִֽים׃

Lit: Give them Yahweh what will You give Give them a womb miscarrying and breasts dry

KJV: Give them, O LORD: what wilt thou give? give them a miscarrying womb and dry breasts.
References

"what"
Ho 9:13: 16: Ephraim: as I saw Tyrus: is planted in a pleasant place: but Ephraim will bring forth his children to the murderer.
Mt 24:19: Woe to them that are with child: and to them that give suck in those days!
Mr 13:17: But woe to them that are with child: and to them that give suck in those days!
Lu 21:23: But woe to them that are with child: and to them that give suck: in those days! for there will be great distress in the land: and wrath upon this people.
Lu 23:29: For: look: the days are coming: in the which they will say: Blessed are the barren: and the wombs that never bare: and the paps which never gave suck.
1Co 7:26: I suppose therefore that this is good for the present distress: I say: that it is good for a man so to be.

"a miscarrying womb"
Job 21:10: Their bull genders: and fails not; their cow calves: and casts not her calf.

15 All their wickedness is in Gilgal: for there I hated them: for the wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of my house, I will love them no more: all their princes are revolters.Hosea 9:15
Stats
Rank: #6944 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 191 characters, 30 words, 149 letters, 58 vowels, 91 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כָּל־רָעָתָ֤ם בַּגִּלְגָּל֙ כִּֽי־שָׁ֣ם שְׂנֵאתִ֔ים עַ֚ל רֹ֣עַ מַֽעַלְלֵיהֶ֔ם מִבֵּיתִ֖י אֲגָרְשֵׁ֑ם לֹ֤א אֹוסֵף֙ אַהֲבָתָ֔ם כָּל־שָׂרֵיהֶ֖ם סֹרְרִֽים׃

Lit: All is their wickedness in Gilgal for there I hated them because of the evil of their deeds from My house I will drive them no more I will love them all their princes are rebellious

KJV: All their wickedness is in Gilgal: for there I hated them: for the wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of mine house, I will love them no more: all their princes [are] revolters.
References

"is in"
Ho 4:15: Though you: Israel: play the harlot: yet not let Judah offend; and not come you to Gilgal: neither go you up to Bethaven: nor swear: The LORD lives.
Ho 12:11: Is there iniquity in Gilead? surely they are vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yes: their altars are as heaps in the furrows of the fields.
Jos 4:19-24: The people came up out of Jordan on the tenth day of the first month: and encamped in Gilgal: in the east border of Jericho.
Jos 5:2-9: At that time the LORD said to Joshua: Make you sharp knives: and circumcise again the children of Israel the second time.
Jos 10:43: Joshua returned: and all Israel with him: to the camp to Gilgal.
1Sa 7:16: He went from year to year in circuit to Bethel: and Gilgal: and Mizpeh: and judged Israel in all those places.
Am 4:4: Come to Bethel: and transgress; at Gilgal multiply transgression; and bring your sacrifices every morning: and your tithes after 3 years:
Am 5:5: But not seek Bethel: nor enter into Gilgal: and not pass to Beersheba: for Gilgal will surely go into captivity: and Bethel will come to nought.
Mic 6:5: O my people: remember now what Balak king of Moab consulted: and what Balaam the son of Beor answered Him from Shittim to Gilgal; that you may know the righteousness of the LORD.

"I hated"
Le 26:30: I will destroy your high places: and cut down your images: and cast your carcases upon the carcases of your idols: and my soul will abhor you.
Eze 23:18: So she discovered her whoredoms: and discovered her nakedness: then my mind was alienated from her: like as my mind was alienated from her sister.
Zec 11:8: 3 shepherds also I cut off in one month; and my soul lothed them: and their soul also abhorred me.

"I will drive"
Ho 9:3: 17: They will not dwell in the LORD's land; but Ephraim will return to Egypt: and they will eat unclean things in Assyria.
Ho 1:6: 9: She conceived again: and bare a daughter. And God said to Him: Call her name Loruhamah: for I will no more have mercy upon the house of Israel; but I will utterly take them away.
Ho 3:4: For the children of Israel will abide many days without a king: and without a prince: and without a sacrifice: and without an image: and without an ephod: and without teraphim:
1Ki 9:7-9: Then will I cut off Israel out of the land which I have given them; and this house: which I have hallowed for my name: will I cast out of my sight; and Israel will be a proverb and a byword among all people:
2Ki 17:17-20: They caused their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire: and used divination and enchantments: and sold themselves to do evil in the sight of the LORD: to provoke Him to anger.
Ps 78:60: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh: the tent which he placed among men;
Jer 3:8: I saw: when for all the causes whereby backsliding Israel committed adultery I had put her away: and given her a bill of divorce; yet her treacherous sister Judah not feared: but went and played the harlot also.
Jer 11:15: What has my beloved to do in my house: seeing she has wrought lewdness with many: and the holy flesh is passed from you? when you do evil: then you rejoice.
Jer 33:24-26: Consider you not what this people have spoken: saying: The two families which the LORD has chosen: He has even cast them off? thus they have despised my people: that they should be no more a nation before them.
Am 5:27: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus: says the LORD: whose name is The God of hosts.

"all"
Ho 5:1: 2: Hear you this: O priests; and listen: you house of Israel; and give you ear: O house of the king; for judgment is toward you: because you have been a snare on Mizpah: and a net spread upon Tabor.
Isa 1:23: Your princes are rebellious: and companions of thieves: every one loves gifts: and follows after rewards: they not judge the fatherless: neither does the cause of the widow come to them.
Jer 5:5: I will get me to the great men: and will speak to them; for they have known the way of the LORD: and the judgment of their God: but these have altogether broken the yoke: and burst the bonds.
Eze 22:27: Her princes in the middle thereof are like wolves ravening the prey: to shed blood: and to destroy souls: to get dishon gain.
Mic 3:11: The heads thereof judge for reward: and the priests thereof teach for hire: and the prophets thereof divine for money: yet will they lean upon the LORD: and say: Is not the LORD among us? none evil can come upon us.
Zep 3:3: Her princes within her are roaring lions; her judges are evening wolves; they not gnaw the bones till the morrow.
Ac 4:5-7: 27: It came to pass on the morrow: that their rulers: and elders: and scribes:
Ac 5:21: When they heard that: they entered into the temple early in the morning: and taught. But the high priest came: and they that were with him: and called the council together: and all the senate of the children of Israel: and sent to the prison to have them brought.

16 Ephraim is smitten, their root is dried up, they will bear no fruit: yes, though they bring forth, yet will I kill even the beloved fruit of their womb.Hosea 9:16

Counts: 155 characters, 22 words, 119 letters, 44 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הֻכָּ֣ה אֶפְרַ֔יִם שָׁרְשָׁ֥ם יָבֵ֖שׁ פְּרִ֣י [בְלִי־ כ] (בַֽל־יַעֲשׂ֑וּן ק) גַּ֚ם כִּ֣י יֵֽלֵד֔וּן וְהֵמַתִּ֖י מַחֲמַדֵּ֥י בִטְנָֽם׃ ס

Lit: Is stricken Ephraim their root is dried up fruit No they shall bear Yes were they to bear children and I would kill the darlings of their womb

KJV: Ephraim is smitten, their root is dried up, they shall bear no fruit: yea, though they bring forth, yet will I slay even the beloved [fruit] of their womb.
References

"their root"
Ho 9:11-13: As for Ephraim: their glory will fly away like a bird: from the birth: and from the womb: and from the conception.
Job 18:16: His roots will be dried up beneath: and above will his branch be cut off.
Isa 5:24: Therefore as the fire devours the stubble: and the flame consumes the chaff: so their root will be as rottenness: and their blossom will go up as dust: because they have cast away the law of the LORD of hosts: and despised the word of the Holy one of Israel.
Isa 40:24: Yes: they will not be planted; yes: they will not be sown: yes: their stock will not take root in the earth: and he will also blow upon them: and they will where: and the whirlwind will take them away as stubble.
Mal 4:1: For: look: the day comes'>comes: that will burn as an oven; and all the proud: yes: and all that do wickedly: will be stubble: and the day that comes'>comes will burn them up: says the LORD of hosts: that it will leave them neither root nor branch.

"the beloved fruit"
Eze 24:21: Speak to the house of Israel: Thus says the Lord GOD; Look: I will profane my sanctuary: the excellency of your strength: the desire of your eyes: and that which your soul pitieth; and your sons and your daughters whom you have left will fall by the sword.

H3588כִּ֛יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֛יkî because Conj

H3808 לֹא lôʼ lo or לוֹא; or לֹה; (Deuteronomy 3:11), a primitive particle; not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles; idiom before, phrase or else, ere, phrase except, ig(-norant), much, less, nay, neither, never, no((-ne), -r, (-thing)), (idiom as though...,(can-), for) not (out of), of nought, otherwise, out of, phrase surely, phrase as truly as, phrase of a truth, phrase verily, for want, phrase whether, without. 		לֹ֥אlō not Adv-NegPrt

17 My God will cast them away, because they not did listen to Him: and they will be wanderers among the nations.Hosea 9:17
Stats
Rank: #7858 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 113 characters, 19 words, 90 letters, 32 vowels, 58 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יִמְאָסֵ֣ם אֱלֹהַ֔י כִּ֛י לֹ֥א שָׁמְע֖וּ לֹ֑ו וְיִהְי֥וּ נֹדְדִ֖ים בַּגֹּויִֽם׃ ס

Lit: Will cast them away My God because not they did obey Him and they shall be wanderers among the nations

KJV: My God will cast them away, because they did not hearken unto him: and they shall be wanderers among the nations.
References

"My God"
2Ch 18:13: Micaiah said: As the LORD lives: even what my God says: that will I speak.
Ne 5:19: Think upon me: my God: for good: according to all that I have done for this people.
Ps 31:14: But I trusted in you: O LORD: I said: You are my God.
Isa 7:13: He said: Hear you now: O house of David; Is it a small thing for you to weary men: but will you weary my God also?
Mic 7:7: Therefore I will look to the LORD; I will wait for the God of my salvation: my God will hear me.
Joh 20:17: 28: Jesus says to her: Touch not me; for I not am yet ascended to my Father: but go to my brothers: and say to them: I ascend to my Father: and your Father; and to my God: and your God.
Php 4:19: But my God will supply all your need according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus.

"because"
Ho 7:13: Woe to them! for they have fled from me: destruction to them! because they have transgressed against me: though I have redeemed them: yet they have spoken lies against me.
1Ki 14:15: 16: For the LORD will smite Israel: as a reed is shaken in the water: and He will root up Israel out of this good land: which He gave to their fathers: and will scatter them beyond the river: because they have made their groves: provoking the LORD to anger.
2Ki 17:14-20: Notwithstanding they not would hear: but hardened their necks: like to the neck of their fathers: that not did believe in the LORD their God.
2Ch 36:16: But they mocked the messengers of God: and despised His words: and misused His prophets: until the wrath of the LORD arose against His people: till there was no remedy.
Ps 81:11-13: But my people not would listen to my voice; and Israel would none of me.
Pr 29:1: He: that being often reproved hardens his neck: will suddenly be destroyed: and that without remedy.
Isa 48:18: O that you hadst listened to my commandments! then had your peace been as a river: and your righteousness as the waves of the sea:
Jer 25:3: 4: From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon king of Judah: even to this day: that is the 3 and twentieth year: the word of the LORD has come to me: and I have spoken to you: rising early and speaking; but you not have listened.
Jer 26:4-6: you will say to them: Thus says the LORD; If you not will listen to me: to walk in my law: which I have set before you:
Jer 35:15-17: I have sent also to you all my servants the prophets: rising up early and sending them: saying: Return you now every man from his evil way: and amend your doings: and not go after other gods to serve them: and you will dwell in the land which I have given to you and to your fathers: but you not have inclined your ear: nor listened to me.
Zec 1:4: Be you not as your fathers: to whom the former prophets have cried: saying: Thus says the LORD of hosts; Turn you now from your evil ways: and from your evil doings: but they not did hear: nor listen to me: says the LORD.
Zec 7:11-14: But they refused to listen: and pulled away the shoulder: and stopped their ears: that they not should hear.
Ac 3:23: It will come to pass: that every soul: which not will hear that prophet: will be destroyed from among the people.

"and"
De 28:64: 65: The LORD will scatter you among all people: from the one end of the earth even to the other; and there you will serve other gods: which neither you nor your fathers have known: even wood and stone.
De 32:26: I said: I would scatter them into corners: I would make the remembrance of them to cease from among men:
Am 8:2: He said: Amos: what see you? And I said: A basket of summer fruit. Then said the LORD to me: The end is come upon my people of Israel; I not will again pass by them any more.
Am 9:9: For: indeed: I will command: and I will sift the house of Israel among all nations: like as grain is sifted in a sieve: yet will not the least grain fall upon the earth.
Joh 7:35: Then said the Jews among themselves: Whither will he go: that we will not find him? will he go to the dispersed among the Gentiles: and teach the Gentiles?
Jas 1:1: James: a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ: to the 12 tribes which are scattered abroad: greeting.

10
Retribution for Israel’s Sin

1 Israel is an empty vine, he brings forth fruit to himself: according to the multitude of his fruit he has increased the altars; according to the goodness of his land they have made goodly images.Hosea 10:1
Stats
Rank: #8262 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 200 characters, 32 words, 162 letters, 61 vowels, 101 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: גֶּ֤פֶן בֹּוקֵק֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל פְּרִ֖י יְשַׁוֶּה־לֹּ֑ו כְּרֹ֣ב לְפִרְיֹ֗ו הִרְבָּה֙ לַֽמִּזְבְּחֹ֔ות כְּטֹ֣וב לְאַרְצֹ֔ו הֵיטִ֖יבוּ מַצֵּבֹֽות׃

Lit: his vine empties Israel fruit He brings forth for himself According to the multitude of his fruit He has increased the altars According to the bounty of his land they have embellished his sacred pillars

KJV: Israel is an empty vine, he bringeth forth fruit unto himself: according to the multitude of his fruit he hath increased the altars; according to the goodness of his land they have made goodly images.
References

"is"
Isa 5:1-7: Now will I sing to my wellbeloved a song of my beloved touching his vineyard. My wellbeloved has a vineyard in a very fruitful hill:
Eze 15:1-5: The word of the LORD came to me: saying:
Na 2:2: For the LORD has turned away the excellency of Jacob: as the excellency of Israel: for the emptiers have emptied them out: and marred their vine branches.
Joh 15:1-6: I am the true vine: and my Father is the husbandman.

"unto"
Zec 7:5: 6: Speak to all the people of the land: and to the priests: saying: When you fasted and mourned in the fifth and seventh month: even those 70 years: did you at all fast to me: even to me?
Ro 14:7: 8: For none of us lives to himself: and no man dies to himself.
2Co 5:16: For what reason henceforth know we no man after the flesh: yes: though we have known Christ after the flesh: yet now henceforth know we Him no more.
Php 2:21: For all seek their own: not the things which are Jesus Christ's.

"to the multitude"
Ho 2:8: For she not did know that I gave her grain: and wine: and oil: and multiplied her silver and gold: which they prepared for Baal.
Ho 8:4: 11: They have set up kings: not but by me: they have made princes: and I knew it not: of their silver and their gold have they made them idols: that they may be cut off.
Ho 12:8: 11: Ephraim said: Yet I am become rich: I have found me out substance: in all my labours they will find none iniquity in me that were sin.
Ho 13:2: 6: Now they sin more and more: and have made them molten images of their silver: and idols according to their own understanding: all of it the work of the craftsmen: they say of them: Let the men that sacrifice kiss the calves.
Jer 2:28: But where are your gods that you have made you? let them arise: if they can save you in the time of your trouble: for according to the number of your cities are your gods: O Judah.

"images"
Le 26:1: You will make you no idols nor graven image: neither rear you up a standing image: neither will you set up any image of stone in your land: to bow down to it: for I am the LORD your God.
1Ki 14:23: For they also built them high places: and images: and groves: on every high hill: and under every green tree.

H1931ה֚וּאhū   (Pro-3ms)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		ה֚וּאhū He Pro-3ms

2 Their heart is divided; now will they be found faulty: he will break down their altars, he will spoil their images.Hosea 10:2
Stats
Counts: 118 characters, 18 words, 94 letters, 34 vowels, 60 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: חָלַ֥ק לִבָּ֖ם עַתָּ֣ה יֶאְשָׁ֑מוּ ה֚וּא יַעֲרֹ֣ף מִזְבְּחֹותָ֔ם יְשֹׁדֵ֖ד מַצֵּבֹותָֽם׃

Lit: Is divided their heart now they are held guilty He will break down their altars He will ruin their sacred pillars

KJV: Their heart is divided; now shall they be found faulty: he shall break down their altars, he shall spoil their images.
References

"Their heart is divided"
Ho 7:8: Ephraim: he has mixed himself among the people; Ephraim is a not cake turned.
1Ki 18:21: Elijah came to all the people: and said: How long halt you between two opinions? if the LORD be God: follow Him: but if Baal: then follow Him. And the people answered Him not">not Him a word.
Isa 44:18: They not have known nor understood: for he has shut their eyes: that they cannot see; and their hearts: that they cannot understand.
Zep 1:5: Them that worship the host of heaven upon the housetops; and them that worship and that swear by the LORD: and that swear by Malcham;
Mt 6:24: No man can serve two masters: for either He will hate the one: and love the other; or else He will hold to the one: and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon.
Lu 16:13: No servant can serve two masters: for either He will hate the one: and love the other; or else He will hold to the one: and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon.
2Th 2:11: 12: For this cause God will send them strong delusion: that they should believe a lie:
Jas 1:8: A double minded man is unstable in all his ways.
Jas 4:4: You adulterers and adulteresses: know you not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.
1Jo 2:15: not Love the world: neither the things that are in the world. If any man love the world: the love of the Father not is in Him.
Re 3:15: 16: I know your works: that you are neither cold nor hot: I would you wert cold or hot.

"break down"

Mic 5:13: Your graven images also will I cut off: and your standing images out of the middle of you; and you will no more worship the work of your hands.

H3588כִּ֤יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֤יkî For Conj

3 For now they will say, We have no king, because we not feared the LORD; what then should a king do to us?Hosea 10:3
Stats
Rank: #8530 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 106 characters, 20 words, 80 letters, 30 vowels, 50 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֤י עַתָּה֙ יֹֽאמְר֔וּ אֵ֥ין מֶ֖לֶךְ לָ֑נוּ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָרֵ֙אנוּ֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֔ה וְהַמֶּ֖לֶךְ מַה־יַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לָּֽנוּ׃

Lit: For now they say no king we have because not we did fear Yahweh and as for a king what would he do for us

KJV: For now they shall say, We have no king, because we feared not the LORD; what then should a king do to us?

4 They have spoken words, swearing falsely in making a covenant: thus judgment springs up as hemlock in the furrows of the field.Hosea 10:4
Stats
Counts: 129 characters, 20 words, 105 letters, 35 vowels, 70 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: דִּבְּר֣וּ דְבָרִ֔ים אָלֹ֥ות שָׁ֖וְא כָּרֹ֣ת בְּרִ֑ית וּפָרַ֤ח כָּרֹאשׁ֙ מִשְׁפָּ֔ט עַ֖ל תַּלְמֵ֥י שָׂדָֽי׃

Lit: They have spoken words Swearing falsely in making a covenant thus springs up like hemlock judgment in the furrows of the field

KJV: They have spoken words, swearing falsely in making a covenant: thus judgment springeth up as hemlock in the furrows of the field.
References

"swearing"
Ho 6:7: But they like men have transgressed the covenant: there have they dealt treacherously against me.
2Ki 17:3: 4: Against him came up Shalmaneser king of Assyria; and Hoshea became his servant: and gave him presents.
Eze 17:13-19: has taken of the king's seed: and made a covenant with him: and has taken an oath of him: he has also taken the mighty of the land:
Ro 1:31: Without understanding: covenantbreakers: without natural affection: implacable: unmerciful:
2Ti 3:3: Without natural affection: trucebreakers: false accusers: incontinent: fierce: despisers of those that are good:

"thus"
De 29:18: Lest'>Lest there should be among you man: or woman: or family: or tribe: whose heart turns away this day from the LORD our God: to go and serve the gods of these nations; lest'>lest there should be among you a root that bears gall and wormwood;
Isa 5:7: For the vineyard of the LORD of hosts is the house of Israel: and the men of Judah His pleasant plant: and He looked for judgment: but look oppression; for righteousness: but look a cry.
Isa 59:13-15: In transgressing and lying against the LORD: and departing away from our God: speaking oppression and revolt: conceiving and uttering from the heart words of falsehood.
Am 5:7: You who turn judgment to wormwood: and leave off righteousness in the earth:
Am 6:12: Will horses run upon the rock? will one plow there with oxen? for you have turned judgment into gall: and the fruit of righteousness into hemlock:
Ac 8:23: For I perceive that you are in the gall of bitterness: and in the bond of iniquity.
Heb 12:15: Looking diligently lest'>lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest'>lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you: and thereby many be defiled;
Re 8:10: 11: The third angel sounded: and there fell a great star from heaven: burning as it were a lamp: and it fell upon the third part of the rivers: and upon the fountains of waters;

5 The inhabitants of Samaria will fear because of the calves of Bethaven: for the people thereof will mourn over it, and the priests thereof that rejoiced on it, for the glory thereof, because it is departed from it.Hosea 10:5
Stats
Rank: #7596 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 216 characters, 34 words, 174 letters, 70 vowels, 104 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לְעֶגְלֹות֙ בֵּ֣ית אָ֔וֶן יָג֖וּרוּ שְׁכַ֣ן שֹֽׁמְרֹ֑ון כִּי־אָבַ֨ל עָלָ֜יו עַמֹּ֗ו וּכְמָרָיו֙ עָלָ֣יו יָגִ֔ילוּ עַל־כְּבֹודֹ֖ו כִּֽי־גָלָ֥ה מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃

Lit: Because of the calf of Beth Aven Fear the inhabitants of Samaria for mourn for it its people and its priests for it shriek upon its glory because has departed from it

KJV: The inhabitants of Samaria shall fear because of the calves of Bethaven: for the people thereof shall mourn over it, and the priests thereof that rejoiced on it, for the glory thereof, because it is departed from it.
References

"the calves"
Ho 8:5: 6: Your calf: O Samaria: has cast you off; my anger is kindled against them: how long will it be ere they attain to innocency?
Ho 13:2: Now they sin more and more: and have made them molten images of their silver: and idols according to their own understanding: all of it the work of the craftsmen: they say of them: Let the men that sacrifice kiss the calves.
1Ki 12:28-32: Whereupon the king took counsel: and made two calves of gold: and said to them: It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem: look your gods: O Israel: which brought you up out of the land of Egypt.
2Ki 10:29: Howbeit from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat: who made Israel to sin: Jehu not departed from after them: to wit: the golden calves that were in Bethel: and that were in Dan.
2Ki 17:16: They left all the commandments of the LORD their God: and made them molten images: even two calves: and made a grove: and worshipped all the host of heaven: and served Baal.
2Ch 11:15: He ordained him priests for the high places: and for the devils: and for the calves which he had made.
2Ch 13:8: Now you think to withstand the kingdom of the LORD in the hand of the sons of David; and you be a great multitude: and there are with you golden calves: which Jeroboam made you for gods.

"Beth-aven"
Ho 4:15: Though you: Israel: play the harlot: yet not let Judah offend; and not come you to Gilgal: neither go you up to Bethaven: nor swear: The LORD lives.
Ho 5:8: Blow you the cornet in Gibeah: and the trumpet in Ramah: cry aloud at Bethaven: after you: O Benjamin.
Jos 7:2: Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai: which is beside Bethaven: on the east side of Bethel: and spoke to them: saying: Go up and view the country. And the men went up and viewed Ai.

"for the people"
Jg 18:24: He said: You have taken away my gods which I made: and the priest: and you are gone away: and what have I more? and what is this that you say to me: What ails you?
Re 18:11-19: The merchants of the earth will weep and mourn over her; for no man buys their merchandise any more:

"the priests"
2Ki 23:5: He put down the idolatrous priests: whom the kings of Judah had ordained to burn incense in the high places in the cities of Judah: and in the places round about Jerusalem; them also that burned incense to Baal: to the sun: and to the moon: and to the planets: and to all the host of heaven.
Zep 1:4: I will also stretch out my hand upon Judah: and upon all the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and I will cut off the remnant of Baal from this place: and the name of the Chemarims with the priests;

"for the glory"
Ho 9:11: As for Ephraim: their glory will fly away like a bird: from the birth: and from the womb: and from the conception.
1Sa 4:21: 22: She named the child Ichabod: saying: The glory is departed from Israel: because the ark of God was taken: and because of her father in law and her husband.
Ac 19:27: So not that only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised: and her magnificence should be destroyed: whom all Asia and the world worships.

6 It will be also carried to Assyria for a present to king Jareb: Ephraim will receive shame, and Israel will be ashamed of his own counsel.Hosea 10:6
Stats
Counts: 143 characters, 24 words, 115 letters, 46 vowels, 69 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: גַּם־אֹותֹו֙ לְאַשּׁ֣וּר יוּבָ֔ל מִנְחָ֖ה לְמֶ֣לֶךְ יָרֵ֑ב בָּשְׁנָה֙ אֶפְרַ֣יִם יִקָּ֔ח וְיֵבֹ֥ושׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵעֲצָתֹֽו׃

Lit: Also The [idol to Assyria shall be carried As a present for King Jareb shame Ephraim shall receive and shall be ashamed Israel of his own counsel

KJV: It shall be also carried unto Assyria for a present to king Jareb: Ephraim shall receive shame, and Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
References

"carried"
Ho 8:6: For from Israel was it also: the workman made it; therefore it is not God: but the calf of Samaria will be broken in pieces.
Isa 46:1: 2: Bel bows down: Nebo stoops: their idols were upon the beasts: and upon the cattle: your carriages were heavy loaden; they are a burden to the weary beast.
Jer 43:12: 13: I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt; and he will burn them: and carry them away captives: and he will array himself with the land of Egypt: as a shepherd puts on his garment; and he will go forth from there in peace.
Da 11:8: will also carry captives into Egypt their gods: with their princes: and with their precious vessels of silver and of gold; and he will continue more years than the king of the north.

"a present"
Ho 5:13: When Ephraim saw his sickness: and Judah saw his wound: then went Ephraim to the Assyrian: and sent to king Jareb: yet could not he heal you: nor cure you of your wound.
2Ki 17:3: Against him came up Shalmaneser king of Assyria; and Hoshea became his servant: and gave him presents.

"receive"
Ho 4:19: The wind has bound her up in her wings: and they will be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
Isa 1:29: For they will be ashamed of the oaks which you have desired: and you will be confounded for the gardens that you have chosen.
Isa 44:9-11: They that make a graven image are all of them vanity; and their delectable things will not profit; and they are their own witnesses; they not see: nor know; that they may be ashamed.
Isa 45:16: They will be ashamed: and also confounded: all of them: they will go to confusion together that are makers of idols.
Jer 2:26: 27: 36: 37: As the thief is ashamed when he is found: so is the house of Israel ashamed; they: their kings: their princes: and their priests: and their prophets:
Jer 3:24: 25: For shame has devoured the labour of our fathers from our youth; their flocks and their herds: their sons and their daughters.
Jer 48:13: Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh: as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel their confidence.
Eze 36:31: Then will you remember your own evil ways: and your doings that were not good: and will lothe yourselves in your own sight for your iniquities and for your abominations.

"ashamed"
Ho 11:6: The sword will abide on his cities: and will consume his branches: and devour them: because of their own counsels.
Job 18:7: The steps of his strength will be straitened: and his own counsel will cast him down.
Isa 30:3: Therefore will the strength of Pharaoh be your shame: and the trust in the shadow of Egypt your confusion.
Jer 7:24: But they listened not: nor inclined their ear: but walked in the counsels and in the imagination of their evil heart: and went backward: not and forward.
Mic 6:16: For the statutes of Omri are kept: and all the works of the house of Ahab: and you walk in their counsels; that I should make you a desolation: and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore you will bear the reproach of my people.

7 As for Samaria, her king is cut off as the foam upon the water.Hosea 10:7
Stats
Counts: 63 characters, 13 words, 48 letters, 20 vowels, 28 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: נִדְמֶ֥ה שֹׁמְרֹ֖ון מַלְכָּ֑הּ כְּקֶ֖צֶף עַל־פְּנֵי־מָֽיִם׃

Lit: Is cut off As for Samaria her king Like a twig on on the water

KJV: As for Samaria, her king is cut off as the foam upon the water.
References

"Samaria"
1Ki 21:1: It came to pass after these things: that Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard: which was in Jezreel: hard by the palace of Ahab king of Samaria.
2Ki 1:3: But the angel of the LORD said to Elijah the Tishbite: Arise: go up to meet the messengers of the king of Samaria: and say to them: Is it not because there is not a God in Israel: that you go to inquire of Baalzebub the god of Ekron?

"king"
Ho 10:3: 15: For now they will say: We have no king: because we not feared the LORD; what then should a king do to us?
2Ki 15:30: Hoshea the son of Elah made a conspiracy against Pekah the son of Remaliah: and smote him: and killed him: and reigned in his stead: in the twentieth year of Jotham the son of Uzziah.
2Ki 17:4: The king of Assyria found conspiracy in Hoshea: for he had sent messengers to So king of Egypt: and brought no present to the king of Assyria: as he had done year by year: therefore the king of Assyria shut him up: and bound him in prison.

"the water"
Jude 1:13: Raging waves of the sea: foaming out their own shame; wandering stars: to whom is reserved the blackness of darkness for ever.

8 The high places also of Aven, the sin of Israel, will be destroyed: the thorn and the thistle will come up on their altars; and they will say to the mountains, Cover us; and to the hills, Fall on us.Hosea 10:8
Stats
Rank: #9805 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 202 characters, 33 words, 155 letters, 55 vowels, 100 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְנִשְׁמְד֞וּ בָּמֹ֣ות אָ֗וֶן חַטַּאת֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל קֹ֣וץ וְדַרְדַּ֔ר יַעֲלֶ֖ה עַל־מִזְבְּחֹותָ֑ם וְאָמְר֤וּ לֶֽהָרִים֙ כַּסּ֔וּנוּ וְלַגְּבָעֹ֖ות נִפְל֥וּ עָלֵֽינוּ׃ ס

Lit: And shall be destroyed the high places of Aven the sin of Israel the thorn and thistle shall grow on their altars and they shall say to the mountains Cover us and to the hills Fall on us

KJV: The high places also of Aven, the sin of Israel, shall be destroyed: the thorn and the thistle shall come up on their altars; and they shall say to the mountains, Cover us; and to the hills, Fall on us.
References

"high places"
Ho 10:5: The inhabitants of Samaria will fear because of the calves of Bethaven: for the people thereof will mourn over it: and the priests thereof that rejoiced on it: for the glory thereof: because it is departed from it.
Ho 4:15: Though you: Israel: play the harlot: yet not let Judah offend; and not come you to Gilgal: neither go you up to Bethaven: nor swear: The LORD lives.
Ho 5:8: Blow you the cornet in Gibeah: and the trumpet in Ramah: cry aloud at Bethaven: after you: O Benjamin.

"the sin"
De 9:21: I took your sin: the calf which you had made: and burnt it with fire: and stamped it: and ground it very small: even until it was as small as dust: and I cast the dust thereof into the brook that descended out of the mount.
1Ki 12:28-30: Whereupon the king took counsel: and made two calves of gold: and said to them: It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem: look your gods: O Israel: which brought you up out of the land of Egypt.
1Ki 13:34: This thing became sin to the house of Jeroboam: even to cut it off: and to destroy it from off the face of the earth.
1Ki 14:16: He will give Israel up because of the sins of Jeroboam: who did sin: and who made Israel to sin.
Am 8:14: They that swear by the sin of Samaria: and say: Your god: O Dan: lives'>lives; and: The manner of Beersheba lives'>lives; even they will fall: and never rise up again.
Mic 1:5: 13: For the transgression of Jacob is all this: and for the sins of the house of Israel. What is the transgression of Jacob? is it not Samaria? and what are the high places of Judah? are they not Jerusalem?

"the thorn"
Ho 9:6: For: indeed: they are gone because of destruction: Egypt will gather them up: Memphis will bury them: the pleasant places for their silver: nettles will possess them: thorns will be in their tabernacles.
Isa 32:13: Upon the land of my people will come up thorns and briers; yes: upon all the houses of joy in the joyous city:
Isa 34:13: Thorns will come up in her palaces: nettles and brambles in the fortresses thereof: and it will be an habitation of dragons: and a court for owls.

"their altars"
1Ki 13:2: He cried against the altar in the word of the LORD: and said: O altar: altar: thus says the LORD; Look: a child will be born to the house of David: Josiah by name; and upon you will He offer the priests of the high places that burn incense upon you: and men's bones will be burnt upon you.
2Ki 23:15: Moreover the altar that was at Bethel: and the high place which Jeroboam the son of Nebat: who made Israel to sin: had made: both that altar and the high place he brake down: and burned the high place: and stamped it small to powder: and burned the grove.
2Ch 31:1: Now when all this was finished: all Israel that were present went out to the cities of Judah: and brake the images in pieces: and cut down the groves: and threw down the high places and the altars out of all Judah and Benjamin: in Ephraim also and Manasseh: until they had utterly destroyed them all. Then all the children of Israel returned: every man to his possession: into their own cities.
2Ch 34:5-7: He burnt the bones of the priests upon their altars: and cleansed Judah and Jerusalem.

"they shall"
Isa 2:19: They will go into the holes of the rocks: and into the caves of the earth: for fear of the LORD: and for the glory of His majesty: when He arises to shake terribly the earth.
Lu 23:30: Then will they begin to say to the mountains: Fall on us; and to the hills: Cover us.
Re 6:16: Said to the mountains and rocks: Fall on us: and hide us from the face of him that sits on the throne: and from the wrath of the Lamb:
Re 9:6: In those days will men seek death: and will not find it; and will desire to die: and death will flee from them.

9 O Israel, you have sinned from the days of Gibeah: there they stood: the battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity not did overtake them.Hosea 10:9
Stats
Counts: 146 characters, 23 words, 117 letters, 46 vowels, 71 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מִימֵי֙ הַגִּבְעָ֔ה חָטָ֖אתָ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל שָׁ֣ם עָמָ֔דוּ לֹֽא־תַשִּׂיגֵ֧ם בַּגִּבְעָ֛ה מִלְחָמָ֖ה עַל־בְּנֵ֥י עַֽלְוָֽה׃

Lit: From the days of Gibeah you have sinned Israel there they stood not did overtake them in Gibeah the battle against the sons of iniquity

KJV: O Israel, thou hast sinned from the days of Gibeah: there they stood: the battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity did not overtake them.

"from"

Jg 20:5: 13: 14: The men of Gibeah rose against me: and beset the house round about upon me by night: and thought to have killed me: and my concubine have they forced: that she is dead.

"the battle"
Jg 20:17-48: The men of Israel: beside Benjamin: were numbered 400000 men that drew sword: all these were men of war.

"did"
Ge 6:5: GOD saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth: and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.
Ge 8:21: The LORD smelled a sweet savour; and the LORD said in His heart: I not will again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from His youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living: as I have done.
Zep 3:6: 7: I have cut off the nations: their towers are desolate; I made their streets waste: that none passs by: their cities are destroyed: so that there is no man: that there is none inhabitant.
Mt 23:31: 32: For what reason you be witnesses to yourselves: that you are the children of them which killed the prophets.

10 It is in my desire that I should chastise them; and the people will be gathered against them, when they will bind themselves in their two furrows.Hosea 10:10

Translation

KJV: It is in my desire that I should chastise them; and the people shall be gathered against them, when they shall bind themselves in their two furrows.

11 Ephraim is as an heifer that is taught, and loves to tread out the grain; but I passed over upon her fair neck: I will make Ephraim to ride; Judah will plow, and Jacob will break his clods.Hosea 10:11
Stats
Rank: #4378 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 203 characters, 29 words, 151 letters, 58 vowels, 93 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאֶפְרַ֜יִם עֶגְלָ֤ה מְלֻמָּדָה֙ אֹהַ֣בְתִּי לָד֔וּשׁ וַאֲנִ֣י עָבַ֔רְתִּי עַל־ט֖וּב צַוָּארָ֑הּ אַרְכִּ֤יב אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ יַחֲרֹ֣ושׁ יְהוּדָ֔ה יְשַׂדֶּד־לֹ֖ו יַעֲקֹֽב׃

Lit: And Ephraim is a heifer trained that loves to thresh grain but I harnessed on her fair her neck I will make pull a plow Ephraim shall plow Judah shall break clods his Jacob

KJV: And Ephraim is as an heifer [that is] taught, [and] loveth to tread out [the corn]; but I passed over upon her fair neck: I will make Ephraim to ride; Judah shall plow, [and] Jacob shall break his clods.
References

"an heifer"
Ho 4:16: For Israel slides back as a backsliding heifer: now the LORD will feed them as a lamb in a large place.
Jer 50:11: Because you were glad: because you rejoiced: O you destroyers of my heritage: because you are grown fat as the heifer at grass: and bellow as bulls;

"and loveth"
Ho 2:5: For their mother has played the harlot: she that conceived them has done shamefully: for she said: I will go after my lovers: that give me my bread and my water: my wool and my flax: my oil and my drink.
Ho 3:1: Then said the LORD to me: Go yet: love a woman beloved of her friend: yet an adulteress: according to the love of the LORD toward the children of Israel: who look to other gods: and love flagons of wine.
Ho 9:1: not Rejoice: O Israel: for joy: as other people: for you have gone a whoring from your God: you have loved a reward upon every cornfloor.
De 25:4: You will not muzzle the ox when he treads out the grain.
Ro 16:18: For they that are such not serve our Lord Jesus Christ: but their own belly; and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.

"but"
Ho 11:4: I drew them with cords of a man: with bands of love: and I was to them as they that take off the yoke on their jaws: and I laid meat to them.

"Judah"

Isa 28:24: Does the plowman plow all day to sow? does he open and break the clods of his ground?

12 Sow to yourselves in righteousness, reap in mercy; break up your fallow ground: for it is time to seek the LORD, till He come and rain righteousness upon you.Hosea 10:12
Stats

Translation
Hebrew: זִרְע֨וּ לָכֶ֤ם לִצְדָקָה֙ קִצְר֣וּ לְפִי־חֶ֔סֶד נִ֥ירוּ לָכֶ֖ם נִ֑יר וְעֵת֙ לִדְרֹ֣ושׁ אֶת־יְהוָ֔ה עַד־יָבֹ֕וא וְיֹרֶ֥ה צֶ֖דֶק לָכֶֽם׃

Lit: Sow for yourselves righteousness Reap in mercy Break up your fallow ground for it is time to seek Yahweh Till He comes and rains righteousness on you

KJV: Sow to yourselves in righteousness, reap in mercy; break up your fallow ground: for it is time to seek the LORD, till he come and rain righteousness upon you.

"Sow"

Pr 11:18: The wicked works a deceitful work: but to him that sows righteousness will be a sure reward.
Pr 18:21: Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it will eat the fruit thereof.

Isa 32:20: Blessed are you that sow beside all waters: that send forth there the feet of the ox and the ass.
Jas 3:18: The fruit of righteousness is sown in peace of them that make peace.

"break"

"time"

1Co 3:6: 7: I have planted: Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.

13 You have plowed wickedness, you have reaped iniquity; you have eaten the fruit of lies: because you did trust in your way, in the multitude of your mighty men.Hosea 10:13
Stats
Rank: #6561 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 157 characters, 25 words, 124 letters, 49 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: חֲרַשְׁתֶּם־רֶ֛שַׁע עַוְלָ֥תָה קְצַרְתֶּ֖ם אֲכַלְתֶּ֣ם פְּרִי־כָ֑חַשׁ כִּֽי־בָטַ֥חְתָּ בְדַרְכְּךָ֖ בְּרֹ֥ב גִּבֹּורֶֽיךָ׃

Lit: You have plowed wickedness iniquity You have reaped You have eaten the fruit of lies Because you trusted in your own way in the multitude of your mighty men

KJV: Ye have plowed wickedness, ye have reaped iniquity; ye have eaten the fruit of lies: because thou didst trust in thy way, in the multitude of thy mighty men.
References

"plowed"
Ho 8:7: For they have sown the wind: and they will reap the whirlwind: it has no stalk: the bud will yield no meal: if so be it yield: the strangers will swallow it up.
Job 4:8: Even as I have seen: they that plow iniquity: and sow wickedness: reap the same.
Pr 22:8: He who sows iniquity will reap vanity: and the rod of his anger will fail.
Ga 6:7: 8: not Be deceived; God not is mocked: for whatever a man sows: that will He also reap.

"eaten"
Pr 1:31: Therefore will they eat of the fruit of their own way: and be filled with their own devices.
Pr 12:19: The lip of truth will be established for ever: but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
Pr 18:20: 21: A man's belly will be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips will he be filled.
Pr 19:5: A false witness will not be unpunished: and he who speaks lies will not escape.

"didst"
Ps 52:7: Indeed: this is the man that not made God His strength; but trusted in the abundance of His riches: and strengthened Himself in His wickedness.
Ps 62:10: not Trust in oppression: and not become vain in robbery: if riches increase: not set your heart upon them.

"in the"
Ps 33:16: There is no king saved by the multitude of an host: a mighty man not is delivered by much strength.
Ec 9:11: I returned: and saw under the sun: that the race is not to the swift: nor the battle to the strong: neither yet bread to the wise: nor yet riches to men of understanding: nor yet favour to men of skill; but time and chance happens to them all.
