14 Therefore will a tumult arise among your people, and all your fortresses will be spoiled, as Shalman spoiled Betharbel in the day of battle: the mother was dashed in pieces upon her children.Hosea 10:14
Stats
Rank: #6839 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 191 characters, 30 words, 155 letters, 56 vowels, 99 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְקָ֣אם שָׁאֹון֮ בְּעַמֶּךָ֒ וְכָל־מִבְצָרֶ֣יךָ יוּשַּׁ֔ד כְּשֹׁ֧ד שַֽׁלְמַ֛ן בֵּ֥ית אַֽרְבֵ֖אל בְּיֹ֣ום מִלְחָמָ֑ה אֵ֥ם עַל־בָּנִ֖ים רֻטָּֽשָׁה׃

Lit: Therefore shall arise tumult among your people and all your fortresses shall be plundered as plundered Shalman in Beth Arbel in the day of battle a mother upon her children dashed in pieces

KJV: Therefore shall a tumult arise among thy people, and all thy fortresses shall be spoiled, as Shalman spoiled Betharbel in the day of battle: the mother was dashed in pieces upon her children.
References

"shall a"
Ho 13:16: Samaria will become desolate; for she has rebelled against her God: they will fall by the sword: their infants will be dashed in pieces: and their women with child will be ripped up.
Isa 22:1-4: The burden of the valley of vision. What ails you now: that you are wholly gone up to the housetops?
Isa 33:14: The sinners in Zion are afraid; fearfulness has surprised the hypocrites. Who among us will dwell with the devouring fire? who among us will dwell with everlasting burnings?
Am 3:8: The lion has roared: who not will fear? the Lord GOD has spoken: who can but prophesy?
Am 9:5: The Lord GOD of hosts is He that'>He who touches the land: and it will melt: and all that dwell therein will mourn: and it will rise up wholly like a flood; and will be drowned: as by the flood of Egypt.

"and all"
2Ki 17:16: They left all the commandments of the LORD their God: and made them molten images: even two calves: and made a grove: and worshipped all the host of heaven: and served Baal.
2Ki 18:9: 10: It came to pass in the fourth year of king Hezekiah: which was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel: that Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria: and besieged it.
Jer 48:41: Kerioth is taken: and the strong holds are surprised: and the mighty men's hearts in Moab at that day will be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.
Na 3:12: All your strong holds will be like fig trees with the firstripe figs: if they be shaken: they will even fall into the mouth of the eater.
Hab 1:10: They will scoff at the kings: and the princes will be a scorn to them: they will deride every strong hold; for they will heap dust: and take it.

"as"
2Ki 18:33: Has any of the gods of the nations delivered at all his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
2Ki 19:11-13: Look: you have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands: by destroying them utterly: and will you be delivered?

"the mother"
Ho 13:16: Samaria will become desolate; for she has rebelled against her God: they will fall by the sword: their infants will be dashed in pieces: and their women with child will be ripped up.
Ge 32:11: Deliver me: I pray you: from the hand of my brother: from the hand of Esau: for I fear him: lest he will come and smite me: and the mother with the children.
Isa 13:16-18: Their children also will be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses will be spoiled: and their wives ravished.
Jer 13:14: I will dash them one against another: even the fathers and the sons together: says the LORD: I not will pity: nor spare: nor have mercy: but destroy them.
Na 3:10: Yet was she carried away: she went into captivity: her young children also were dashed in pieces at the top of all the streets: and they cast lots for her honourable men: and all her great men were bound in chains.

The Faithful God

Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֛י נַ֥עַר יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וָאֹהֲבֵ֑הוּ וּמִמִּצְרַ֖יִם קָרָ֥אתִי לִבְנִֽי׃

Lit: When a child Israel was and I loved him and out of Egypt I called My son

KJV: When Israel was a child, then I loved him, and called my son out of Egypt.
References

"Israel"
Ho 2:15: I will give her her vineyards from there: and the valley of Achor for a door of hope: and she will sing there: as in the days of her youth: and as in the day when she came up out of the land of Egypt.
De 7:7: The LORD not did set His love upon you: nor choose you: because you were more in number than any people; for you were the few of all people:
Jer 2:2: Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem: saying: Thus says the LORD; I remember you: the kindness of your youth: the love of your espousals: when you went after me in the wilderness: in a land that was not sown.
Eze 16:6: When I passed by you: and saw you polluted in your own blood: I said to you when you were in your blood: Live; yes: I said to you when you were in your blood: Live.
Mal 1:2: I have loved you: says the LORD. Yet you say: Wherein have you loved us? Was not Esau Jacob's brother? says the LORD: yet I loved Jacob:

"called"
Ex 4:22: you will say to Pharaoh: Thus says the LORD: Israel is my son: even my firstborn:
Mt 2:15: Was there until the death of Herod: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet: saying: Out of Egypt have I called my son.

2 As they called them, so they went from them: they sacrificed to Baalim, and burned incense to graven images.Hosea 11:2
Stats
Counts: 110 characters, 16 words, 88 letters, 32 vowels, 56 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: קָרְא֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם כֵּ֚ן הָלְכ֣וּ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם לַבְּעָלִ֣ים יְזַבֵּ֔חוּ וְלַפְּסִלִ֖ים יְקַטֵּרֽוּן׃

Lit: As they called them so they went from them to the Baals they sacrificed and to carved images burned incense

KJV: As they called them, so they went from them: they sacrificed unto Baalim, and burned incense to graven images.

"they called"

Zec 7:11: But they refused to listen: and pulled away the shoulder: and stopped their ears: that they not should hear.

Joh 3:19: This is the condemnation: that light is come into the world: and men loved darkness rather than light: because their deeds were evil.

"burned"

3 I taught Ephraim also to go, taking them by their arms; but they not knew that I healed them.Hosea 11:3
Stats
Counts: 93 characters, 17 words, 72 letters, 26 vowels, 46 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֤י תִרְגַּ֙לְתִּי֙ לְאֶפְרַ֔יִם קָחָ֖ם עַל־זְרֹֽועֹתָ֑יו וְלֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּ כִּ֥י רְפָאתִֽים׃

Lit: And I taught to walk Ephraim Taking them by their arms but not they did know that I healed them

KJV: I taught Ephraim also to go, taking them by their arms; but they knew not that I healed them.
References

"taught"
Ex 19:4: You have seen what I did to the Egyptians: and how I bare you on eagles' wings: and brought you to myself.
Nu 11:11: 12: Moses said to the LORD: For what reason have you afflicted your servant? and for what reason have not I found favour in your sight: that you lay the burden of all this people upon me?
De 1:31: In the wilderness: where you have seen how that the LORD your God bare you: as a man does bear His son: in all the way that you went: until you came into this place.
De 8:2: you will remember all the way which the LORD your God led you these 40 years in the wilderness: to humble you: and to prove you: to know what was in your heart: whether you would keep His commandments: or no.
De 32:10-12: He found him in a desert land: and in the waste howling wilderness; he led him about: he instructed him: he kept him as the apple of his eye.
Isa 46:3: Listen to me: O house of Jacob: and all the remnant of the house of Israel: which are borne by me from the belly: which are carried from the womb:
Isa 63:9: In all their affliction he was afflicted: and the angel of his presence saved them: in his love and in his pity he redeemed them; and he bare them: and carried them all the days of old.
Ac 13:18: About the time of 40 years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.

"I healed"
Ho 2:8: For she not did know that I gave her grain: and wine: and oil: and multiplied her silver and gold: which they prepared for Baal.
Ho 7:1: When I would have healed Israel: then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered: and the wickedness of Samaria: for they commit falsehood; and the thief comes in: and the troop of robbers spoils without.
Ho 14:4: I will heal their backsliding: I will love them freely: for my anger is turned away from him.
Ex 15:26: Said: If you will diligently listen to the voice of the LORD your God: and will do that which is right in His sight: and will give ear to His commandments: and keep all His statutes: I will put none of these diseases upon you: which I have brought upon the Egyptians: for I am the LORD that heals you.
Ex 23:25: you will serve the LORD your God: and He will bless your bread: and your water; and I will take sickness away from the middle of you.
Isa 1:2: Hear: O heavens: and give ear: O earth: for the LORD has spoken: I have nourished and brought up children: and they have rebelled against me.
Isa 30:26: Moreover the light of the moon will be as the light of the sun: and the light of the sun will be sevenfold: as the light of 7 days: in the day that the LORD binds up the breach of His people: and heals the stroke of their wound.
Jer 8:22: Is there no balm in Gilead; is there no physician there? why then not is the health of the daughter of my people recovered?
Jer 30:17: For I will restore health to you: and I will heal you of your wounds: says the LORD; because they called you an Outcast: saying: This is Zion: whom no man seeks after.

4 I drew them with cords of a man, with bands of love: and I was to them as they that take off the yoke on their jaws, and I laid meat to them.Hosea 11:4
Stats
Rank: #8786 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 143 characters, 30 words, 107 letters, 40 vowels, 67 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בְּחַבְלֵ֨י אָדָ֤ם אֶמְשְׁכֵם֙ בַּעֲבֹתֹ֣ות אַהֲבָ֔ה וָאֶהְיֶ֥ה לָהֶ֛ם כִּמְרִ֥ימֵי עֹ֖ל עַ֣ל לְחֵיהֶ֑ם וְאַ֥ט אֵלָ֖יו אֹוכִֽיל׃

Lit: With cords gentle I drew them with bands of love and I was to them as those who take the yoke from their neck and I stooped them and fed

KJV: I drew them with cords of a man, with bands of love: and I was to them as they that take off the yoke on their jaws, and I laid meat unto them.
References

"drew"
Song 1:4: Draw me: we will run after you: the king has brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in you: we will remember your love more than wine: the upright love you.
Isa 63:9: In all their affliction he was afflicted: and the angel of his presence saved them: in his love and in his pity he redeemed them; and he bare them: and carried them all the days of old.
Joh 6:44: No man can come to me: except the Father which has sent me draw Him: and I will raise Him up at the last day.
Joh 12:32: I: if I be lifted up from the earth: will draw all men to me.
2Co 5:14: For the love of Christ constrains us; because we thus judge: that if one died for all: then were all dead:

"of a"
2Sa 7:14: I will be his father: and he will be my son. If he commit iniquity: I will chasten him with the rod of men: and with the stripes of the children of men:

"I was"
Le 26:13: I am the LORD your God: which brought you forth out of the land of Egypt: that you not should be their bondmen; and I have broken the bands of your yoke: and made you go upright.

"and I laid"
Ho 2:8: For she not did know that I gave her grain: and wine: and oil: and multiplied her silver and gold: which they prepared for Baal.
Ps 78:23-25: Though he had commanded the clouds from above: and opened the doors of heaven:
Ps 105:40: The people asked: and he brought quails: and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
Joh 6:32-58: Then Jesus said to them: Truly: truly: I say to you: Moses gave you not that bread from heaven; but my Father gives you the true bread from heaven.

5 He will not return into the land of Egypt, but the Assyrian will be his king, because they refused to return.Hosea 11:5
Stats
Counts: 111 characters, 19 words, 88 letters, 31 vowels, 57 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לֹ֤א יָשׁוּב֙ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וְאַשּׁ֖וּר ה֣וּא מַלְכֹּ֑ו כִּ֥י מֵאֲנ֖וּ לָשֽׁוּב׃

Lit: Not He shall return to the land of Egypt but Assyria it shall be his king because they refused to repent

KJV: He shall not return into the land of Egypt, but the Assyrian shall be his king, because they refused to return.
References

"shall not"
Ho 7:16: They return: but not to the most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes will fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this will be their derision in the land of Egypt.
Ho 8:13: They sacrifice flesh for the sacrifices of my offerings: and eat it; but the LORD accepts not them; now will He remember their iniquity: and visit their sins: they will return to Egypt.
Ho 9:3: 6: They will not dwell in the LORD's land; but Ephraim will return to Egypt: and they will eat unclean things in Assyria.

"but"
Ho 5:13: When Ephraim saw his sickness: and Judah saw his wound: then went Ephraim to the Assyrian: and sent to king Jareb: yet could not he heal you: nor cure you of your wound.
Ho 10:6: It will be also carried to Assyria for a present to king Jareb: Ephraim will receive shame: and Israel will be ashamed of his own counsel.
2Ki 15:19: 29: And Pul the king of Assyria came against the land: and Menahem gave Pul a000 talents of silver: that his hand might be with him to confirm the kingdom in his hand.
2Ki 17:3-6: Against him came up Shalmaneser king of Assyria; and Hoshea became his servant: and gave him presents.
2Ki 18:11: The king of Assyria did carry away Israel to Assyria: and put them in Halah and in Habor by the river of Gozan: and in the cities of the Medes:
Isa 8:6-8: Forasmuch as this people refuses the waters of Shiloah that go softly: and rejoice in Rezin and Remaliah's son;
Am 5:27: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus: says the LORD: whose name is The God of hosts.

"because"
Ho 6:1: Come: and let us return to the LORD: for He has torn: and He will heal us; He has smitten: and He will bind us up.
2Ki 17:13: 14: Yet the LORD testified against Israel: and against Judah: by all the prophets: and by all the seers: saying: Turn you from your evil ways: and keep my commandments and my statutes: according to all the law which I commanded your fathers: and which I sent to you by my servants the prophets.
2Ki 18:12: Because they not obeyed the voice of the LORD their God: but transgressed His covenant: and all that Moses the servant of the LORD commanded: and not would hear them: nor do them.
Jer 8:4-6: Moreover you will say to them: Thus says the LORD; Will they fall: not and arise? will He turn away: not and return?
Am 4:6: 8-10: I also have given you cleanness of teeth in all your cities: and want of bread in all your places: yet have you not returned to me: says the LORD.
Zec 1:4-6: Be you not as your fathers: to whom the former prophets have cried: saying: Thus says the LORD of hosts; Turn you now from your evil ways: and from your evil doings: but they not did hear: nor listen to me: says the LORD.

6 The sword will abide on his cities, and will consume his branches, and devour them, because of their own counsels.Hosea 11:6
Stats
Counts: 120 characters, 18 words, 96 letters, 36 vowels, 60 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְחָלָ֥ה חֶ֙רֶב֙ בְּעָרָ֔יו וְכִלְּתָ֥ה בַדָּ֖יו וְאָכָ֑לָה מִֽמֹּעֲצֹ֖ותֵיהֶֽם׃

Lit: And shall slash the sword in his cities and Devour his districts and consume them because of their own counsels

KJV: And the sword shall abide on his cities, and shall consume his branches, and devour them, because of their own counsels.
References

"the sword"
Ho 10:14: Therefore will a tumult arise among your people: and all your fortresses will be spoiled: as Shalman spoiled Betharbel in the day of battle: the mother was dashed in pieces upon her children.
Ho 13:16: Samaria will become desolate; for she has rebelled against her God: they will fall by the sword: their infants will be dashed in pieces: and their women with child will be ripped up.
Le 26:31: 33: I will make your cities waste: and bring your sanctuaries to desolation: and I not will smell the savour of your sweet odours.
De 28:52: He will besiege you in all your gates: until your high and fenced walls come down: wherein you trustedst: throughout all your land: and He will besiege you in all your gates throughout all your land: which the LORD your God has given you.
De 32:25: The sword without: and terror within: will destroy both the young man and the virgin: the suckling also with the man of gray hairs.
Jer 5:17: They will eat up your harvest: and your bread: which your sons and your daughters should eat: they will eat up your flocks and your herds: they will eat up your vines and your fig trees: they will impoverish your fenced cities: wherein you trustedst: with the sword.
Mic 5:11: I will cut off the cities of your land: and throw down all your strong holds:

"consume"
Ps 80:11-16: She sent out her boughs to the sea: and her branches to the river.
Isa 9:14: Therefore the LORD will cut off from Israel head and tail: branch and rush: in one day.
Isa 18:5: For afore the harvest: when the bud is perfect: and the sour grape is ripening in the flower: he will both cut off the sprigs with pruning hooks: and take away and cut down the branches.
Isa 27:10: Yet the defenced city will be desolate: and the habitation forsaken: and left like a wilderness: there will the calf feed: and there will he lie down: and consume the branches thereof.
Eze 15:2-7: Son of man: What is the vine tree more than any tree: or than a branch which is among the trees of the forest?
Eze 20:47: Say to the for of the south: Hear the word of the LORD; Thus says the Lord GOD; Look: I will kindle a fire in you: and it will devour every green tree in you: and every dry tree: the flaming flame will not be quenched: and all faces from the south to the north will be burned therein.
Mal 4:1: For: look: the day comes'>comes: that will burn as an oven; and all the proud: yes: and all that do wickedly: will be stubble: and the day that comes'>comes will burn them up: says the LORD of hosts: that it will leave them neither root nor branch.

"because"
Ho 10:6: It will be also carried to Assyria for a present to king Jareb: Ephraim will receive shame: and Israel will be ashamed of his own counsel.
Ps 106:39: 43: Thus were they defiled with their own works: and went a whoring with their own inventions.
Isa 30:1: Woe to the rebellious children: says the LORD: that take counsel: not but of me; and that cover with a covering: not but of my spirit: that they may add sin to sin:

 וְעַמִּ֥י תְלוּאִ֖ים לִמְשֽׁוּבָתִ֑י וְאֶל־עַל֙ יִקְרָאֻ֔הוּ יַ֖חַד לֹ֥א יְרֹומֵם ׃

H413 אֵל ʼêl ale (but only used in the shortened constructive form אֶל ); a primitive particle; properly, denoting motion towards, but occasionally used of a quiescent position, i.e.; near, with or among; often in general, to; about, according to, after, against, among, as for, at, because(-fore, -side), both...and, by, concerning, for, from, idiom hath, in(-to), near, (out) of, over, through, to(-ward), under, unto, upon, whether, with(-in). 		וְאֶל־wə-’el- and Though to Conj-w | Prep

H7311 רוּם rûwm room a primitive root; to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively); bring up, exalt (self), extol, give, go up, haughty, heave (up), (be, lift up on, make on, set up on, too) high(-er, one), hold up, levy, lift(-er) up, (be) lofty, (idiom a-) loud, mount up, offer (up), phrase presumptuously, (be) promote(-ion), proud, set up, tall(-er), take (away, off, up), breed worms. 		יְרוֹמֵם׃‪‬yə-rō-w-mêm exalt Him V-Piel-Imperf-3ms | 3mp
7 My people are bent to backsliding from me: though they called them to the most High, none at all would exalt him.Hosea 11:7
Stats
Counts: 117 characters, 21 words, 92 letters, 32 vowels, 60 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְעַמִּ֥י תְלוּאִ֖ים לִמְשֽׁוּבָתִ֑י וְאֶל־עַל֙ יִקְרָאֻ֔הוּ יַ֖חַד לֹ֥א יְרֹומֵם ׃

Lit: And My people are bent on backsliding from Me and Though to the Most High they call at all none exalt Him

KJV: And my people are bent to backsliding from me: though they called them to the most High, none at all would exalt him.
References

"are bent"
Ho 4:16: For Israel slides back as a backsliding heifer: now the LORD will feed them as a lamb in a large place.
Ho 14:4: I will heal their backsliding: I will love them freely: for my anger is turned away from him.
Ps 78:57: 58: But turned back: and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
Pr 14:14: The backslider in heart will be filled with his own ways: and a good man will be satisfied from himself.
Jer 3:6: 8: 11: The LORD said also to me in the days of Josiah the king: Have you seen that which backsliding Israel has done? she is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree: and there has played the harlot.
Jer 8:5: Why then is this people of Jerusalem slidden back by a perpetual backsliding? they hold fast deceit: they refuse to return.
Jer 14:7: O LORD: though our iniquities testify against us: do you it for your name's sake: for our backslidings are many; we have sinned against you.

"they called me"
Ho 11:2: As they called them: so they went from them: they sacrificed to Baalim: and burned incense to graven images.
Ho 7:16: They return: but not to the most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes will fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this will be their derision in the land of Egypt.
2Ch 30:1-11: Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah: and wrote letters also to Ephraim and Manasseh: that they should come to the house of the LORD at Jerusalem: to keep the passover to the LORD God of Israel.
Ps 81:11: But my people not would listen to my voice; and Israel would none of me.
Am 5:4-6: 14: 15: For thus says the LORD to the house of Israel: Seek you me: and you will live:

God’s Love for Israel

אֵ֞יךְ אֶתֶּנְךָ֣ אֶפְרַ֗יִם אֲמַגֶּנְךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֚יךְ אֶתֶּנְךָ֣ כְאַדְמָ֔ה אֲשִֽׂימְךָ֖ כִּצְבֹאיִ֑ם נֶהְפַּ֤ךְ עָלַי֙ לִבִּ֔י יַ֖חַד נִכְמְר֥וּ נִחוּמָֽי׃

8 How will I give you up, Ephraim? how will I deliver you, Israel? how will I make you as Admah? how will I set you as Zeboim? my heart is turned within me, my repentings are kindled together.Hosea 11:8
Stats
Rank: #8372 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 202 characters, 30 words, 155 letters, 62 vowels, 93 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֵ֞יךְ אֶתֶּנְךָ֣ אֶפְרַ֗יִם אֲמַגֶּנְךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֚יךְ אֶתֶּנְךָ֣ כְאַדְמָ֔ה אֲשִֽׂימְךָ֖ כִּצְבֹאיִ֑ם נֶהְפַּ֤ךְ עָלַי֙ לִבִּ֔י יַ֖חַד נִכְמְר֥וּ נִחוּמָֽי׃

Lit: How can I give you up Ephraim How can I hand you over Israel how can I make you like Admah How can I set you like Zeboiim churns within Me My heart together is stirred My sympathy

KJV: How shall I give thee up, Ephraim? how shall I deliver thee, Israel? how shall I make thee as Admah? [how] shall I set thee as Zeboim? mine heart is turned within me, my repentings are kindled together.
References

"How shall I give"
Ho 6:4: O Ephraim: what will I do to you? O Judah: what will I do to you? for your goodness is as a morning cloud: and as the early dew it goes away.
Jer 9:7: Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts: Look: I will melt them: and try them; for how will I do for the daughter of my people?
La 3:33: For he does not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.
Mt 23:37: O Jerusalem: Jerusalem: you that kill the prophets: and stone them which are sent to you: how often would I have gathered your children together: even as a hen gathers her chickens under her wings: and you not would!
Lu 19:41: 42: When he was come near: he beheld the city: and wept over it:

"Admah"
Ge 14:8: There went out the king of Sodom: and the king of Gomorrah: and the king of Admah: and the king of Zeboiim: and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar;) and they joined battle with them in the vale of Siddim;
Ge 19:24: 25: Then the LORD rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah brimstone and fire from the LORD out of heaven;
De 29:23: And that the whole land thereof is brimstone: and salt: and burning: that it not is sown: nor bears: nor any grass grows therein: like the overthrow of Sodom: and Gomorrah: Admah: and Zeboim: which the LORD overthrew in His anger: and in His wrath:
Isa 1:9: 10: Except the LORD of hosts had left to us a very small remnant: we should have been as Sodom: and we should have been like to Gomorrah.
Am 4:11: I have overthrown some of you: as God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah: and you were as a firebrand plucked out of the burning: yet have you not returned to me: says the LORD.
Zep 2:9: Therefore as I live: says the LORD of hosts: the God of Israel: Surely Moab will be as Sodom: and the children of Ammon as Gomorrah: even the breeding of nettles: and saltpits: and a perpetual desolation: the residue of my people will spoil them: and the remnant of my people will possess them.
2Pe 2:6: Turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrha into ashes condemned them with an overthrow: making them an ensample to those that after should live ungodly;
Jude 1:7: Even as Sodom and Gomorrha: and the cities about them in like manner: giving themselves over to fornication: and going after strange flesh: are set forth for an example: suffering the vengeance of eternal fire.
Re 11:8: Their dead bodies will lie in the street of the great city: which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt: where also our Lord was crucified.
Re 18:18: Cried when they saw the smoke of her burning: saying: What city is like to this great city!

"Mine"
De 32:36: For the LORD will judge His people: and repent Himself for His servants: when He sees that their power is gone: and there is none shut up: or left.
Jg 10:16: They put away the strange gods from among them: and served the LORD: and His soul was grieved for the misery of Israel.
2Sa 24:16: When the angel stretched out His hand upon Jerusalem to destroy it: the LORD repented Him of the evil: and said to the angel that destroyed the people: It is enough: stay now your hand. And the angel of the LORD was by the threshingplace of Araunah the Jebusite.
2Ki 13:23: The LORD was gracious to them: and had compassion on them: and had respect to them: because of His covenant with Abraham: Isaac: and Jacob: and not would destroy them: neither cast He them from His presence as yet.
Ps 106:45: He remembered for them his covenant: and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.
Isa 63:15: Look down from heaven: and look from the habitation of your holiness and of your glory: where is your zeal and your strength: the sounding of your bowels and of your mercies toward me? are they restrained?
Jer 3:12: Go and proclaim these words toward the north: and say: Return: you backsliding Israel: says the LORD; and I not will cause my anger to fall upon you: for I am merciful: says the LORD: and I not will keep anger for ever.
Jer 31:20: Is Ephraim my dear son? is He a pleasant child? for since I spoke against Him: I do earnestly remember Him still: therefore my bowels are troubled for Him; I will surely have mercy upon Him: says the LORD.
Am 7:3: 6: The LORD repented for this: It will not be: says the LORD.

"heart"
La 1:20: Look: O LORD; for I am in distress: my bowels are troubled; my heart is turned within me; for I have grievously rebelled: abroad the sword bereaves: at home there is as death.

 לֹ֤א אֶֽעֱשֶׂה֙ חֲרֹ֣ון אַפִּ֔י לֹ֥א אָשׁ֖וּב לְשַׁחֵ֣ת אֶפְרָ֑יִם כִּ֣י אֵ֤ל אָֽנֹכִי֙ וְלֹא־אִ֔ישׁ בְּקִרְבְּךָ֣ קָדֹ֔ושׁ וְלֹ֥א אָבֹ֖וא בְּעִֽיר׃

9 I not will execute the fierceness of my anger, I not will return to destroy Ephraim: for I am God, not and man; the Holy one in the middle of you: and I not will enter into the city.Hosea 11:9
Stats
Rank: #8748 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 184 characters, 34 words, 140 letters, 55 vowels, 85 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לֹ֤א אֶֽעֱשֶׂה֙ חֲרֹ֣ון אַפִּ֔י לֹ֥א אָשׁ֖וּב לְשַׁחֵ֣ת אֶפְרָ֑יִם כִּ֣י אֵ֤ל אָֽנֹכִי֙ וְלֹא־אִ֔ישׁ בְּקִרְבְּךָ֣ קָדֹ֔ושׁ וְלֹ֥א אָבֹ֖וא בְּעִֽיר׃

Lit: Not I will execute the fierceness of My anger not I will again destroy Ephraim for God I am and not man in your midst the Holy one and not I will come with terror

KJV: I will not execute the fierceness of mine anger, I will not return to destroy Ephraim: for I am God, and not man; the Holy One in the midst of thee: and I will not enter into the city.
References

"not execute"
Ho 14:4: I will heal their backsliding: I will love them freely: for my anger is turned away from him.
Ex 32:10-14: Now therefore let me alone: that my wrath may wax hot against them: and that I may consume them: and I will make of you a great nation.
De 32:26: 27: I said: I would scatter them into corners: I would make the remembrance of them to cease from among men:
Ps 78:38: But he: being full of compassion: forgave their iniquity: and destroyed them not: yes: many a time turned he his anger away: and not did stir up all his wrath.
Isa 27:4-8: Fury is not in me: who would set the briers and thorns against me in battle? I would go through them: I would burn them together.
Isa 48:9: For my name's sake will I defer my anger: and for my praise will I refrain for you: that I cut you not off.
Jer 30:11: For I am with you: says the LORD: to save you: though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered you: yet will not I make a full end of you: but I will correct you in measure: and not will leave you altogether unpunished.
Jer 31:1-3: At the same time: says the LORD: will I be the God of all the families of Israel: and they will be my people.
Eze 20:8: 9: 13: 14: 21-23: But they rebelled against me: and not would listen to me: they not did every man cast away the abominations of their eyes: neither did they forsake the idols of Egypt: then I said: I will pour out my fury upon them: to accomplish my anger against them in the middle of the land of Egypt.

"return"
1Sa 26:8: Then said Abishai to David: God has delivered your enemy into your hand this day: now therefore let me smite Him: I pray you: with the spear even to the earth at once: and I not will smite Him the second time.
2Sa 20:10: But Amasa took no heed to the sword that was in Joab's hand: so he smote him therewith in the fifth rib: and shed out his bowels to the ground: and struck not him again; and he died. So Joab and Abishai his brother pursued after Sheba the son of Bichri.

"for"
Nu 23:19: God is not a man: that He should lie; neither the son of man: that He should repent: has He said: and will He not">not He do it? or has He spoken: and will He not">not He make it good?
Isa 55:8: 9: For my thoughts are not your thoughts: neither are your ways my ways: says the LORD.
Mic 7:18-20: Who is a God like to you: that pardons iniquity: and passs by the transgression of the remnant of His heritage? He retains not His anger for ever: because He delights in mercy.
Mal 3:6: For I am the LORD: I not change; therefore you sons of Jacob not are consumed.
Ro 11:28: 29: As concerning the gospel: they are enemies for your sakes: but as touching the election: they are beloved for the fathers' sakes.

"the Holy One"
Isa 12:6: Cry out and shout: you inhabitant of Zion: for great is the Holy one of Israel in the middle of you.
Eze 37:27: 28: My tabernacle also will be with them: yes: I will be their God: and they will be my people.
Zep 3:15-17: The LORD has taken away your judgments: He has cast out your enemy: the king of Israel: even the LORD: is in the middle of you: you will not see evil any more.

 אַחֲרֵ֧י יְהוָ֛ה יֵלְכ֖וּ כְּאַרְיֵ֣ה יִשְׁאָ֑ג כִּֽי־ה֣וּא יִשְׁאַ֔ג וְיֶחֶרְד֥וּ בָנִ֖ים מִיָּֽם׃

H3220מִיָּֽם׃mî-yām.   (Prep-m | N-ms)
H3220 יָם yâm yawm from an unused root meaning to roar; a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south; sea (idiom -faring man, (-shore)), south, west (-ern, side, -ward). 		מִיָּֽם׃mî-yām. from the west Prep-m | N-ms
10 They will walk after the LORD: He will roar like a lion: when He will roar, then the children will tremble from the west.Hosea 11:10
Stats
Counts: 125 characters, 21 words, 98 letters, 31 vowels, 67 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֧י יְהוָ֛ה יֵלְכ֖וּ כְּאַרְיֵ֣ה יִשְׁאָ֑ג כִּֽי־ה֣וּא יִשְׁאַ֔ג וְיֶחֶרְד֥וּ בָנִ֖ים מִיָּֽם׃

Lit: After Yahweh they shall walk like a lion He will roar when He roars and shall come trembling His sons from the west

KJV: They shall walk after the LORD: he shall roar like a lion: when he shall roar, then the children shall tremble from the west.
References

"walk"
Isa 2:5: O house of Jacob: come you: and let us walk in the light of the LORD.
Isa 49:10: They will not hunger nor thirst; neither will the heat nor sun smite them: for he who has mercy on them will lead them: even by the springs of water will he guide them.
Jer 2:2: Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem: saying: Thus says the LORD; I remember you: the kindness of your youth: the love of your espousals: when you went after me in the wilderness: in a land that was not sown.
Jer 7:6: 9: If you not oppress the stranger: the fatherless: and the widow: and not shed innocent blood in this place: neither walk after other gods to your hurt:
Jer 31:9: They will come with weeping: and with supplications will I lead them: I will cause them to walk by the rivers of waters in a straight way: wherein they will not stumble: for I am a father to Israel: and Ephraim is my firstborn.
Mic 4:5: For all people will walk every one in the name of His god: and we will walk in the name of the LORD our God for ever and ever.
Zec 10:12: I will strengthen them in the LORD; and they will walk up and down in His name: says the LORD.
Joh 8:12: Then spoke Jesus again to them: saying: I am the light of the world: He that'>He who follows me will not walk in darkness: but will have the light of life.
Ro 8:1: There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus: who not walk after the flesh: but after the Spirit.
2Pe 2:10: But chiefly them that walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness: and despise government. Presumptuous are they: selfwilled: they not are afraid to speak evil of dignities.

"he shall roar like"
Isa 31:4: For thus has the LORD spoken to me: Like as the lion and the young lion roaring on His prey: when a multitude of shepherds is called forth against Him: He not will be afraid of their voice: nor abase Himself for the noise of them: so will the LORD of hosts come down to fight for mount Zion: and for the hill thereof.
Isa 42:13: The LORD will go forth as a mighty man: He will stir up jealousy like a man of war: He will cry: yes: roar; He will prevail against His enemies.
Jer 25:30: Therefore prophesy you against them all these words: and say to them: The LORD will roar from on high: and utter His voice from His holy habitation; He will mightily roar upon His habitation; He will give a shout: as they that tread the grapes: against all the inhabitants of the earth.
Joe 3:16: The LORD also will roar out of Zion: and utter His voice from Jerusalem; and the heavens and the earth will shake: but the LORD will be the hope of His people: and the strength of the children of Israel.
Am 1:2: He said: The LORD will roar from Zion: and utter His voice from Jerusalem; and the habitations of the shepherds will mourn: and the top of Carmel will where.
Am 3:4: 8: Will a lion roar in the for: when he has no prey? will a young lion cry out of his den: if he have not takenhing?

"shall tremble"
Job 37:1: At this also my heart trembles: and is moved out of his place.
Ps 2:11: Serve the LORD with fear: and rejoice with trembling.
Ps 119:120: My flesh trembles for fear of you; and I am afraid of your judgments.
Isa 64:2: As when the melting fire burns: the fire causes the waters to boil: to make your name known to your adversaries: that the nations may tremble at your presence!
Jer 5:22: Fear you not me? says the LORD: will you not tremble at my presence: which have placed the sand for the bound of the sea by a perpetual decree: that it cannot pass it: and though the waves thereof toss themselves: yet can not they prevail; though they roar: yet can not they pass over it?
Jer 33:9: It will be to me a name of joy: a praise and an honour before all the nations of the earth: which will hear all the good that I do to them: and they will fear and tremble for all the goodness and for all the prosperity that I procure to it.
Hab 3:16: When I heard: my belly trembled; my lips quivered at the voice: rottenness entered into my bones: and I trembled in myself: that I might rest in the day of trouble: when he comes up to the people: he will invade them with his troops.
Ac 24:25: As he reasoned of righteousness: temperance: and judgment to come: Felix trembled: and answered: Go your way for this time; when I have a convenient season: I will call for you.

"west"
Zec 8:7: Thus says the LORD of hosts; Look: I will save my people from the east country: and from the west country;

11 They will tremble as a bird out of Egypt, and as a dove out of the land of Assyria: and I will place them in their houses, says the LORD.Hosea 11:11
Stats
Counts: 139 characters, 27 words, 106 letters, 41 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יֶחֶרְד֤וּ כְצִפֹּור֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם וּכְיֹונָ֖ה מֵאֶ֣רֶץ אַשּׁ֑וּר וְהֹושַׁבְתִּ֥ים עַל־בָּתֵּיהֶ֖ם נְאֻם־יְהוָֽה׃ ס

Lit: They shall come trembling like a bird from Egypt and Like a dove from the land of Assyria and I will let them dwell in their houses says Yahweh

KJV: They shall tremble as a bird out of Egypt, and as a dove out of the land of Assyria: and I will place them in their houses, saith the LORD.
References

"out"
Ho 3:5: Afterward will the children of Israel return: and seek the LORD their God: and David their king; and will fear the LORD and His goodness in the latter days.
Ho 9:3-6: They will not dwell in the LORD's land; but Ephraim will return to Egypt: and they will eat unclean things in Assyria.
Isa 11:11: It will come to pass in that day: that the Lord will set His hand again the second time to recover the remnant of His people: which will be left: from Assyria: and from Egypt: and from Pathros: and from Cush: and from Elam: and from Shinar: and from Hamath: and from the islands of the sea.
Zec 10:10: I will bring them again also out of the land of Egypt: and gather them out of Assyria; and I will bring them into the land of Gilead and Lebanon; and place will not be found for them.

"as a dove"
Ho 7:11: Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt: they go to Assyria.
Isa 60:8: Who are these that fly as a cloud: and as the doves to their windows?

"and I"
Jer 31:12: Therefore they will come and sing in the height of Zion: and will flow together to the goodness of the LORD: for wheat: and for wine: and for oil: and for the young of the flock and of the herd: and their soul will be as a watered garden; and they will not sorrow any more at all.
Eze 28:25: Thus says the Lord GOD; When I will have gathered the house of Israel from the people among whom they are scattered: and will be sanctified in them in the sight of the heathen: then will they dwell in their land that I have given to my servant Jacob.
Eze 36:33: 34: Thus says the Lord GOD; In the day that I will have cleansed you from all your iniquities I will also cause you to dwell in the cities: and the wastes will be built.
Eze 37:21: 25: Say to them: Thus says the Lord GOD; Look: I will take the children of Israel from among the heathen: whither they be gone: and will gather them on every side: and bring them into their own land:
Am 9:14: 15: I will bring again the captivity of my people of Israel: and they will build the waste cities: and inhabit them; and they will plant vineyards: and drink the wine thereof; they will also make gardens: and eat the fruit of them.
Ob 1:17: But upon mount Zion will be deliverance: and there will be holiness; and the house of Jacob will possess their possessions.

 12 Ephraim compasss me about with lies, and the house of Israel with deceit: but Judah yet rules with God, and is faithful with the saints.Hosea 11:12
Stats
Rank: #3723 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 139 characters, 22 words, 111 letters, 43 vowels, 68 consonants
Translation
Hebrew:

Lit: Has encircled Me with lies Ephraim and with deceit the house of Israel but Judah still walks with God and Even with the Holy one who is faithful

KJV: Ephraim compasseth me about with lies, and the house of Israel with deceit: but Judah yet ruleth with God, and is faithful with the saints.
References

"compasseth"
Ho 7:16: They return: but not to the most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes will fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this will be their derision in the land of Egypt.
Ho 12:1: 7: Ephraim feeds on wind: and follows after the east wind: he daily increases lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians: and oil is carried into Egypt.
Ps 78:36: Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth: and they lied to him with their tongues.
Isa 29:13: For what reason the Lord said: Forasmuch as this people draw near me with their mouth: and with their lips do honour me: but have removed their heart far from me: and their fear toward me is taught by the precept of men:
Isa 44:20: He feeds on ashes: a deceived heart has turned him aside: that he cannot deliver his soul: nor say: Is there not a lie in my right hand?
Isa 59:3: 4: For your hands are defiled with blood: and your fingers with iniquity; your lips have spoken lies: your tongue has muttered perverseness.
Mic 6:12: For the rich men thereof are full of violence: and the inhabitants thereof have spoken lies: and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.

"Judah"
Ho 4:15: Though you: Israel: play the harlot: yet not let Judah offend; and not come you to Gilgal: neither go you up to Bethaven: nor swear: The LORD lives.
2Ki 18:4-7: He removed the high places: and brake the images: and cut down the groves: and brake in pieces the brasen serpent that Moses had made: for to those days the children of Israel did burn incense to it: and he called it Nehushtan.
2Ch 29:1-32: Hezekiah began to reign when he was 25 years old: and he reigned 29 years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Abijah: the daughter of Zechariah.

"ruleth"
Ge 32:28: He said: Your name will be called no more Jacob: but Israel: for as a prince have you power with God and with men: and have prevailed.
1Co 6:2: Do you not know that the saints will judge the world? and if the world will be judged by you: are you unworthy to judge the small matters?
Re 1:6: has made us kings and priests to God and His Father; to Him be glory and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.
Re 3:21: To Him that overcomes will I grant to sit with me in my throne: even as I also overcame: and am set down with my Father in His throne.
Re 5:10: have made us to our God kings and priests: and we will reign on the earth.

12
A Reproof of Ephraim, Judah, and Jacob

1 Ephraim feeds on wind, and follows after the east wind: he daily increases lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians, and oil is carried into Egypt.Hosea 12:1
Stats
Rank: #8785 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 179 characters, 27 words, 144 letters, 57 vowels, 87 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: סְבָבֻ֤נִי בְכַ֙חַשׁ֙ אֶפְרַ֔יִם וּבְמִרְמָ֖ה בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וִֽיהוּדָ֗ה עֹ֥ד רָד֙ עִם־אֵ֔ל וְעִם־קְדֹושִׁ֖ים נֶאֱמָֽן׃

Lit: Ephraim feeds on the wind and pursues the east wind all daily lies and desolation He increases and a covenant with Assyria they make and oil to Egypt is carried

KJV: Ephraim feedeth on wind, and followeth after the east wind: he daily increaseth lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians, and oil is carried into Egypt.
References

"feedeth"
Ho 8:7: For they have sown the wind: and they will reap the whirlwind: it has no stalk: the bud will yield no meal: if so be it yield: the strangers will swallow it up.
Job 15:2: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge: and fill his belly with the east wind?
Jer 22:22: The wind will eat up all your pastors: and your lovers will go into captivity: surely then will you be ashamed and confounded for all your wickedness.

"he daily"
Ho 11:12: Ephraim compasss me about with lies: and the house of Israel with deceit: but Judah yet rules with God: and is faithful with the saints.

"and they"
Ho 5:13: When Ephraim saw his sickness: and Judah saw his wound: then went Ephraim to the Assyrian: and sent to king Jareb: yet could not he heal you: nor cure you of your wound.
2Ki 15:19: And Pul the king of Assyria came against the land: and Menahem gave Pul a000 talents of silver: that his hand might be with him to confirm the kingdom in his hand.
2Ki 17:4-6: The king of Assyria found conspiracy in Hoshea: for he had sent messengers to So king of Egypt: and brought no present to the king of Assyria: as he had done year by year: therefore the king of Assyria shut him up: and bound him in prison.
Isa 30:6: 7: The burden of the beasts of the south: into the land of trouble and anguish: from where come the young and old lion: the viper and fiery flying serpent: they will carry their riches upon the shoulders of young asses: and their treasures upon the bunches of camels: to a people that will not profit them.

Hלֽוֹ׃lōw.   (Prep | 3ms)
 		לֽוֹ׃lōw. him Prep | 3ms
2 The LORD has also a controversy with Judah, and will punish Jacob according to His ways; according to His doings will He recompense Him.Hosea 12:2
Stats
Counts: 137 characters, 22 words, 111 letters, 38 vowels, 73 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֶפְרַ֜יִם רֹעֶ֥ה ר֙וּחַ֙ וְרֹדֵ֣ף קָדִ֔ים כָּל־הַיֹּ֕ום כָּזָ֥ב וָשֹׁ֖ד יַרְבֶּ֑ה וּבְרִית֙ עִם־אַשּׁ֣וּר יִכְרֹ֔תוּ וְשֶׁ֖מֶן לְמִצְרַ֥יִם יוּבָֽל׃

Lit: And a charge Yahweh brings against Judah and will punish on Jacob according to his ways According to his deeds He will recompense him

KJV: The LORD hath also a controversy with Judah, and will punish Jacob according to his ways; according to his doings will he recompense him.
References

"a controversy"
Ho 4:1: Hear the word of the LORD: you children of Israel: for the LORD has a controversy with the inhabitants of the land: because there is no truth: nor mercy: nor knowledge of God in the land.
Jer 25:31: A noise will come even to the ends of the earth; for the LORD has a controversy with the nations: He will plead with all flesh; He will give them that are wicked to the sword: says the LORD.
Mic 6:2: Hear you: O mountains: the LORD's controversy: and you strong foundations of the earth: for the LORD has a controversy with His people: and He will plead with Israel.

"and will"
2Ki 17:19: 20: Also Judah not kept the commandments of the LORD their God: but walked in the statutes of Israel which they made.
Isa 8:7: 8: Now therefore: look: the Lord brings up upon them the waters of the river: strong and many: even the king of Assyria: and all His glory: and He will come up over all His channels: and go over all His banks:
Isa 10:6: I will send him against an hypocritical nation: and against the people of my wrath will I give him a charge: to take the spoil: and to take the prey: and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.
Jer 3:8-11: I saw: when for all the causes whereby backsliding Israel committed adultery I had put her away: and given her a bill of divorce; yet her treacherous sister Judah not feared: but went and played the harlot also.
Eze 23:11-21: When her sister Aholibah saw this: she was more corrupt in her inordinate love than she: and in her whoredoms more than her sister in her whoredoms.
Eze 23:31: 32: You have walked in the way of your sister; therefore will I give her cup into your hand.

"punish"
Ho 2:13: I will visit upon her the days of Baalim: wherein she burned incense to them: and she decked herself with her earrings and her jewels: and she went after her lovers: and forgot me: says the LORD.
Ho 8:13: They sacrifice flesh for the sacrifices of my offerings: and eat it; but the LORD accepts not them; now will He remember their iniquity: and visit their sins: they will return to Egypt.
Ho 9:9: They have deeply corrupted themselves: as in the days of Gibeah: therefore he will remember their iniquity: he will visit their sins.
Isa 10:12: For what reason it will come to pass: that when the Lord has performed His whole work upon mount Zion and on Jerusalem: I will punish the fruit of the stout heart of the king of Assyria: and the glory of His high looks.
Isa 24:21: It will come to pass in that day: that the LORD will punish the host of the high ones that are on high: and the kings of the earth upon the earth.

"according to his doings"
Isa 3:11: Woe to the wicked! it will be ill with him: for the reward of his hands will be given him.
Isa 59:18: According to their deeds: accordingly he will repay: fury to his adversaries: recompence to his enemies; to the islands he will repay recompence.
Mt 16:27: For the Son of man will come in the glory of His Father with His angels; and then He will reward every man according to His works.
Ro 2:6: Who will render to every man according to his deeds:
Ga 6:7: not Be deceived; God not is mocked: for whatever a man sows: that will He also reap.

וְרִ֥יב לַֽיהוָ֖ה עִם־יְהוּדָ֑ה וְלִפְקֹ֤ד עַֽל־יַעֲקֹב֙ כִּדְרָכָ֔יו כְּמַעֲלָלָ֖יו יָשִׁ֥יב לֹֽו׃

3 He took His brother by the heel in the womb, and by His strength He had power with God:Hosea 12:3
Stats

Counts: 87 characters, 18 words, 67 letters, 21 vowels, 46 consonants
Translation

Lit: In the womb He took by the heel his brother and in his strength he struggled with God

KJV: He took his brother by the heel in the womb, and by his strength he had power with God:

"took"

Ro 9:11: (For the children not being yet born: neither having done any good or evil: that the purpose of God according to election might stand: not of works: but of Him that calls;)

"had, etc"
Ge 32:24-28: Jacob was left alone; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day.
Jas 5:16-18: Confess your faults one to another: and pray one for another: that you may be healed. The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.

4 Yes, he had power over the angel, and prevailed: he wept, and made supplication to him: he found him in Bethel, and there he spoke with us;Hosea 12:4
Stats
Rank: #9615 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 141 characters, 21 words, 108 letters, 44 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בַּבֶּ֖טֶן עָקַ֣ב אֶת־אָחִ֑יו וּבְאֹונֹ֖ו שָׂרָ֥ה אֶת־אֱלֹהִֽים׃

Lit: And Yes he struggled with the Angel and prevailed He wept and sought favor from Him in Bethel He found Him and there He spoke to us

KJV: Yea, he had power over the angel, and prevailed: he wept, and made supplication unto him: he found him in Bethel, and there he spake with us;
References

"angel"
Ge 32:29: Jacob asked him: and said: Tell me: I pray you: your name. And he said: For what reason is it that you do ask after my name? And he blessed him there.
Ge 48:15: He blessed Joseph: and said: God: before whom my fathers Abraham and Isaac did walk: the God which fed me all my life long to this day:
Ex 3:2-5: The angel of the LORD appeared to Him in a flame of fire out of the middle of a bush: and He looked: and: look: the bush burned with fire: and the bush was not consumed.
Isa 63:9: In all their affliction he was afflicted: and the angel of his presence saved them: in his love and in his pity he redeemed them; and he bare them: and carried them all the days of old.
Mal 3:1: Look: I will send my messenger: and He will prepare the way before me: and the Lord: whom you seek: will suddenly come to His temple: even the messenger of the covenant: whom you delight in: look: He will come: says the LORD of hosts.
Ac 7:30-35: When 40 years were expired: there appeared to Him in the wilderness of mount Sina an angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush.

"made"
Ge 32:9-12: Jacob said: O God of my father Abraham: and God of my father Isaac: the LORD which said to me: Return to your country: and to your kindred: and I will deal well with you:
Heb 5:7: Who in the days of his flesh: when he had offered up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears to him that was able to save him from death: and was heard in that he feared;

"found"
Ge 28:11-19: He lighted upon a certain place: and tarried there all night: because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place: and put them for his pillows: and lay down in that place to sleep.
Ge 35:9: God appeared to Jacob again: when He came out of Padanaram: and blessed Him.

"spake"
Ps 66:6: He turned the sea into dry land: they went through the flood on foot: there did we rejoice in him.
1Th 4:17: Then we which are alive and remain will be caught up together with them in the clouds: to meet the Lord in the air: and so will we ever be with the Lord.
Heb 6:13-18: For when God made promise to Abraham: because He could swear by no greater: He sware by Himself:

וָיָּ֤שַׂר אֶל־מַלְאָךְ֙ וַיֻּכָ֔ל בָּכָ֖ה וַיִּתְחַנֶּן־לֹ֑ו בֵּֽית־אֵל֙ יִמְצָאֶ֔נּוּ וְשָׁ֖ם יְדַבֵּ֥ר עִמָּֽנוּ׃

H430אֱלֹהֵ֣י’ĕ-lō-hê   (N-mpc)
H430 אֱלֹהִים ʼĕlôhîym el-o-heem plural of אֱלוֹהַּ; gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative; angels, idiom exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), idiom (very) great, judges, idiom mighty. 		אֱלֹהֵ֣י’ĕ-lō-hê God N-mpc

5 Even the LORD God of hosts; the LORD is His memorial.Hosea 12:5
Stats
Counts: 53 characters, 10 words, 41 letters, 15 vowels, 26 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וָיָּ֤שַׂר אֶל־מַלְאָךְ֙ וַיֻּכָ֔ל בָּכָ֖ה וַיִּתְחַנֶּן־לֹ֑ו בֵּֽית־אֵל֙ יִמְצָאֶ֔נּוּ וְשָׁ֖ם יְדַבֵּ֥ר עִמָּֽנוּ׃

Lit: That is Yahweh God of hosts Yahweh is His memorable name

KJV: Even the LORD God of hosts; the LORD is his memorial.
References

"Even"
Ge 28:16: Jacob awaked out of His sleep: and He said: Surely the LORD is in this place; and I knew it not.
Ge 32:30: Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for I have seen God face to face: and my life is preserved.

"is"
Ex 3:15: God said moreover to Moses: Thus will you say to the children of Israel: The LORD God of your fathers: the God of Abraham: the God of Isaac: and the God of Jacob: has sent me to you: this is my name for ever: and this is my memorial to all generations.
Ps 135:13: Your name: O LORD: endureth for ever; and your memorial: O LORD: throughout all generations.
Isa 42:8: I am the LORD: that is my name: and my glory will not I give to another: neither my praise to graven images.

6 Therefore turn you to your God: keep mercy and judgment, and wait on your God continually.Hosea 12:6
Stats
Counts: 89 characters, 14 words, 71 letters, 24 vowels, 47 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַֽיהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י הַצְּבָאֹ֑ות יְהוָ֖ה זִכְרֹֽו׃

Lit: So you by the help of your God return mercy and justice Observe and wait on your God continually

KJV: Therefore turn thou to thy God: keep mercy and judgment, and wait on thy God continually.
References

"turn"
Ho 14:1: O Israel: return to the LORD your God; for you have fallen by your iniquity.
Pr 1:23: Turn you at my reproof: look: I will pour out my spirit to you: I will make known my words to you.
Isa 31:6: Turn you to him from whom the children of Israel have deeply revolted.
Isa 55:6: 7: Seek you the LORD while He may be found: call you upon Him while He is near:
Jer 3:14-22: Turn: O backsliding children: says the LORD; for I am married to you: and I will take you one of a city: and two of a family: and I will bring you to Zion:
La 3:39-41: For what reason does a living man complain: a man for the punishment of his sins?
Joe 2:13: Rend your heart: not and your garments: and turn to the LORD your God: for He is gracious and merciful: slow to anger: and of great kindness: and repents Him of the evil.
Zec 1:3: Therefore say you to them: Thus says the LORD of hosts; Turn you to me: says the LORD of hosts: and I will turn to you: says the LORD of hosts.
Ac 2:38: Then Peter said to them: Repent: and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins: and you will receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.
Ac 26:20: But showed first to them of Damascus: and at Jerusalem: and throughout all the coasts of Judaea: and then to the Gentiles: that they should repent and turn to God: and do works meet for repentance.

"keep"
Ho 4:1: Hear the word of the LORD: you children of Israel: for the LORD has a controversy with the inhabitants of the land: because there is no truth: nor mercy: nor knowledge of God in the land.
Pr 21:3: To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.
Isa 1:16: Wash you: make you clean; put away the evil of your doings from before my eyes; cease to do evil;
Isa 58:6: Is not this the fast that I have chosen? to loose the bands of wickedness: to undo the heavy burdens: and to let the oppressed go free: and that you break every yoke?
Jer 22:15: Will you reign: because you close yourself in cedar? not did your father eat and drink: and do judgment and justice: and then it was well with him?
Am 5:24: But let judgment run down as waters: and righteousness as a mighty stream.
Mic 6:8: He has showed you: O man: what is good; and what does the LORD require of you: but to do justly: and to love mercy: and to walk humbly with your God?
Zec 7:9: Thus speaks the LORD of hosts: saying: Execute true judgment: and show mercy and compassions every man to His brother:
Zec 8:16: These are the things that you will do; Speak you every man the truth to his neighbour; execute the judgment of truth and peace in your gates:
Jas 1:27: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this: To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction: and to keep Himself unspotted from the world.
Jas 2:13: For he will have judgment without mercy: that has showed no mercy; and mercy rejoices against judgment.

"wait"
Ge 49:18: I have waited for your salvation: O LORD.
Ps 27:14: Wait on the LORD: be of good courage: and He will strengthen your heart: wait: I say: on the LORD.
Ps 37:7: Rest in the LORD: and wait patiently for Him: not fret yourself because of Him who prospers in His way: because of the man who brings wicked devices to pass.
Ps 123:2: Look: as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their masters: and as the eyes of a maiden to the hand of her mistress; so our eyes wait upon the LORD our God: until that He have mercy upon us.
Ps 130:5-7: I wait for the LORD: my soul does wait: and in His word do I hope.
Isa 8:17: I will wait upon the LORD: that hides His face from the house of Jacob: and I will look for Him.
Isa 30:18: Therefore will the LORD wait: that He may be gracious to you: and therefore will He be exalted: that He may have mercy upon you: for the LORD is a God of judgment: blessed are all they that wait for Him.
Isa 40:31: But they that wait upon the LORD will renew their strength; they will mount up with wings as eagles; they will run: not and be weary; and they will walk: not and faint.
La 3:25: 26: The LORD is good to them that wait for Him: to the soul that seeks Him.
Hab 2:3: For the vision is yet for an appointed time: but at the end it will speak: not and lie: though it tarry: wait for it; because it will surely come: it not will tarry.
Zep 3:8: Therefore wait you upon me: says the LORD: until the day that I rise up to the prey: for my determination is to gather the nations: that I may assemble the kingdoms: to pour upon them my indignation: even all my fierce anger: for all the earth will be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.

7 He is a merchant, the balances of deceit are in his hand: he loves to oppress.Hosea 12:7
Stats
Rank: #6920 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 81 characters, 12 words, 61 letters, 24 vowels, 37 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֖ה בֵּאלֹהֶ֣יךָ תָשׁ֑וּב חֶ֤סֶד וּמִשְׁפָּט֙ שְׁמֹ֔ר וְקַוֵּ֥ה אֶל־אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ תָּמִֽיד׃

Lit: Canaan in his hand scales are Deceitful to oppress He loves

KJV: He is a merchant, the balances of deceit [are] in his hand: he loveth to oppress.
References

"a merchant"
Eze 16:3: Say: Thus says the Lord GOD to Jerusalem; Your birth and your nativity is of the land of Canaan; your father was an Amorite: and your mother an Hittite.
Zec 14:21: Yes: every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah will be holiness to the LORD of hosts: and all they that sacrifice will come and take of them: and seethe therein: and in that day there will be no more the Canaanite in the house of the LORD of hosts.
Joh 2:16: Said to them that sold doves: Take these things here; not make my Father's house an house of merchandise.

"the balances"
Le 19:35: 36: You will do no unrighteousness in judgment: in meteyard: in weight: or in measure.
Pr 11:1: A false balance is abomination to the LORD: but a just weight is His delight.
Pr 16:11: A just weight and balance are the LORD's: all the weights of the bag are His work.
Am 8:5: 6: Saying: When will the new moon be gone: that we may sell grain? and the sabbath: that we may set forth wheat: making the ephah small: and the shekel great: and falsifying the balances by deceit?
Mic 6:10: 11: Are there yet the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked: and the scant measure that is abominable?
1Ti 6:9: 10: But they that will be rich fall into temptation and a snare: and into many foolish and hurtful lusts: which drown men in destruction and perdition.

"he loveth"
Isa 3:5: The people will be oppressed: every one by another: and every one by his neighbour: the child will behave himself proudly against the ancient: and the base against the honourable.
Eze 22:29: The people of the land have used oppression: and exercised robbery: and have vexed the poor and needy: yes: they have oppressed the stranger wrongfully.
Am 2:7: That pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor: and turn aside the way of the meek: and a man and his father will go in to the same maid: to profane my holy name:
Am 3:9: Publish in the palaces at Ashdod: and in the palaces in the land of Egypt: and say: Assemble yourselves upon the mountains of Samaria: and look the great tumults in the middle thereof: and the oppressed in the middle thereof.
Am 4:1: Hear this word: you cattle of Bashan: that are in the mountain of Samaria: which oppress the poor: which crush the needy: which say to their masters: Bring: and let us drink.
Am 5:11: Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon the poor: and you take from him burdens of wheat: you have built houses of cut stone: but you will not dwell in them; you have planted pleasant vineyards: but you will not drink wine of them.
Mic 2:1: Woe to them that devise iniquity: and work evil upon their beds! when the morning is light: they practise it: because it is in the power of their hand.
Mic 3:1-3: I said: Hear: I pray you: O heads of Jacob: and you princes of the house of Israel; Is it not for you to know judgment?
Mic 7:2: The good man is perished out of the earth: and there is none upright among men: they all lie in wait for blood; they hunt every man his brother with a net.
Mal 3:5: I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers: and against the adulterers: and against false swearers: and against those that oppress the hireling in His wages: the widow: and the fatherless: and that turn aside the stranger from His right: and not fear me: says the LORD of hosts.
Jas 5:4: Look: the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields: which is of you kept back by fraud: cries: and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth.

"oppress"
1Sa 12:3: Look: here I am: witness against me before the LORD: and before His anointed: whose ox have I taken? or whose ass have I taken? or whom have I defrauded? whom have I oppressed? or of whose hand have I received any bribe to blind my eyes therewith? and I will restore it you.

8 Ephraim said, Yet I am become rich, I have found me out substance: in all my labours they will find none iniquity in me that were sin.Hosea 12:8
Stats
Counts: 141 characters, 23 words, 108 letters, 44 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כְּנַ֗עַן בְּיָדֹ֛ו מֹאזְנֵ֥י מִרְמָ֖ה לַעֲשֹׁ֥ק אָהֵֽב׃

Lit: And said Ephraim surely I have become rich I have found wealth for myself In all my labors no they shall find in me iniquity that is sin

KJV: And Ephraim said, Yet I am become rich, I have found me out substance: in all my labours they shall find none iniquity in me that [were] sin.
References

"Yet"
Job 31:24: 25: If I have made gold my hope: or have said to the fine gold: You are my confidence;
Ps 49:6: They that trust in their wealth: and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;
Ps 52:7: Indeed: this is the man that not made God His strength; but trusted in the abundance of His riches: and strengthened Himself in His wickedness.
Ps 62:10: not Trust in oppression: and not become vain in robbery: if riches increase: not set your heart upon them.
Zec 11:5: Whose possessors kill them: and hold not themselves guilty: and they that sell them say: Blessed be the LORD; for I am rich: and their own shepherds pity not them.
Lu 12:19: I will say to my soul: Soul: you have much goods laid up for many years; take your ease: eat: drink: and be merry.
Lu 16:13: No servant can serve two masters: for either He will hate the one: and love the other; or else He will hold to the one: and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon.
1Ti 6:5: 17: Perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds: and destitute of the truth: supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw yourself.
Re 3:17: Because you say: I am rich: and increased with goods: and have need not ofhing; and know not that you are wretched: and miserable: and poor: and blind: and naked:

"I have"
De 8:17: you say in your heart: My power and the might of my hand has gotten me this wealth.
Isa 10:13: 14: For he says: By the strength of my hand I have done it: and by my wisdom; for I am prudent: and I have removed the bounds of the people: and have robbed their treasures: and I have put down the inhabitants like a valiant man:
Hab 1:16: Therefore they sacrifice to their net: and burn incense to their drag; because by them their portion is fat: and their meat plenteous.
Hab 2:5: 6: Yes also: because he transgresss by wine: he is a proud man: neither keeps at home: who enlarges his desire as hell: and is as death: and cannot be satisfied: but gathers to him all nations: and heaps to him all people:

"they"
Pr 30:12: 20: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes: and yet not is washed from their filthiness.
Jer 2:23: 35: How canst you say: I not am polluted: I not have gone after Baalim? see your way in the valley: know what you have done: you are a swift dromedary traversing her ways;
Mal 2:17: You have wearied the LORD with your words. Yet you say: Wherein have we wearied Him? When you say: Every one that does evil is good in the sight of the LORD: and He delights in them; or: Where is the God of judgment?
Mal 3:13: your words have been stout against me: says the LORD. Yet you say: What have we spoken so much against you?
Lu 10:29: But He: willing to justify Himself: said to Jesus: And who is my neighbour?
Lu 16:15: He said to them: You are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knows your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.

H4150מוֹעֵֽד׃mō-w-‘êḏ.   (N-ms)
H4150 מוֹעֵד môwʻêd mo-ade or מֹעֵד; or (feminine) מוֹעָדָה; (2 Chronicles 8:13), from יָעַד; properly, an appointment, i.e. a fixed time or season; specifically, a festival; conventionally ayear; by implication, an assembly (as convened for a definite purpose); technically the congregation; by extension, the place of meeting; also a signal (as appointed beforehand); appointed (sign, time), (place of, solemn) assembly, congregation, (set, solemn) feast, (appointed, due) season, solemn(-ity), synogogue, (set) time (appointed). 		מוֹעֵֽד׃mō-w-‘êḏ. of the appointed feast N-ms
9 I that am the LORD your God from the land of Egypt will yet make you to dwell in tabernacles, as in the days of the solemn feast.Hosea 12:9
Stats
Counts: 133 characters, 28 words, 103 letters, 35 vowels, 68 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶפְרַ֔יִם אַ֣ךְ עָשַׁ֔רְתִּי מָצָ֥אתִי אֹ֖ון לִ֑י כָּל־יְגִיעַ֕י לֹ֥א יִמְצְאוּ־לִ֖י עָוֹ֥ן אֲשֶׁר־חֵֽטְא׃

Lit: But I am Yahweh your God Ever since the land of Egypt again I will make you dwell in tents as in the days of the appointed feast

KJV: And I that am the LORD thy God from the land of Egypt will yet make thee to dwell in tabernacles, as in the days of the solemn feast.
References

"I that"
Ho 13:4: Yet I am the LORD your God from the land of Egypt: and you will know no god but me: for there is no saviour beside me.
Ex 20:2: I am the LORD your God: which have brought you out of the land of Egypt: out of the house of bondage.
Le 19:36: Just balances: just weights: a just ephah: and a just hin: will you have: I am the LORD your God: which brought you out of the land of Egypt.
Le 26:13: I am the LORD your God: which brought you forth out of the land of Egypt: that you not should be their bondmen; and I have broken the bands of your yoke: and made you go upright.
Nu 15:41: I am the LORD your God: which brought you out of the land of Egypt: to be your God: I am the LORD your God.
Ps 81:10: I am the LORD your God: which brought you out of the land of Egypt: open your mouth wide: and I will fill it.
Mic 6:4: For I brought you up out of the land of Egypt: and redeemed you out of the house of servants; and I sent before you Moses: Aaron: and Miriam.

"yet"
Ge 25:27: The boys grew: and Esau was a cunning hunter: a man of the field; and Jacob was a plain man: dwelling in tents.
2Sa 7:2: That the king said to Nathan the prophet: See now: I dwell in an house of cedar: but the ark of God dwells within curtains.
Jer 35:7: Neither will you build house: nor sow seed: nor plant vineyard: nor have any: but all your days you will dwell in tents; that you may live many days in the land where you be strangers.
Heb 11:9-13: By faith he sojourned in the land of promise: as in a strange country: dwelling in tabernacles with Isaac and Jacob: the heirs with him of the same promise:

"as in"
Le 23:40-43: you will take you on the first day the boughs of goodly trees: branches of palm trees: and the boughs of thick trees: and willows of the brook; and you will rejoice before the LORD your God 7 days.
Ezr 3:4: They kept also the feast of tabernacles: as it is written: and offered the daily burnt offerings by number: according to the custom: as the duty of every day required;
Ne 8:15-17: That they should publish and proclaim in all their cities: and in Jerusalem: saying: Go forth to the mount: and fetch olive branches: and pine branches: and myrtle branches: and palm branches: and branches of thick trees: to make booths: as it is written.
Zec 14:16-19: It will come to pass: that every one that is left of all the nations which came against Jerusalem will even go up from year to year to worship the King: the LORD of hosts: and to keep the feast of tabernacles.
Joh 7:2: Now the Jews' feast of tabernacles was at hand.

10 I have also spoken by the prophets, and I have multiplied visions, and used similitudes, by the ministry of the prophets.Hosea 12:10
Stats
Rank: #9722 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 121 characters, 18 words, 97 letters, 36 vowels, 61 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֛י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם עֹ֛ד אֹושִֽׁיבְךָ֥ בָאֳהָלִ֖ים כִּימֵ֥י מֹועֵֽד׃

Lit: And I have spoken by the prophets and I visions have multiplied and through the witness of the prophets I have given symbols

KJV: I have also spoken by the prophets, and I have multiplied visions, and used similitudes, by the ministry of the prophets.

"have also"

1Ki 19:10: He said: I have been very jealous for the LORD God of hosts: for the children of Israel have forsaken your covenant: thrown down your altars: and killed your prophets with the sword; and I: even I only: am left; and they seek my life: to take it away.
2Ki 17:13: Yet the LORD testified against Israel: and against Judah: by all the prophets: and by all the seers: saying: Turn you from your evil ways: and keep my commandments and my statutes: according to all the law which I commanded your fathers: and which I sent to you by my servants the prophets.

"multiplied"

11 Is there iniquity in Gilead? surely they are vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yes, their altars are as heaps in the furrows of the fields.Hosea 12:11
Stats
Counts: 152 characters, 18 words, 118 letters, 47 vowels, 71 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְדִבַּ֙רְתִּי֙ עַל־הַנְּבִיאִ֔ים וְאָנֹכִ֖י חָזֹ֣ון הִרְבֵּ֑יתִי וּבְיַ֥ד הַנְּבִיאִ֖ים אֲדַמֶּֽה׃

Lit: Though Gilead has idols surely vanity They are in Gilgal bulls Though they sacrifice indeed their altars shall be heaps in the furrows of the field

KJV: Is there iniquity [in] Gilead? surely they are vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yea, their altars [are] as heaps in the furrows of the fields.
References

"iniquity"
Ho 6:8: Gilead is a city of them that work iniquity: and is polluted with blood.
1Ki 17:1: Elijah the Tishbite: who was of the inhabitants of Gilead: said to Ahab: As the LORD God of Israel lives: before whom I stand: there will not be dew nor rain these years: but according to my word.

"surely"
Jer 10:8: 15: But they are altogether brutish and foolish: the stock is a doctrine of vanities.
Jon 2:8: They that observe lying vanities forsake their own mercy.

"they sacrifice"
Ho 4:15: Though you: Israel: play the harlot: yet not let Judah offend; and not come you to Gilgal: neither go you up to Bethaven: nor swear: The LORD lives.
Ho 9:15: All their wickedness is in Gilgal: for there I hated them: for the wickedness of their doings I will drive them out of my house: I will love them no more: all their princes are revolters.
Am 4:4: Come to Bethel: and transgress; at Gilgal multiply transgression; and bring your sacrifices every morning: and your tithes after 3 years:
Am 5:5: But not seek Bethel: nor enter into Gilgal: and not pass to Beersheba: for Gilgal will surely go into captivity: and Bethel will come to nought.

"their altars"
Ho 8:11: Because Ephraim has made many altars to sin: altars will be to him to sin.
Ho 10:1: Israel is an empty vine: he brings forth fruit to himself: according to the multitude of his fruit he has increased the altars; according to the goodness of his land they have made goodly images.
2Ki 17:9-11: The children of Israel did secretly those things that were not right against the LORD their God: and they built them high places in all their cities: from the tower of the watchmen to the fenced city.
Jer 2:20: 28: For of old time I have broken your yoke: and burst your bands; and you said: I not will transgress; when upon every high hill and under every green tree you wander: playing the harlot.

12 Jacob fled into the country of Syria, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept sheep.Hosea 12:12

Lit: And fled Jacob to the country of Syria and served Israel for a spouse and for a wife he tended sheep

KJV: And Jacob fled into the country of Syria, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept sheep.

13 By a prophet the LORD brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet was He preserved.Hosea 12:13
Stats
Rank: #4577 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 89 characters, 17 words, 70 letters, 24 vowels, 46 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיִּבְרַ֥ח יַעֲקֹ֖ב שְׂדֵ֣ה אֲרָ֑ם וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ד יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּאִשָּׁ֔ה וּבְאִשָּׁ֖ה שָׁמָֽר׃

Lit: And by a prophet brought Yahweh Israel out of Egypt and by a prophet he was preserved

KJV: And by a prophet the LORD brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet was he preserved.
References

"And by a prophet the LORD brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet was he preserved."
Ho 13:4: 5: Yet I am the LORD your God from the land of Egypt: and you will know no god but me: for there is no saviour beside me.
Ex 12:50: 51: Thus did all the children of Israel; as the LORD commanded Moses and Aaron: so did they.
Ex 13:3: Moses said to the people: Remember this day: in which you came out from Egypt: out of the house of bondage; for by strength of hand the LORD brought you out from this place: there will no leavened bread be eaten.
1Sa 12:8: When Jacob was come into Egypt: and your fathers cried to the LORD: then the LORD sent Moses and Aaron: which brought forth your fathers out of Egypt: and made them dwell in this place.
Ps 77:20: You led your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
Isa 63:11: 12: Then He remembered the days of old: Moses: and His people: saying: Where is He that'>He who brought them up out of the sea with the shepherd of His flock? where is He that'>He who put His holy Spirit within Him?
Am 2:11: 12: I raised up of your sons for prophets: and of your young men for Nazarites. Is it not even thus: O you children of Israel? says the LORD.
Mic 6:4: For I brought you up out of the land of Egypt: and redeemed you out of the house of servants; and I sent before you Moses: Aaron: and Miriam.
Ac 3:22: 23: For Moses truly said to the fathers: A prophet will the Lord your God raise up to you of your brothers: like to me; Him will you hear in all things whatever He will say to you.
Ac 7:35-37: This Moses whom they refused: saying: Who made you a ruler and a judge? the same did God send to be a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel which appeared to Him in the bush.
