14 Ephraim provoked Him to anger most bitterly: therefore will He leave His blood upon Him, and His reproach will His Lord return to Him.Hosea 12:14
Stats
Rank: #5455 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 138 characters, 22 words, 112 letters, 41 vowels, 71 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּבְנָבִ֕יא הֶעֱלָ֧ה יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וּבְנָבִ֖יא נִשְׁמָֽר׃

Lit: Provoked Him to anger Ephraim most bitterly therefore the guilt of his bloodshed upon him will leave and his reproach return upon him his Lord

KJV: Ephraim provoked him to anger most bitterly: therefore shall he leave his blood upon him, and his reproach shall his Lord return unto him.
References

"provoked"
2Ki 17:7-18: For so it was: that the children of Israel had sinned against the LORD their God: which had brought them up out of the land of Egypt: from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt: and had feared other gods:
Eze 23:2-10: Son of man: there were two women: the daughters of one mother:

"therefore"
2Sa 1:16: David said to Him: Your blood be upon your head; for your mouth has testified against you: saying: I have killed the LORD's anointed.
1Ki 2:33: 34: Their blood will therefore return upon the head of Joab: and upon the head of His seed for ever: but upon David: and upon His seed: and upon His house: and upon His throne: will there be peace for ever from the LORD.
Eze 18:13: Has given forth upon usury: and has taken increase: will he then live? he will not live: he has done all these abominations; he will surely die; his blood will be upon him.
Eze 24:7: 8: For her blood is in the middle of her; she set it upon the top of a rock; she poured not it upon the ground: to cover it with dust;
Eze 33:5: He heard the sound of the trumpet: and not took warning; his blood will be upon him. But he who takes warning will deliver his soul.

"and his"
Ho 7:16: They return: but not to the most High: they are like a deceitful bow: their princes will fall by the sword for the rage of their tongue: this will be their derision in the land of Egypt.
De 28:37: you will become an astonishment: a proverb: and a byword: among all nations whither the LORD will lead you.
1Sa 2:30: For what reason the LORD God of Israel says: I said indeed that your house: and the house of your father: should walk before me for ever: but now the LORD says: Be it far from me; for them that honour me I will honour: and they that despise me will be lightly esteemed.
Da 11:18: After this will he turn his face to the isles: and will take many: but a prince for his own behalf will cause the reproach offered by him to cease; without his own reproach he will cause it to turn upon him.

God’s Anger against Israel

1 When Ephraim spoke trembling, he exalted himself in Israel; but when he offended in Baal, he died.Hosea 13:1
Stats
Counts: 98 characters, 14 words, 78 letters, 30 vowels, 48 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כְּדַבֵּ֤ר אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ רְתֵ֔ת נָשָׂ֥א ה֖וּא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֶּאְשַׁ֥ם בַּבַּ֖עַל וַיָּמֹֽת׃

Lit: When spoke Ephraim trembling exalted He himself in Israel but when he offended through Baal worship and he died

KJV: When Ephraim spake trembling, he exalted himself in Israel; but when he offended in Baal, he died.
References

"Ephraim"
1Sa 15:17: Samuel said: When you were little in your own sight: were you not made the head of the tribes of Israel: and the LORD anointed you king over Israel?
Pr 18:12: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty: and before honour is humility.
Isa 66:2: For all those things has my hand made: and all those things have been: says the LORD: but to this man will I look: even to Him that is poor and of a contrite spirit: and trembles at my word.
Lu 14:11: For whoever exalts himself will be abased; and he who humbles himself will be exalted.

"exalted"
Nu 2:18-21: On the west side will be the standard of the camp of Ephraim according to their armies: and the captain of the sons of Ephraim will be Elishama the son of Ammihud.
Nu 10:22: The standard of the camp of the children of Ephraim set forward according to their armies: and over his host was Elishama the son of Ammihud.
Nu 13:8: 16: Of the tribe of Ephraim: Oshea the son of Nun.
Nu 27:16-23: Let the LORD: the God of the spirits of all flesh: set a man over the congregation:
Jos 3:7: The LORD said to Joshua: This day will I begin to magnify you in the sight of all Israel: that they may know that: as I was with Moses: so I will be with you.
1Ki 12:25: Then Jeroboam built Shechem in mount Ephraim: and dwelt therein; and went out from there: and built Penuel.

"offended"
Ho 11:2: As they called them: so they went from them: they sacrificed to Baalim: and burned incense to graven images.
1Ki 16:29-33: In the 30 and eighth year of Asa king of Judah began Ahab the son of Omri to reign over Israel: and Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria 22 years.
1Ki 18:18: 19: He answered: I not have troubled Israel; but you: and your father's house: in that you have forsaken the commandments of the LORD: and you have followed Baalim.
2Ki 17:16-18: They left all the commandments of the LORD their God: and made them molten images: even two calves: and made a grove: and worshipped all the host of heaven: and served Baal.

"died"
Ge 2:17: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil: you will not eat of it: for in the day that you eat thereof you will surely die.
Ro 5:12: For what reason: as by one man sin entered into the world: and death by sin; and so death passed upon all men: for that all have sinned:
2Co 5:14: For the love of Christ constrains us; because we thus judge: that if one died for all: then were all dead:

H5401 נָשַׁק nâshaq naw-shak a primitive root (identical with נָשַׂק, through the idea of fastening up; compare חָזַק, חָשַׁק); to kiss, literally or figuratively (touch); also (as a mode of attachment), to equip with weapons; armed (men), rule, kiss, that touched. 		יִשָּׁקֽוּן׃yiš-šā-qūn. let kiss V-Qal-Imperf-3mp | Pn
2 Now they sin more and more, and have made them molten images of their silver, and idols according to their own understanding, all of it the work of the craftsmen: they say of them, Let the men that sacrifice kiss the calves.Hosea 13:2
Stats
Counts: 228 characters, 38 words, 180 letters, 64 vowels, 116 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ יֹוסִ֣פוּ לַחֲטֹ֗א וַיַּעְשׂ֣וּ לָהֶם֩ מַסֵּכָ֨ה מִכַּסְפָּ֤ם כִּתְבוּנָם֙ עֲצַבִּ֔ים מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה חָרָשִׁ֖ים כֻּלֹּ֑ה לָהֶם֙ הֵ֣ם אֹמְרִ֔ים זֹבְחֵ֣י אָדָ֔ם עֲגָלִ֖ים יִשָּׁקֽוּן׃

Lit: Now they more and more sin and have made for themselves molded images of their silver according to their skill Idols the work of craftsmen All of it is of them they say who sacrifice the men the calves let kiss

KJV: And now they sin more and more, and have made them molten images of their silver, and idols according to their own understanding, all of it the work of the craftsmen: they say of them, Let the men that sacrifice kiss the calves.
References

"now"
Nu 32:14: And: look: you are risen up in your fathers' stead: an increase of sinful men: to augment yet the fierce anger of the LORD toward Israel.
2Ch 28:13: Said to them: You will not bring in the captives here: for whereas we have offended against the LORD already: you intend to add more to our sins and to our trespass: for our trespass is great: and there is fierce wrath against Israel.
2Ch 33:23: not humbled Himself before the LORD: as Manasseh His father had humbled Himself; but Amon trespassed more and more.
Isa 1:5: Why should you be stricken any more? you will revolt more and more: the whole head is sick: and the whole heart faint.
Isa 30:1: Woe to the rebellious children: says the LORD: that take counsel: not but of me; and that cover with a covering: not but of my spirit: that they may add sin to sin:
Ro 2:5: But after your hardness and impenitent heart treasure up to yourself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;
2Ti 3:13: But evil men and seducers will wax worse and worse: deceiving: and being deceived.

"have made"
Ho 2:8: For she not did know that I gave her grain: and wine: and oil: and multiplied her silver and gold: which they prepared for Baal.
Ho 8:4: They have set up kings: not but by me: they have made princes: and I knew it not: of their silver and their gold have they made them idols: that they may be cut off.
Ho 10:1: Israel is an empty vine: he brings forth fruit to himself: according to the multitude of his fruit he has increased the altars; according to the goodness of his land they have made goodly images.
Ps 115:4-8: Their idols are silver and gold: the work of men's hands.
Isa 46:6: They lavish gold out of the bag: and weigh silver in the balance: and hire a goldsmith; and he makes it a god: they fall down: yes: they worship.
Jer 10:4: They deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails and with hammers: that it not move.
Hab 2:18: 19: What profits the graven image that the maker thereof has graven it; the molten image: and a teacher of lies: that the maker of his work trusts therein: to make dumb idols?

"according"
Ho 11:6: The sword will abide on his cities: and will consume his branches: and devour them: because of their own counsels.
Ps 135:17: 18: They have ears: but they not hear; neither is there any breath in their mouths.
Isa 44:17-20: The residue thereof he makes a god: even his graven image: he falls down to it: and worships it: and prays to it: and says: Deliver me; for you are my god.
Isa 45:20: Assemble yourselves and come; draw near together: you that are escaped of the nations: they have no knowledge that set up the wood of their graven image: and pray to a god that cannot save.
Isa 46:8: Remember this: and show yourselves men: bring it again to mind: O you transgressors.
Jer 10:8: But they are altogether brutish and foolish: the stock is a doctrine of vanities.
Ro 1:22-25: Professing themselves to be wise: they became fools:

"kiss"
1Sa 10:1: Then Samuel took a vial of oil: and poured it upon His head: and kissed Him: and said: Is it not because the LORD has anointed you to be captain over His inheritance?
1Ki 19:18: Yet I have left me 7000 in Israel: all the knees which not have bowed to Baal: and every mouth which has not kissed him.
Ps 2:12: Kiss the Son: lest He be angry: and you perish from the way: when His wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in Him.
Ro 11:4: But what says the answer of God to Him? I have reserved to myself 7000 men: who not have bowed the knee to the image of Baal.

3 Therefore they will be as the morning cloud, and as the early dew that passs away, as the chaff that is driven with the whirlwind out of the floor, and as the smoke out of the chimney.Hosea 13:3
Stats
Counts: 187 characters, 34 words, 147 letters, 52 vowels, 95 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן יִֽהְיוּ֙ כַּעֲנַן־בֹּ֔קֶר וְכַטַּ֖ל מַשְׁכִּ֣ים הֹלֵ֑ךְ כְּמֹץ֙ יְסֹעֵ֣ר מִגֹּ֔רֶן וּכְעָשָׁ֖ן מֵאֲרֻבָּֽה׃

Lit: Therefore they shall be like the cloud morning and like the dew early that passes away Like chaff blown off from a threshing floor and like smoke from a chimney

KJV: Therefore they shall be as the morning cloud, and as the early dew that passeth away, as the chaff that is driven with the whirlwind out of the floor, and as the smoke out of the chimney.
References

"as the morning"
Ho 6:4: O Ephraim: what will I do to you? O Judah: what will I do to you? for your goodness is as a morning cloud: and as the early dew it goes away.

"as the chaff"
Ps 1:4: The ungodly are not so: but are like the chaff which the wind drives away.
Ps 68:2: As smoke is driven away: so drive them away: as wax melts before the fire: so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
Ps 83:12-17: Who said: Let us take to ourselves the houses of God in possession.
Isa 17:13: The nations will rush like the rushing of many waters: but God will rebuke them: and they will flee far off: and will be chased as the chaff of the mountains before the wind: and like a rolling thing before the whirlwind.
Isa 41:15: 16: Look: I will make you a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth: you will thresh the mountains: and beat them small: and will make the hills as chaff.
Da 2:35: Then was the iron: the clay: the brass: the silver: and the gold: broken to pieces together: and became like the chaff of the summer threshingfloors; and the wind carried them away: that no place was found for them: and the stone that smote the image became a great mountain: and filled the whole earth.

H430וֵאלֹהִ֤יםwê-lō-hîm   (Conj-w | N-mp)
H430 אֱלֹהִים ʼĕlôhîym el-o-heem plural of אֱלוֹהַּ; gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative; angels, idiom exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), idiom (very) great, judges, idiom mighty. 		וֵאלֹהִ֤יםwê-lō-hîm and God Conj-w | N-mp

H3045תֵדָ֔עṯê-ḏā‘,   (V-Qal-Imperf-2ms)
H3045 יָדַע yâdaʻ yaw-dah a primitive root; to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.); acknowledge, acquaintance(-ted with), advise, answer, appoint, assuredly, be aware, (un-) awares, can(-not), certainly, comprehend, consider, idiom could they, cunning, declare, be diligent, (can, cause to) discern, discover, endued with, familiar friend, famous, feel, can have, be (ig-) norant, instruct, kinsfolk, kinsman, (cause to let, make) know, (come to give, have, take) knowledge, have (knowledge), (be, make, make to be, make self) known, phrase be learned, phrase lie by man, mark, perceive, privy to, idiom prognosticator, regard, have respect, skilful, shew, can (man of) skill, be sure, of a surety, teach, (can) tell, understand, have (understanding), idiom will be, wist, wit, wot. 		תֵדָ֔עṯê-ḏā‘, you shall know V-Qal-Imperf-2ms
H3467וּמוֹשִׁ֥יעַū-mō-wō-šî-a‘   (Conj-w | V-Hifil-Prtcpl-ms)
H3467 יָשַׁע yâshaʻ yaw-shah a primitive root; properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor; idiom at all, avenging, defend, deliver(-er), help, preserve, rescue, be safe, bring (having) salvation, save(-iour), get victory. 		וּמוֹשִׁ֥יעַū-mō-wō-šî-a‘ for Savior Conj-w | V-Hifil-Prtcpl-ms
H369אַ֖יִן’a-yin   (Adv)
H369 אַיִן ʼayin ah-yin as if from a primitive root meaning to be nothing or not exist; a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle; else, except, fail, (father-) less, be gone, in(-curable), neither, never, no (where), none, nor, (any, thing), not, nothing, to nought, past, un(-searchable), well-nigh, without. Compare אַיִן. 		אַ֖יִן’a-yin there is no Adv
H1115בִּלְתִּֽי׃bil-tî.   (Prep)
H1115 בִּלְתִּי biltîy bil-tee constructive feminine of בָּלָה (equivalent to בְּלִי); properly, a failure of, i.e. (used only as a negative particle, usually with a prepositional prefix) not, except, without, unless, besides, because not, until, etc.; because un(satiable), beside, but, phrase continual, except, from, lest, neither, no more, none, not, nothing, save, that no, without., 		בִּלְתִּֽי׃bil-tî. besides Me Prep
4 Yet I am the LORD your God from the land of Egypt, and you will know no god but me: for there is no saviour beside me.Hosea 13:4
Stats
Counts: 121 characters, 23 words, 90 letters, 33 vowels, 57 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֛י יְהוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וֵאלֹהִ֤ים זֽוּלָתִי֙ לֹ֣א תֵדָ֔ע וּמֹושִׁ֥יעַ אַ֖יִן בִּלְתִּֽי׃

Lit: And yet I am Yahweh your God Ever since the land of Egypt and God but Me no you shall know for Savior there is no besides Me

KJV: Yet I am the LORD thy God from the land of Egypt, and thou shalt know no god but me: for [there is] no saviour beside me.
References

"I am"
Ho 12:9: I that am the LORD your God from the land of Egypt will yet make you to dwell in tabernacles: as in the days of the solemn feast.
Ex 20:2: I am the LORD your God: which have brought you out of the land of Egypt: out of the house of bondage.
Ps 81:9: 10: There will no strange god be in you; neither will you worship any strange god.
Isa 43:3: 10: For I am the LORD your God: the Holy one of Israel: your Saviour: I gave Egypt for your ransom: Ethiopia and Seba for you.
Isa 44:6-8: Thus says the LORD the King of Israel: and His redeemer the LORD of hosts; I am the first: and I am the last; and beside me there is no God.

"for"
Isa 43:11-13: I: even I: am the LORD; and beside me there is no saviour.
Isa 45:21: 22: Tell you: and bring them near; yes: let them take counsel together: who has declared this from ancient time? who has told it from that time? have not I the LORD? and there is no God else beside me; a just God and a Saviour; there is none beside me.
Ac 4:12: Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men: whereby we must be saved.

אֲנִ֥י יְדַעְתִּ֖יךָ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר בְּאֶ֖רֶץ תַּלְאֻבֹֽות׃

5 I did know you in the wilderness, in the land of great drought.Hosea 13:5
Stats
Counts: 64 characters, 12 words, 50 letters, 18 vowels, 32 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֲנִ֥י יְדַעְתִּ֖יךָ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר בְּאֶ֖רֶץ תַּלְאֻבֹֽות׃

Lit: I knew you in the wilderness in the land of great drought

KJV: I did know thee in the wilderness, in the land of great drought.
References

"know"
Ex 2:25: God looked upon the children of Israel: and God had respect to them.
Ps 1:6: For the LORD knows the way of the righteous: but the way of the ungodly will perish.
Ps 31:7: I will be glad and rejoice in your mercy: for you have considered my trouble; you have known my soul in adversities;
Ps 142:3: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me: then you knew my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.
Na 1:7: The LORD is good: a strong hold in the day of trouble; and He knows them that trust in Him.
1Co 8:3: But if any man love God: the same is known of Him.
Ga 4:9: But now: after that you have known God: or rather are known of God: how turn you again to the weak and beggarly elements: to what you desire again to be in bondage?

"in the wilderness"
De 2:7: For the LORD your God has blessed you in all the works of your hand: He knows your walking through this great wilderness: these 40 years the LORD your God has been with you; you have not lackedhing.
De 8:15: Who led you through that great and terrible wilderness: wherein were fiery serpents: and scorpions: and drought: where there was no water; who brought you forth water out of the rock of flint;
De 32:10: He found him in a desert land: and in the waste howling wilderness; he led him about: he instructed him: he kept him as the apple of his eye.
Jer 2:2: 6: Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem: saying: Thus says the LORD; I remember you: the kindness of your youth: the love of your espousals: when you went after me in the wilderness: in a land that was not sown.

"great drought"
Ps 63:1: He was in the wilderness of Judah.>> O God: you are my God; early will I seek you: my soul thirsts for you: my flesh longs for you in a dry and thirsty land: where no water is;

6 According to their pasture, so were they filled; they were filled, and their heart was exalted; therefore have they forgotten me.Hosea 13:6
Stats
Counts: 129 characters, 17 words, 104 letters, 40 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כְּמַרְעִיתָם֙ וַיִּשְׂבָּ֔עוּ שָׂבְע֖וּ וַיָּ֣רָם לִבָּ֑ם עַל־כֵּ֖ן שְׁכֵחֽוּנִי׃

Lit: When they had pasture and they were filled they were filled and was exalted their heart upon thus they forgot Me

KJV: According to their pasture, so were they filled; they were filled, and their heart was exalted; therefore have they forgotten me.
References

"to"
Ho 10:1: Israel is an empty vine: he brings forth fruit to himself: according to the multitude of his fruit he has increased the altars; according to the goodness of his land they have made goodly images.
De 8:12-14: Lest when you have eaten and are full: and have built goodly houses: and dwelt therein;
De 32:13-15: He made him ride on the high places of the earth: that he might eat the increase of the fields; and he made him to suck honey out of the rock: and oil out of the flinty rock;
Ne 9:25: 26: 35: They took strong cities: and a fat land: and possessed houses full of all goods: wells digged: vineyards: and oliveyards: and fruit trees in abundance: so they did eat: and were filled: and became fat: and delighted themselves in your great goodness.
Jer 2:31: O generation: see you the word of the LORD. Have I been a wilderness to Israel? a land of darkness? for what reason say my people: We are lords; we will come no more to you?

"therefore"
Ho 8:4: They have set up kings: not but by me: they have made princes: and I knew it not: of their silver and their gold have they made them idols: that they may be cut off.
De 6:10-12: It will be: when the LORD your God will have brought you into the land which He sware to your fathers: to Abraham: to Isaac: and to Jacob: to give you great and goodly cities: which you not buildedst:
De 32:18: Of the Rock that begot you you are unmindful: and have forgotten God that formed you.
Ps 10:4: The wicked: through the pride of His face: not will seek after God: God is not in all His thoughts.
Isa 17:10: Because you have forgotten the God of your salvation: and have not been mindful of the rock of your strength: therefore will you plant pleasant plants: and will set it with strange slips:
Jer 2:32: Can a maid forget her ornaments: or a bride her attire? yet my people have forgotten me days without number.

7 Therefore I will be to them as a lion: as a leopard by the way will I observe them:Hosea 13:7
Stats
Counts: 85 characters, 18 words, 65 letters, 27 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וָאֱהִ֥י לָהֶ֖ם כְּמֹו־שָׁ֑חַל כְּנָמֵ֖ר עַל־דֶּ֥רֶךְ אָשֽׁוּר׃

Lit: So I will be to them like a lion Like a leopard by the road I will lurk

KJV: Therefore I will be unto them as a lion: as a leopard by the way will I observe them:
References

"Therefore I will be unto them as a lion: as a leopard by the way will I observe them:"
Ho 5:14: For I will be to Ephraim as a lion: and as a young lion to the house of Judah: I: even I: will tear and go away; I will take away: and none will rescue him.
Isa 42:13: The LORD will go forth as a mighty man: He will stir up jealousy like a man of war: He will cry: yes: roar; He will prevail against His enemies.
Jer 5:6: For what reason a lion out of the for will kill them: and a wolf of the evenings will spoil them: a leopard will watch over their cities: every one that goes out there will be torn in pieces: because their transgressions are many: and their backslidings are increased.
La 3:10: He was to me as a bear lying in wait: and as a lion in secret places.
Am 1:2: He said: The LORD will roar from Zion: and utter His voice from Jerusalem; and the habitations of the shepherds will mourn: and the top of Carmel will where.
Am 3:4: 8: Will a lion roar in the for: when he has no prey? will a young lion cry out of his den: if he have not takenhing?

8 I will meet them as a bear that is bereaved of her whelps, and will rend the caul of their heart, and there will I devour them like a lion: the wild beast will tear them.Hosea 13:8
Stats
Counts: 173 characters, 32 words, 132 letters, 51 vowels, 81 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֶפְגְּשֵׁם֙ כְּדֹ֣ב שַׁכּ֔וּל וְאֶקְרַ֖ע סְגֹ֣ור לִבָּ֑ם וְאֹכְלֵ֥ם שָׁם֙ כְּלָבִ֔יא חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה תְּבַקְּעֵֽם׃

Lit: I will meet them like a bear deprived of her cubs and I will tear open cage their rib and I will devour them there like a lion beast the wild shall tear them

KJV: I will meet them as a bear that is bereaved [of her whelps], and will rend the caul of their heart, and there will I devour them like a lion: the wild beast shall tear them.
References

"as a"
2Sa 17:8: For: said Hushai: you know your father and his men: that they be mighty men: and they be chafed in their minds: as a bear robbed of her whelps in the field: and your father is a man of war: and not will lodge with the people.
Pr 17:12: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man: rather than a fool in his folly.
Am 9:1-3: I saw the Lord standing upon the altar: and He said: Smite the lintel of the door: that the posts may shake: and cut them in the head: all of them; and I will kill the last of them with the sword: He that'>He who flees of them will not flee away: and He that'>He who escapes of them will not be delivered.

"wild beast"
Ps 80:13: The boar out of the wood does waste it: and the wild beast of the field does devour it.
Isa 5:29: Their roaring will be like a lion: they will roar like young lions: yes: they will roar: and lay hold of the prey: and will carry it away safe: and none will deliver it.
Isa 56:9: All you beasts of the field: come to devour: yes: all you beasts in the for.
Jer 12:9: My heritage is to me as a speckled bird: the birds round about are against her; come you: assemble all the beasts of the field: come to devour.

KJV: O Israel, thou hast destroyed thyself; but in me is thine help.

"thou"

Pr 8:36: But he who sins against me wrongs his own soul: all they that hate me love death.

10 I will be your king: where is any other that may save you in all your cities? and your judges of whom you said, Give me a king and princes?Hosea 13:10
Stats
Counts: 140 characters, 27 words, 107 letters, 38 vowels, 69 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֱהִ֤י מַלְכְּךָ֙ אֵפֹ֔וא וְיֹושִֽׁיעֲךָ֖ בְּכָל־עָרֶ֑יךָ וְשֹׁ֣פְטֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֔רְתָּ תְּנָה־לִּ֖י מֶ֥לֶךְ וְשָׂרִֽים׃

Lit: I will be your king where is any other that he may save you in all your cities and your judges to whom you said Give me a King and princes

KJV: I will be thy king: where is any other that may save thee in all thy cities? and thy judges of whom thou saidst, Give me a king and princes?
References

"I will be thy king"
Ps 10:16: The LORD is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of His land.
Ps 44:4: You are my King: O God: command deliverances for Jacob.
Ps 47:6: 7: Sing praises to God: sing praises: sing praises to our King: sing praises.
Ps 74:12: For God is my King of old: working salvation in the middle of the earth.
Ps 89:18: For the LORD is our defence; and the Holy one of Israel is our king.
Ps 149:2: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
Isa 33:22: For the LORD is our judge: the LORD is our lawgiver: the LORD is our king; He will save us.
Isa 43:15: I am the LORD: your Holy one: the creator of Israel: your King.
Jer 8:19: Look the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people because of them that dwell in a far country: Is not the LORD in Zion? is not her king in her? Why have they provoked me to anger with their graven images: and with strange vanities?
Zec 14:9: The LORD will be king over all the earth: in that day will there be one LORD: and His name one.
Joh 1:49: Nathanael answered and says to Him: Rabbi: you are the Son of God; you are the King of Israel.

"where"
Ho 13:4: Yet I am the LORD your God from the land of Egypt: and you will know no god but me: for there is no saviour beside me.
Ho 10:3: For now they will say: We have no king: because we not feared the LORD; what then should a king do to us?
De 32:37-39: He will say: Where are their gods: their rock in whom they trusted:
Jer 2:28: But where are your gods that you have made you? let them arise: if they can save you in the time of your trouble: for according to the number of your cities are your gods: O Judah.

"thy judges"
Ho 8:4: They have set up kings: not but by me: they have made princes: and I knew it not: of their silver and their gold have they made them idols: that they may be cut off.
Jg 2:16-18: Nevertheless the LORD raised up judges: which delivered them out of the hand of those that spoiled them.
1Sa 8:5: 6: 19: 20: Said to him: Look: you are old: and your sons not walk in your ways: now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.

11 I gave you a king in my anger, and took him away in my wrath.Hosea 13:11
Stats
Counts: 64 characters, 14 words, 48 letters, 20 vowels, 28 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֶֽתֶּן־לְךָ֥ מֶ֙לֶךְ֙ בְּאַפִּ֔י וְאֶקַּ֖ח בְּעֶבְרָתִֽי׃ ס

Lit: I gave you a king in My anger and took him away in My wrath

KJV: I gave thee a king in mine anger, and took him away in my wrath.
References

"I gave thee a king in mine anger, and took him away in my wrath."

1Sa 8:7-9: The LORD said to Samuel: Listen to the voice of the people in all that they say to you: for they not have rejected you: but they have rejected me: that I not should reign over them.
1Sa 10:19: you have this day rejected your God: who Himself saved you out of all your adversities and your tribulations; and you have said to Him: No: but set a king over us. Now therefore present yourselves before the LORD by your tribes: and by your thousands.
1Sa 12:13: Now therefore look the king whom you have chosen: and whom you have desired! and: look: the LORD has set a king over you.
1Sa 15:22: 23: Samuel said: Has the LORD as great delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices: as in obeying the voice of the LORD? Look: to obey is better than sacrifice: and to listen than the fat of rams.

13 The sorrows of a travailing woman will come upon him: he is an unwise son; for he not should stay long in the place of the breaking forth of children.Hosea 13:13
Stats
Counts: 153 characters, 26 words, 119 letters, 44 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: חֶבְלֵ֥י יֹֽולֵדָ֖ה יָבֹ֣אוּ לֹ֑ו הוּא־בֵן֙ לֹ֣א חָכָ֔ם כִּֽי־עֵ֥ת לֹֽא־יַעֲמֹ֖ד בְּמִשְׁבַּ֥ר בָּנִֽים׃

Lit: The sorrows of a woman in childbirth shall come upon him He son not an unwise for long not he should stay where are born children

KJV: The sorrows of a travailing woman shall come upon him: he is an unwise son; for he should not stay long in [the place of] the breaking forth of children.
References

"sorrows"
Ps 48:6: Fear took hold upon them there: and pain: as of a woman in travail.
Isa 13:8: They will be afraid: pangs and sorrows will take hold of them; they will be in pain as a woman that travails: they will be amazed one at another; their faces will be as flames.
Isa 21:3: Therefore are my loins filled with pain: pangs have taken hold upon me: as the pangs of a woman that travails: I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.
Jer 4:31: For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail: and the anguish as of her that brings forth her first child: the voice of the daughter of Zion: that bewails herself: that spreads her hands: saying: Woe is me now! for my soul is wearied because of murderers.
Jer 13:21: What will you say when he will punish you? for you have taught them to be captains: and as chief over you: will not sorrows take you: as a woman in travail?
Jer 22:23: O inhabitant of Lebanon: that make your nest in the cedars: how gracious will you be when pangs come upon you: the pain as of a woman in travail!
Jer 30:6: Ask you now: and see whether a man does travail with child? for what reason do I see every man with his hands on his loins: as a woman in travail: and all faces are turned into paleness?
Jer 49:24: Damascus is waxed feeble: and turns herself to flee: and fear has seized on her: anguish and sorrows have taken her: as a woman in travail.
Mic 4:9: 10: Now why do you cry out aloud? is there no king in you? is your counseller perished? for pangs have taken you as a woman in travail.
1Th 5:3: For when they will say: Peace and safety; then sudden destruction comes upon them: as travail upon a woman with child; and they will not escape.

"an"
Pr 22:3: A prudent man foreseeth the evil: and hides himself: but the simple pass on: and are punished.
Ac 24:25: As he reasoned of righteousness: temperance: and judgment to come: Felix trembled: and answered: Go your way for this time; when I have a convenient season: I will call for you.

"for he"
2Ki 19:3: They said to him: Thus says Hezekiah: This day is a day of trouble: and of rebuke: and blasphemy: for the children are come to the birth: and there is not strength to bring forth.
Isa 26:17: Like as a woman with child: that draws near the time of her delivery: is in pain: and cries out in her pangs; so have we been in your sight: O LORD.
Isa 37:3: They said to him: Thus says Hezekiah: This day is a day of trouble: and of rebuke: and of blasphemy: for the children are come to the birth: and there is not strength to bring forth.

2Co 6:2: (For he says: I have heard you in a time accepted: and in the day of salvation have I succoured you: look: now is the accepted time; look: now is the day of salvation.)
Heb 3:7: 8: For what reason (as the Holy Ghost says: Today if you will hear His voice:

H3027מִיַּ֤דmî-yaḏ   (Prep-m | N-fsc)

14 I will ransom them from the power of the grave; I will redeem them from death: O death, I will be your plagues; O grave, I will be your destruction: repentance will be hid from my eyes.Hosea 13:14
Stats
Counts: 186 characters, 31 words, 143 letters, 53 vowels, 90 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מִיַּ֤ד שְׁאֹול֙ אֶפְדֵּ֔ם מִמָּ֖וֶת אֶגְאָלֵ֑ם אֱהִ֨י דְבָרֶיךָ֜ מָ֗וֶת אֱהִ֤י קָֽטָבְךָ֙ שְׁאֹ֔ול נֹ֖חַם יִסָּתֵ֥ר מֵעֵינָֽי׃

Lit: From the power of Sheol I will ransom them from death I will redeem them I will be your plagues Death I will be your destruction Grave Pity is hidden from My eyes

KJV: I will ransom them from the power of the grave; I will redeem them from death: O death, I will be thy plagues; O grave, I will be thy destruction: repentance shall be hid from mine eyes.
References

"ransom"
Ho 6:2: After two days will he revive us: in the third day he will raise us up: and we will live in his sight.
Job 19:25-27: For I know that my redeemer lives: and that he will stand at the latter day upon the earth:
Job 33:24: Then he is gracious to him: and says: Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.
Ps 16:10: For you will not leave my soul in hell; neither will you suffer your Holy one to see corruption.
Ps 30:3: O LORD: you have brought up my soul from the grave: you have kept me alive: that I not should go down to the pit.
Ps 49:15: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for He will receive me. Selah.
Ps 71:20: You: which have showed me great and sore troubles: will quicken me again: and will bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
Ps 86:13: For great is your mercy toward me: and you have delivered my soul from the low hell.
Isa 25:8: He will swallow up death in victory; and the Lord GOD will wipe away tears from off all faces; and the rebuke of His people will He take away from off all the earth: for the LORD has spoken it.
Eze 37:11-14: Then He said to me: Son of man: these bones are the whole house of Israel: look: they say: Our bones are dried: and our hope is lost: we are cut off for our parts.
Ro 11:15: For if the casting away of them be the reconciling of the world: what will the receiving of them be: but life from the dead?

"O death"
Isa 26:19: Your dead men will live: together with my dead body will they arise. Awake and sing: you that dwell in dust: for your dew is as the dew of herbs: and the earth will cast out the dead.
1Co 15:21: 22: 52-57: For since by man came death: by man came also the resurrection of the dead.
2Co 5:4: For we that are in this tabernacle do groan: being burdened: not for that we would be unclothed: but clothed upon: that mortality might be swallowed up of life.
Php 3:21: Who will change our vile body: that it may be fashioned like to his glorious body: according to the working whereby he is able even to subdue all things to himself.
1Th 4:14: For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again: even so them also which sleep in Jesus will God bring with Him.
Re 20:13: The sea gave up the dead which were in it; and death and hell delivered up the dead which were in them: and they were judged every man according to their works.
Re 21:4: God will wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there will be no more death: neither sorrow: nor crying: neither will there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away.

"repentance"
Nu 23:19: God is not a man: that He should lie; neither the son of man: that He should repent: has He said: and will He not">not He do it? or has He spoken: and will He not">not He make it good?
1Sa 15:29: Also the Strength of Israel not will lie nor repent: for he is not a man: that he should repent.
Jer 15:6: You have forsaken me: says the LORD: you are gone backward: therefore will I stretch out my hand against you: and destroy you; I am weary with repenting.
Mal 3:6: For I am the LORD: I not change; therefore you sons of Jacob not are consumed.
Ro 11:29: For the gifts and calling of God are without repentance.
Jas 1:17: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above: and comes down from the Father of lights: with whom is no variableness: neither shadow of turning.

Judgment on Samaria

כִּ֣י ה֔וּא בֵּ֥ן אַחִ֖ים יַפְרִ֑יא יָבֹ֣וא קָדִים֩ ר֨וּחַ יְהוָ֜ה מִמִּדְבָּ֣ר עֹלֶ֗ה וְיֵבֹ֤ושׁ מְקֹורֹו֙ וְיֶחֱרַ֣ב מַעְיָנֹ֔ו ה֣וּא יִשְׁסֶ֔ה אֹוצַ֖ר כָּל־כְּלִ֥י חֶמְדָּֽה׃

H3588כִּ֣יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֣יkî Though Conj

15 Though He be fruitful among His brothers, an east wind will come, the wind of the LORD will come up from the wilderness, and His spring will become dry, and His fountain will be dried up: He will spoil the treasure of all pleasant vessels.Hosea 13:15
Stats
Rank: #5078 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 244 characters, 40 words, 194 letters, 67 vowels, 127 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֣י ה֔וּא בֵּ֥ן אַחִ֖ים יַפְרִ֑יא יָבֹ֣וא קָדִים֩ ר֨וּחַ יְהוָ֜ה מִמִּדְבָּ֣ר עֹלֶ֗ה וְיֵבֹ֤ושׁ מְקֹורֹו֙ וְיֶחֱרַ֣ב מַעְיָנֹ֔ו ה֣וּא יִשְׁסֶ֔ה אֹוצַ֖ר כָּל־כְּלִ֥י חֶמְדָּֽה׃

Lit: Though he among his brothers is fruitful shall come An east wind the wind of Yahweh from the wilderness shall come up and shall become dry his spring and shall be dried up his fountain He shall plunder the treasury of every prize desireable

KJV: Though he be fruitful among his brethren, an east wind shall come, the wind of the LORD shall come up from the wilderness, and his spring shall become dry, and his fountain shall be dried up: he shall spoil the treasure of all pleasant vessels.
References

"he be"
Ge 41:52: The name of the second called He Ephraim: For God has caused me to be fruitful in the land of my affliction.
Ge 48:19: His father refused: and said: I know it: my son: I know it: he also will become a people: and he also will be great: but truly his younger brother will be greater than he: and his seed will become a multitude of nations.
Ge 49:22: Joseph is a fruitful bough: even a fruitful bough by a well; whose branches run over the wall:
De 33:17: His glory is like the firstling of his bullock: and his horns are like the horns of unicorns: with them he will push the people together to the ends of the earth: and they are the 10 thousands of Ephraim: and they are the thousands of Manasseh.

"an east"
Ho 4:19: The wind has bound her up in her wings: and they will be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
Ps 1:4: The ungodly are not so: but are like the chaff which the wind drives away.
Isa 17:13: The nations will rush like the rushing of many waters: but God will rebuke them: and they will flee far off: and will be chased as the chaff of the mountains before the wind: and like a rolling thing before the whirlwind.
Isa 41:16: You will fan them: and the wind will carry them away: and the whirlwind will scatter them: and you will rejoice in the LORD: and will glory in the Holy one of Israel.
Jer 4:11: At that time will it be said to this people and to Jerusalem: A dry wind of the high places in the wilderness toward the daughter of my people: not to fan: nor to cleanse:
Eze 17:10: Yes: look: being planted: will it prosper? will not it utterly where: when the east wind touches it? it will where in the furrows where it grew.
Eze 19:12: But she was plucked up in fury: she was cast down to the ground: and the east wind dried up her fruit: her strong rods were broken and withered; the fire consumed them.

"his spring"
Ho 9:11: As for Ephraim: their glory will fly away like a bird: from the birth: and from the womb: and from the conception.
Job 18:16: His roots will be dried up beneath: and above will his branch be cut off.
Ps 109:13: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
Isa 14:21: Prepare slaughter for his children for the iniquity of their fathers; that they not do rise: nor possess the land: nor fill the face of the world with cities.

"pleasant vessels"
Da 11:8: will also carry captives into Egypt their gods: with their princes: and with their precious vessels of silver and of gold; and he will continue more years than the king of the north.
Na 2:9: Take you the spoil of silver: take the spoil of gold: for there is none end of the store and glory out of all the pleasant furniture.

 16 Samaria will become desolate; for she has rebelled against her God: they will fall by the sword: their infants will be dashed in pieces, and their women with child will be ripped up.Hosea 13:16
Stats
Counts: 187 characters, 29 words, 150 letters, 52 vowels, 98 consonants
Translation
Hebrew:

Lit: Is held guilty Samaria for she has rebelled against her God By the sword they shall fall their infants shall be dashed in pieces and their women pregnant ripped open

KJV: Samaria shall become desolate; for she hath rebelled against her God: they shall fall by the sword: their infants shall be dashed in pieces, and their women with child shall be ripped up.
References

"Samaria"
2Ki 17:6: 18: In the ninth year of Hoshea the king of Assyria took Samaria: and carried Israel away into Assyria: and placed them in Halah and in Habor by the river of Gozan: and in the cities of the Medes.
2Ki 19:9-11: When he heard say of Tirhakah king of Ethiopia: Look: he is come out to fight against you: he sent messengers again to Hezekiah: saying:
Isa 7:8: 9: For the head of Syria is Damascus: and the head of Damascus is Rezin; and within threescore and 5 years will Ephraim be broken: that it not be a people.
Isa 8:4: For before the child will have knowledge to cry: My father: and my mother: the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria will be taken away before the king of Assyria.
Isa 17:3: The fortress also will cease from Ephraim: and the kingdom from Damascus: and the remnant of Syria: they will be as the glory of the children of Israel: says the LORD of hosts.
Am 3:9-15: Publish in the palaces at Ashdod: and in the palaces in the land of Egypt: and say: Assemble yourselves upon the mountains of Samaria: and look the great tumults in the middle thereof: and the oppressed in the middle thereof.
Am 4:1: Hear this word: you cattle of Bashan: that are in the mountain of Samaria: which oppress the poor: which crush the needy: which say to their masters: Bring: and let us drink.
Am 6:1-8: Woe to them that are at ease in Zion: and trust in the mountain of Samaria: which are named chief of the nations: to whom the house of Israel came!
Am 9:1: I saw the Lord standing upon the altar: and He said: Smite the lintel of the door: that the posts may shake: and cut them in the head: all of them; and I will kill the last of them with the sword: He that'>He who flees of them will not flee away: and He that'>He who escapes of them will not be delivered.
Mic 1:4: The mountains will be molten under him: and the valleys will be cleft: as wax before the fire: and as the waters that are poured down a steep place.
Mic 6:16: For the statutes of Omri are kept: and all the works of the house of Ahab: and you walk in their counsels; that I should make you a desolation: and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore you will bear the reproach of my people.

"their infants"
Ho 10:14: 15: Therefore will a tumult arise among your people: and all your fortresses will be spoiled: as Shalman spoiled Betharbel in the day of battle: the mother was dashed in pieces upon her children.
2Ki 8:12: Hazael said: Why weeps my lord? And he answered: Because I know the evil that you will do to the children of Israel: their strong holds will you set on fire: and their young men will you kill with the sword: and will dash their children: and rip up their women with child.
2Ki 15:16: Then Menahem smote Tiphsah: and all that were therein: and the coasts thereof from Tirzah: because they not opened to him: therefore he smote it; and all the women therein that were with child he ripped up.
Ps 137:8: 9: O daughter of Babylon: who are to be destroyed; happy will he be: that rewards you as you have served us.
Isa 13:16: Their children also will be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses will be spoiled: and their wives ravished.
Am 1:13: Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of the children of Ammon: and for 4: I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they have ripped up the women with child of Gilead: that they might enlarge their border:
Na 3:10: Yet was she carried away: she went into captivity: her young children also were dashed in pieces at the top of all the streets: and they cast lots for her honourable men: and all her great men were bound in chains.

14
A Call to Repentance

תֶּאְשַׁם֙ שֹֽׁמְרֹ֔ון כִּ֥י מָרְתָ֖ה בֵּֽאלֹהֶ֑יהָ בַּחֶ֣רֶב יִפֹּ֔לוּ עֹלְלֵיהֶ֣ם יְרֻטָּ֔שׁוּ וְהָרִיֹּותָ֖יו יְבֻקָּֽעוּ׃ פ

1 O Israel, return to the LORD your God; for you have fallen by your iniquity.Hosea 14:1
Stats
Counts: 79 characters, 13 words, 62 letters, 23 vowels, 39 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: תֶּאְשַׁם֙ שֹֽׁמְרֹ֔ון כִּ֥י מָרְתָ֖ה בֵּֽאלֹהֶ֑יהָ בַּחֶ֣רֶב יִפֹּ֔לוּ עֹלְלֵיהֶ֣ם יְרֻטָּ֔שׁוּ וְהָרִיֹּותָ֖יו יְבֻקָּֽעוּ׃ פ

Lit: And return Israel to Yahweh your God for you have stumbled because of your iniquity

KJV: O Israel, return unto the LORD thy God; for thou hast fallen by thine iniquity.
References

"return"

Ho 12:6: Therefore turn you to your God: keep mercy and judgment: and wait on your God continually.
1Sa 7:3: 4: Samuel spoke to all the house of Israel: saying: If you do return to the LORD with all your hearts: then put away the strange gods and Ashtaroth from among you: and prepare your hearts to the LORD: and serve Him only: and He will deliver you out of the hand of the Philistines.

Isa 55:6: 7: Seek you the LORD while He may be found: call you upon Him while He is near:
Jer 3:12-14: Go and proclaim these words toward the north: and say: Return: you backsliding Israel: says the LORD; and I not will cause my anger to fall upon you: for I am merciful: says the LORD: and I not will keep anger for ever.
Jer 4:1: If you will return: O Israel: says the LORD: return to me: and if you will put away your abominations out of my sight: then will you not remove.
Joe 2:12: 13: Therefore also now: says the LORD: turn you even to me with all your heart: and with fasting: and with weeping: and with mourning:
Zec 1:3: 4: Therefore say you to them: Thus says the LORD of hosts; Turn you to me: says the LORD of hosts: and I will turn to you: says the LORD of hosts.

"thou"

2 Take with you words, and turn to the LORD: say to Him, Take away all iniquity, and receive us graciously: so will we render the calves of our lips.Hosea 14:2
Stats
Counts: 149 characters, 24 words, 115 letters, 46 vowels, 69 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּבָה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַ֖ד יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ כִּ֥י כָשַׁ֖לְתָּ בַּעֲוֹנֶֽךָ׃

Lit: Take with you words and return to Yahweh Say to Him all take away iniquity and Receive us graciously for we will offer the sacrifices of our lips

KJV: Take with you words, and turn to the LORD: say unto him, Take away all iniquity, and receive us graciously: so will we render the calves of our lips.
References

"with"
Job 34:31: 32: Surely it is meet to be said to God: I have borne chastisement: I not will offend any more:
Joe 2:17: Let the priests: the ministers of the LORD: weep between the porch and the altar: and let them say: Spare your people: O LORD: and not give your heritage to reproach: that the heathen should rule over them: for what reason should they say among the people: Where is their God?
Mt 6:9-13: After this manner therefore pray you: Our Father which are in heaven: Hallowed be your name.
Lu 11:2-4: He said to them: When you pray: say: Our Father which are in heaven: Hallowed be your name. Your kingdom come. Your will be done: as in heaven: so in earth.
Lu 18:13: The publican: standing afar off: not would lift up so much as His eyes to heaven: but smote upon His breast: saying: God be merciful to me a sinner.

"away"
2Sa 12:13: David said to Nathan: I have sinned against the LORD. And Nathan said to David: The LORD also has put away your sin; you will not die.
2Sa 24:10: David's heart smote Him after that He had numbered the people. And David said to the LORD: I have sinned greatly in that I have done: and now: I beseech you: O LORD: take away the iniquity of your servant; for I have done very foolishly.
Job 7:21: Why do you not pardon my transgression: and take away my iniquity? for now will I sleep in the dust; and you will seek me in the morning: but I will not be.
Ps 51:2-10: Wash me throughly from my iniquity: and cleanse me from my sin.
Isa 6:7: He laid it upon my mouth: and said: Indeed: this has touched your lips; and your iniquity is taken away: and your sin purged.
Eze 36:25: 26: Then will I sprinkle clean water upon you: and you will be clean: from all your filthiness: and from all your idols: will I cleanse you.
Mic 7:19: He will turn again: he will have compassion upon us; he will subdue our iniquities; and you will cast all their sins into the depths of the sea.
Zec 3:4: He answered and spoke to those that stood before him: saying: Take away the filthy garments from him. And to him he said: Look: I have caused your iniquity to pass from you: and I will clothe you with change of clothing.
Joh 1:29: The next day John sees Jesus coming to Him: and says: Look the Lamb of God: which takes away the sin of the world.
Ro 11:27: For this is my covenant to them: when I will take away their sins.
Tit 2:14: Who gave himself for us: that he might redeem us from all iniquity: and purify to himself a peculiar people: zealous of good works.
Heb 10:4: For it is not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.
1Jo 1:7: But if we walk in the light: as He is in the light: we have fellowship one with another: and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.
1Jo 3:5: you know that he was manifested to take away our sins; and in him is no sin.

"receive, etc"
Mt 7:11: If you then: being evil: know how to give good gifts to your children: how much more will your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask Him?
Lu 11:13: If you then: being evil: know how to give good gifts to your children: how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask Him?
Lu 15:21-24: The son said to Him: Father: I have sinned against heaven: and in your sight: and am no more worthy to be called your son.
Eph 1:6: 7: To the praise of the glory of his grace: wherein he has made us accepted in the beloved.
Eph 2:7: 8: That in the ages to come He might show the exceeding riches of His grace in His kindness toward us through Christ Jesus.
2Ti 1:9: Who has saved us: and called us with an holy calling: not according to our works: but according to His own purpose and grace: which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began:

"the calves"
Ps 69:30: 31: I will praise the name of God with a song: and will magnify Him with thanksgiving.
Heb 13:15: By Him therefore let us offer the sacrifice of praise to God continually: that is: the fruit of our lips giving thanks to His name.
1Pe 2:5: 9: You also: as lively stones: are built up a spiritual house: an holy priesthood: to offer up spiritual sacrifices: acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

 קְח֤וּ עִמָּכֶם֙ דְּבָרִ֔ים וְשׁ֖וּבוּ אֶל־יְהוָ֑ה אִמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו כָּל־תִּשָּׂ֤א עָוֹן֙ וְקַח־טֹ֔וב וּֽנְשַׁלְּמָ֥ה פָרִ֖ים שְׂפָתֵֽינוּ׃

H804אַשּׁ֣וּר ׀’aš-šūr   (N-proper-fs)
H804 אַשּׁוּר ʼAshshûwr ash-shoor or אַשֻּׁר; apparently from אָשַׁר (in the sense of successful); Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire; Asshur, Assur, Assyria, Assyrians. See אָשֻׁר., 		אַשּׁ֣וּר ׀’aš-šūr Assyria N-proper-fs
H3808לֹ֣אlō   (Adv-NegPrt)
H3808 לֹא lôʼ lo or לוֹא; or לֹה; (Deuteronomy 3:11), a primitive particle; not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles; idiom before, phrase or else, ere, phrase except, ig(-norant), much, less, nay, neither, never, no((-ne), -r, (-thing)), (idiom as though...,(can-), for) not (out of), of nought, otherwise, out of, phrase surely, phrase as truly as, phrase of a truth, phrase verily, for want, phrase whether, without. 		לֹ֣אlō not Adv-NegPrt

H834אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer-   (Pro-r)

3 Asshur will not save us; we not will ride upon horses: neither will we say any more to the work of our hands, You are our gods: for in you the fatherless finds mercy.Hosea 14:3
Stats
Counts: 169 characters, 30 words, 131 letters, 49 vowels, 82 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: קְח֤וּ עִמָּכֶם֙ דְּבָרִ֔ים וְשׁ֖וּבוּ אֶל־יְהוָ֑ה אִמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו כָּל־תִּשָּׂ֤א עָוֹן֙ וְקַח־טֹ֔וב וּֽנְשַׁלְּמָ֥ה פָרִ֖ים שְׂפָתֵֽינוּ׃

Lit: Assyria not shall save us on horses not we will ride nor will we say anymore You are our gods to the work of our hands for in You finds mercy the fatherless

KJV: Asshur shall not save us; we will not ride upon horses: neither will we say any more to the work of our hands, Ye are our gods: for in thee the fatherless findeth mercy.
References

"Asshur"
Ho 5:13: When Ephraim saw his sickness: and Judah saw his wound: then went Ephraim to the Assyrian: and sent to king Jareb: yet could not he heal you: nor cure you of your wound.
Ho 7:11: Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt: they go to Assyria.
Ho 8:9: For they are gone up to Assyria: a wild ass alone by himself: Ephraim has hired lovers.
Ho 12:1: Ephraim feeds on wind: and follows after the east wind: he daily increases lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians: and oil is carried into Egypt.
2Ch 16:7: At that time Hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah: and said to Him: Because you have relied on the king of Syria: not and relied on the LORD your God: therefore is the host of the king of Syria escaped out of your hand.
Ps 146:3: not Put your trust in princes: nor in the son of man: in whom there is no help.
Jer 31:18-22: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning Himself thus; You have chastised me: and I was chastised: as a bullock unaccustomed to the yoke: turn you me: and I will be turned; for you are the LORD my God.

"we will not"
De 17:16: But He will not multiply horses to Himself: nor cause the people to return to Egypt: to the end that He should multiply horses: forasmuch as the LORD has said to you: You will henceforth return no more that way.
Ps 20:7: 8: Some trust in chariots: and some in horses: but we will remember the name of the LORD our God.
Ps 33:17: An horse is a vain thing for safety: neither will he deliver any by his great strength.
Isa 30:2: 16: That walk to go down into Egypt: and not have asked at my mouth; to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh: and to trust in the shadow of Egypt!
Isa 31:3: Now the Egyptians are men: not and God; and their horses flesh: not and spirit. When the LORD will stretch out His hand: both He that'>He who helps will fall: and He that'>He who is holpen will fall down: and they all will fail together.
Isa 36:8: Now therefore give pledges: I pray you: to my master the king of Assyria: and I will give you 2000 horses: if you be able on your part to set riders upon them.

"neither"
Ho 14:8: Ephraim will say: What have I to do any more with idols? I have heard him: and observed him: I am like a green fir tree. From me is your fruit found.
Ho 2:17: For I will take away the names of Baalim out of her mouth: and they will no more be remembered by their name.
Isa 1:29: For they will be ashamed of the oaks which you have desired: and you will be confounded for the gardens that you have chosen.
Isa 2:20: In that day a man will cast his idols of silver: and his idols of gold: which they made each one for himself to worship: to the moles and to the bats;
Isa 27:9: By this therefore will the iniquity of Jacob be purged; and this is all the fruit to take away his sin; when he makes all the stones of the altar as chalkstones that are beaten in sunder: the groves and images will not stand up.
Eze 36:25: Then will I sprinkle clean water upon you: and you will be clean: from all your filthiness: and from all your idols: will I cleanse you.
Eze 37:23: Neither will they defile themselves any more with their idols: nor with their detestable things: nor with any of their transgressions: but I will save them out of all their dwellingplaces: wherein they have sinned: and will cleanse them: so will they be my people: and I will be their God.
Eze 43:7-9: He said to me: Son of man: the place of my throne: and the place of the soles of my feet: where I will dwell in the middle of the children of Israel for ever: and my holy name: will the house of Israel no more defile: neither they: nor their kings: by their whoredom: nor by the carcases of their kings in their high places.
Mic 5:10-14: It will come to pass in that day: says the LORD: that I will cut off your horses out of the middle of you: and I will destroy your chariots:
Zec 13:2: It will come to pass in that day: says the LORD of hosts: that I will cut off the names of the idols out of the land: and they will no more be remembered: and also I will cause the prophets and the unclean spirit to pass out of the land.

"for"
Ex 22:22-24: You will not afflict any widow: or fatherless child.
Ps 10:14: You have seen it; for you behold mischief and spite: to requite it with your hand: the poor commits himself to you; you are the helper of the fatherless.
Ps 68:5: A father of the fatherless: and a judge of the widows: is God in His holy habitation.
Ps 146:9: The LORD preserves the strangers; He relieves the fatherless and widow: but the way of the wicked He turns upside down.
Pr 23:10: 11: not Remove the old landmark; and not enter into the fields of the fatherless:
Joh 14:18: I not will leave you comfortless: I will come to you.

A Promise of God’s Blessing

אַשּׁ֣וּר ׀ לֹ֣א יֹושִׁיעֵ֗נוּ עַל־סוּס֙ לֹ֣א נִרְכָּ֔ב וְלֹא־נֹ֥אמַר עֹ֛וד אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ לְמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֵ֑ינוּ אֲשֶׁר־בְּךָ֖ יְרֻחַ֥ם יָתֹֽום׃

4 I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely: for my anger is turned away from him.Hosea 14:4
Stats
Counts: 95 characters, 16 words, 75 letters, 28 vowels, 47 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַשּׁ֣וּר ׀ לֹ֣א יֹושִׁיעֵ֗נוּ עַל־סוּס֙ לֹ֣א נִרְכָּ֔ב וְלֹא־נֹ֥אמַר עֹ֛וד אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ לְמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֵ֑ינוּ אֲשֶׁר־בְּךָ֖ יְרֻחַ֥ם יָתֹֽום׃

Lit: I will heal their backsliding I will love them freely for has turned away My anger from him

KJV: I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely: for mine anger is turned away from him.
References

"heal"
Ho 11:7: My people are bent to backsliding from me: though they called them to the most High: none at all would exalt him.
Ex 15:26: Said: If you will diligently listen to the voice of the LORD your God: and will do that which is right in His sight: and will give ear to His commandments: and keep all His statutes: I will put none of these diseases upon you: which I have brought upon the Egyptians: for I am the LORD that heals you.
Isa 57:18: I have seen his ways: and will heal him: I will lead him also: and restore comforts to him and to his mourners.
Jer 3:22: Return: you backsliding children: and I will heal your backslidings. Look: we come to you; for you are the LORD our God.
Jer 5:6: For what reason a lion out of the for will kill them: and a wolf of the evenings will spoil them: a leopard will watch over their cities: every one that goes out there will be torn in pieces: because their transgressions are many: and their backslidings are increased.
Jer 8:22: Is there no balm in Gilead; is there no physician there? why then not is the health of the daughter of my people recovered?
Jer 14:7: O LORD: though our iniquities testify against us: do you it for your name's sake: for our backslidings are many; we have sinned against you.
Jer 17:14: Heal me: O LORD: and I will be healed; save me: and I will be saved: for you are my praise.
Jer 33:6: Look: I will bring it health and cure: and I will cure them: and will reveal to them the abundance of peace and truth.
Mt 9:12: 13: But when Jesus heard that: He said to them: They that be whole not need a physician: but they that are sick.

"I will love"
De 7:7: 8: The LORD not did set His love upon you: nor choose you: because you were more in number than any people; for you were the few of all people:
Zep 3:17: The LORD your God in the middle of you is mighty; He will save: He will rejoice over you with joy; He will rest in His love: He will joy over you with singing.
Ro 3:24: Being justified freely by His grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:
Eph 1:6: To the praise of the glory of his grace: wherein he has made us accepted in the beloved.
Eph 2:4-9: But God: who is rich in mercy: for His great love wherewith He loved us:
2Ti 1:9: Who has saved us: and called us with an holy calling: not according to our works: but according to His own purpose and grace: which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began:
Tit 3:4: But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared:

"for"
Nu 25:4: 11: The LORD said to Moses: Take all the heads of the people: and hang them up before the LORD against the sun: that the fierce anger of the LORD may be turned away from Israel.
Ps 78:38: But he: being full of compassion: forgave their iniquity: and destroyed them not: yes: many a time turned he his anger away: and not did stir up all his wrath.
Isa 12:1: In that day you will say: O LORD: I will praise you: though you were angry with me: your anger is turned away: and you comfortedst me.
2Co 5:19-21: To wit: that God was in Christ: reconciling the world to Himself: not imputing their trespasses to them; and has committed to us the word of reconciliation.

5 I will be as the dew to Israel: he will grow as the lily, and cast forth his roots as Lebanon.Hosea 14:5
Stats
Counts: 97 characters, 19 words, 74 letters, 27 vowels, 47 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֶרְפָּא֙ מְשׁ֣וּבָתָ֔ם אֹהֲבֵ֖ם נְדָבָ֑ה כִּ֛י שָׁ֥ב אַפִּ֖י מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃

Lit: I will be like the dew to Israel He shall grow like the lily and lengthen his roots like Lebanon

KJV: I will be as the dew unto Israel: he shall grow as the lily, and cast forth his roots as Lebanon.
References

"as the dew"
De 32:2: My doctrine will drop as the rain: my speech will distil as the dew: as the small rain upon the tender herb: and as the showers upon the grass:
2Sa 23:4: he will be as the light of the morning: when the sun rises: even a morning without clouds; as the tender grass springing out of the earth by clear shining after rain.
Job 29:19: My root was spread out by the waters: and the dew lay all night upon my branch.
Ps 72:6: He will come down like rain upon the mown grass: as showers that water the earth.
Pr 19:12: The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.
Isa 18:4: For so the LORD said to me: I will take my rest: and I will consider in my dwelling place like a clear heat upon herbs: and like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.
Isa 26:19: Your dead men will live: together with my dead body will they arise. Awake and sing: you that dwell in dust: for your dew is as the dew of herbs: and the earth will cast out the dead.
Isa 44:3: For I will pour water upon him that is thirsty: and floods upon the dry ground: I will pour my spirit upon your seed: and my blessing upon your offspring:
Mic 5:7: The remnant of Jacob will be in the middle of many people as a dew from the LORD: as the showers upon the grass: that tarries not for man: nor waits for the sons of men.

"he shall"
Song 2:1: 2: 16: I am the rose of Sharon: and the lily of the valleys.
Song 4:5: Your two breasts are like two young roes that are twins: which feed among the lilies.
Mt 6:28: Why take you thought for clothing? Consider the lilies of the field: how they grow; they not toil: neither do they spin:
Lu 12:27: Consider the lilies how they grow: they not toil: they not spin; and yet I say to you: that Solomon in all his glory not was arrayed like one of these.

"grow"
2Ki 19:30: The remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah will yet again take root downward: and bear fruit upward.
Ps 72:16: There will be an handful of grain in the earth upon the top of the mountains; the fruit thereof will shake like Lebanon: and they of the city will flourish like grass of the earth.
Isa 27:6: He will cause them that come of Jacob to take root: Israel will blossom and bud: and fill the face of the world with fruit.
Isa 35:2: It will blossom abundantly: and rejoice even with joy and singing: the glory of Lebanon will be given to it: the excellency of Carmel and Sharon: they will see the glory of the LORD: and the excellency of our God.
Eze 17:22-24: Thus says the Lord GOD; I will also take of the high branch of the high cedar: and will set it; I will crop off from the top of His young twigs a tender one: and will plant it upon an high mountain and eminent:
Eph 3:17: That Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that you: being rooted and grounded in love:

6 His branches will spread, and his beauty will be as the olive tree, and his smell as Lebanon.Hosea 14:6
Stats
Counts: 95 characters, 16 words, 75 letters, 27 vowels, 48 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֶהְיֶ֤ה כַטַּל֙ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יִפְרַ֖ח כַּשֹּֽׁושַׁנָּ֑ה וְיַ֥ךְ שָׁרָשָׁ֖יו כַּלְּבָנֹֽון׃

Lit: Shall spread His branches shall be like an olive tree His beauty and fragrance his like Lebanon

KJV: His branches shall spread, and his beauty shall be as the olive tree, and his smell as Lebanon.
References

"branches"
Ps 80:9-11: You preparedst room before it: and did cause it to take deep root: and it filled the land.
Eze 17:5-8: He took also of the seed of the land: and planted it in a fruitful field; he placed it by great waters: and set it as a willow tree.
Eze 31:3-10: Look: the Assyrian was a cedar in Lebanon with fair branches: and with a shadowing shroud: and of an high stature; and his top was among the thick boughs.
Da 4:10-15: Thus were the visions of my head in my bed; I saw: and look a tree in the middle of the earth: and the height thereof was great.
Mt 13:31: Another parable put he forth to them: saying: The kingdom of heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed: which a man took: and sowed in his field:
Joh 15:1: I am the true vine: and my Father is the husbandman.
Ro 11:16-24: For if the firstfruit be holy: the lump is also holy: and if the root be holy: so are the branches.

"and his beauty"
Ps 52:8: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God: I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.
Ps 128:3: Your wife will be as a fruitful vine by the sides of your house: your children like olive plants round about your table.

"his smell"
Ge 27:27: He came near: and kissed Him: and He smelled the smell of His clothing: and blessed Him: and said: See: the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which the LORD has blessed:
Song 4:11-15: Your lips: O my spouse: drop as the honeycomb: honey and milk are under your tongue; and the smell of your garments is like the smell of Lebanon.
2Co 2:14: 15: Now thanks be to God: which always causes us to triumph in Christ: and makes manifest the savour of His knowledge by us in every place.
Php 4:18: But I have all: and abound: I am full: having received of Epaphroditus the things which were sent from you: an odour of a sweet smell: a sacrifice acceptable: wellpleasing to God.

H7725יָשֻׁ֙בוּ֙yā-šu-ḇū   (V-Qal-Imperf-3mp)
H7725 שׁוּב shûwb shoob a primitive root; to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again; ((break, build, circumcise, dig, do anything, do evil, feed, lay down, lie down, lodge, make, rejoice, send, take, weep)) idiom again, (cause to) answer (phrase again), idiom in any case (wise), idiom at all, averse, bring (again, back, home again), call (to mind), carry again (back), cease, idiom certainly, come again (back), idiom consider, phrase continually, convert, deliver (again), phrase deny, draw back, fetch home again, idiom fro, get (oneself) (back) again, idiom give (again), go again (back, home), (go) out, hinder, let, (see) more, idiom needs, be past, idiom pay, pervert, pull in again, put (again, up again), recall, recompense, recover, refresh, relieve, render (again), requite, rescue, restore, retrieve, (cause to, make to) return, reverse, reward, phrase say nay, send back, set again, slide back, still, idiom surely, take back (off), (cause to, make to) turn (again, self again, away, back, back again, backward, from, off), withdraw. 		יָשֻׁ֙בוּ֙yā-šu-ḇū Shall return V-Qal-Imperf-3mp

7 They that dwell under his shadow will return; they will revive as the grain, and grow as the vine: the scent thereof will be as the wine of Lebanon.Hosea 14:7
Stats
Counts: 152 characters, 24 words, 118 letters, 40 vowels, 78 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יֵֽלְכוּ֙ יֹֽנְקֹותָ֔יו וִיהִ֥י כַזַּ֖יִת הֹודֹ֑ו וְרֵ֥יחַֽ לֹ֖ו כַּלְּבָנֹֽון׃

Lit: Shall return Those who dwell under his shadow they shall be revived like grain and grow like a vine Their scent shall be like the wine of Lebanon

KJV: They that dwell under his shadow shall return; they shall revive as the corn, and grow as the vine: the scent thereof [shall be] as the wine of Lebanon.
References

"that"
Ps 91:1: He who dwells in the secret place of the most High will abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
Song 2:3: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood: so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight: and his fruit was sweet to my taste.
Isa 32:1: 2: Look: a king will reign in righteousness: and princes will rule in judgment.

"revive"
Ho 6:2: After two days will he revive us: in the third day he will raise us up: and we will live in his sight.
Ps 85:6: Will you not revive us again: that your people may rejoice in you?
Ps 138:7: Though I walk in the middle of trouble: you will revive me: you will stretch forth your hand against the wrath of my enemies: and your right hand will save me.
Isa 61:11: For as the earth brings forth her bud: and as the garden causes the things that are sown in it to spring forth; so the Lord GOD will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.
Joh 11:25: Jesus said to her: I am the resurrection: and the life: He that'>He who believes in me: though He were dead: yet will He live:
Joh 12:24: Truly: truly: I say to you: Except a grain of wheat fall into the ground and die: it abides alone: but if it die: it brings forth much fruit.
1Co 15:36-38: You fool: that which you sow not is quickened: except it die:

"grow"
Ho 14:5: I will be as the dew to Israel: he will grow as the lily: and cast forth his roots as Lebanon.
Song 6:11: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley: and to see whether the vine flourished: and the pomegranates budded.
Zec 8:12: For the seed will be prosperous; the vine will give her fruit: and the ground will give her increase: and the heavens will give their dew; and I will cause the remnant of this people to possess all these things.

 יָשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ יֹשְׁבֵ֣י בְצִלֹּ֔ו יְחַיּ֥וּ דָגָ֖ן וְיִפְרְח֣וּ כַגָּ֑פֶן זִכְרֹ֖ו כְּיֵ֥ין לְבָנֹֽון׃ ס

H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! 8 Ephraim will say, What have I to do any more with idols? I have heard him, and observed him: I am like a green fir tree. From me is your fruit found.Hosea 14:8
Stats
Counts: 153 characters, 24 words, 112 letters, 45 vowels, 67 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יָשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ יֹשְׁבֵ֣י בְצִלֹּ֔ו יְחַיּ֥וּ דָגָ֖ן וְיִפְרְח֣וּ כַגָּ֑פֶן זִכְרֹ֖ו כְּיֵ֥ין לְבָנֹֽון׃ ס

Lit: Ephraim shall say what have I to do anymore with idols I have heard and observed him I am like a cypress tree Green in Me Your fruit is found

KJV: Ephraim shall say, What have I to do any more with idols? I have heard [him], and observed him: I [am] like a green fir tree. From me is thy fruit found.
References

"What"
Ho 14:2: 3: Take with you words: and turn to the LORD: say to Him: Take away all iniquity: and receive us graciously: so will we render the calves of our lips.
Job 34:32: That which I not see teach you me: if I have done iniquity: I will do no more.
Ac 19:18-20: Many that believed came: and confessed: and showed their deeds.
1Th 1:9: For they themselves show of us what manner of entering in we had to you: and how you turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God;
1Pe 1:14-16: As obedient children: not fashioning yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance:
1Pe 4:3: 4: For the time past of our life may suffice us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles: when we walked in lasciviousness: lusts: excess of wine: revellings: banquetings: and abominable idolatries:

"I have"
Job 33:27: He looks upon men: and if any say: I have sinned: and perverted that which was right: and it profited not me;
Jer 31:18-20: I have surely heard Ephraim bemoaning Himself thus; You have chastised me: and I was chastised: as a bullock unaccustomed to the yoke: turn you me: and I will be turned; for you are the LORD my God.
Lu 15:20: He arose: and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off: his father saw him: and had compassion: and ran: and fell on his neck: and kissed him.
Joh 1:47: 48: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him: and says of Him: Look an Israelite indeed: in whom is no guile!

"I am"
Isa 41:19: I will plant in the wilderness the cedar: the shittah tree: and the myrtle: and the oil tree; I will set in the desert the fir tree: and the pine: and the box tree together:
Isa 55:13: Instead of the thorn will come up the fir tree: and instead of the brier will come up the myrtle tree: and it will be to the LORD for a name: for an everlasting sign that will not be cut off.
Isa 60:13: The glory of Lebanon will come to you: the fir tree: the pine tree: and the box together: to beautify the place of my sanctuary; and I will make the place of my feet glorious.

"From me"
Joh 1:16: Of his fulness have all we received: and grace for grace.
Joh 15:1-8: I am the true vine: and my Father is the husbandman.
Ga 5:22: 23: But the fruit of the Spirit is love: joy: peace: longsuffering: gentleness: goodness: faith:
Eph 5:9: (For the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth;)
Php 1:11: Being filled with the fruits of righteousness: which are by Jesus Christ: to the glory and praise of God.
Php 2:13: For it is God which works in you both to will and to do of His good pleasure.
Php 4:13: I can do all things through Christ which strengthens me.
Jas 1:17: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above: and comes down from the Father of lights: with whom is no variableness: neither shadow of turning.
